text: Wow and I mean wow. Various dishes made from scratch just as well as their very own soy sauce! I am greatly impressed and by all means you will be too! This small Japanese tapas restaurant is more than meets the eyes!! Thank you Go for the introduction! I'm huge on sake and love to marinate with a few dishes. I will be back regularly!
Make sure to stop by this place if you're craving Japanese Tapas. You won't be disappointed. Try the Kara Age!

I went here fairly late at night. Everything was very flavorful and fresh but the service was a little slow. Regardless, the service wasn't terrible, and I will go back again because I have no complaints about the food or the menu.

Tried this place pretty late at night. We ordered a variety of different dishes. Nothing we had was great. The pork ramen was very flavorless. The kimchee fried rice was average. The beef carpaccio wasn't very good either. 

I would rate this restaurant less stars for food quality and taste. The only thing positive about this restaurant is that it's open very late, and the variety of dishes they offer is very big. Nothing was bad, nothing was great but the fair yet of dishes offered is good.

Loved it!  We were looking for good Japanese off the strip (way cheaper) and found this jem...  Great selection and quality!  The tapas menu format is a little confusing given that some things are not really to be shared ...  Some more guidance on the menu could prove beneficial to future guests....

Came here with my boys and thanks to the Yelp gods for directing me here.  

The service was good. 

Enjoyed the extensive late night HH and ate a lot of sushi. Very tasty and fresh.  The POKE roll was the best.
If you lookin for a place to chill and enjoy your time with good company this the place right here!

I'm not really a foodie, but had to write a review bc the food here is delicious.  We went starving after attending CES and ordered a ton of food.  Despite ordering many dishes, our bill was surprisingly cheap.   The house fried rice is amazing and the Bbq Korean ribs with greens was flavorful and seasoned just right.  Like I said, I'm not really a foodie but it was so good I'll be coming back to try the ramen burger before this Vegas trip is over. Service is excellent!
They took very long to serve me and my family, food was okay... portion size and price were bad as well. I would not come back here.
Amazing food, good portions, and a really nice environment. There is a lot of variety on the menu and although it may be overwhelming, in the end you will be full and happy

The food here is good and well priced. The happy hour has great deals but you can always score a deal off their ongoing specials. On my last visit I was really excited to order some yakitori skewers but I waited over an hour and had to ask if they were ready and hadn't been started yet. The restaurant was really busy so I understand but a heads up would be nice when something is going to take over an hour. The restaurant could've used another waitress. It's very small and tight space but it is always packed. Good prices and good food. Great for HH and drinks and tapas - as for a true dinner I'm not so sure.

They have a wide variety of food types to choose from. The flavors of the food are on point and worth experiencing.  I urge anyone to take the time to enjoy the warm welcoming ambiance as well as the delicious food.
Good quality great prices and nice atmosphere. Reminds me a lot of places I have been in Japan, LA, and NYC.  Most recommendable off the the Strip and family friendly to boot!

Super yummy! I love the whole design of the restaurant and the little details they put into the place. 

Service was excellent. My server was patient, friendly and knew her food. The food choices we chose were delicious and flavorful as well. 

The portions are more than your average Japanese tapas restaurant so me and my boyfriend were full and satisfied after ordering a few dishes. 

I would love to come back and try their other menu items.

I ordered a certain way and it was not correct when I got it. There was not broth with my noodles as I asked for it. The dynamite is not "dynamite" it's the opposite in fact, I felt like I was eating scallops out of a pool of melted mayo. When the broth for my dry fried noodles came he also brought my ice cream knowing I'm clearly not done eating as he just brought the other half of one of my dishes. My boyfriend eventually asked him if he could keep it cold somehow while I am still eating. To top it all off a bug crawled on my leg while eating.

Never try their sushi roll. I went their late night and the sushi roll was so so bad. Worst in my life ever. Everything else was fine like 3 star but the sushi roll makes me give them one star. I hope the chef who made it is not a main chef.
Amazing selection of food. Everything was incredibly tasty, filling, and surprisingly cheap, all things considered. Will definitely be returning.

Izakaya Go is exactly what I was looking for to escape the strip scene. Go and his staff are super friendly and they make an out of towner like me feel at home. The menu is amazing and the sushi (not always something you find at an izakaya ) was great. Loved the sake selection too. Met some other sake lovers at the bar and we ended up partying all night. I will be back here every time I am in town!

The first time we ate here months ago the service was awful but the food was so good we decided to give it another try. The server that gave us issues is no longer there but the food has remained consistently good. The fish for sashimi is always fresh. The crunchy pork belly is spot on. The izakaya go fried rice has that umami flavor going for it. Even the vegetables are good (garlic spinach and the eggplant with miso).

This is one of my favorite restaurant in Vegas!  I probably come here at least once a week or more.  They have the most extensive menu.  Love Poke Chips, Fried Pork Belly, Shishito Peppers and Shoyu Ramen Spicy is to die for... Try it, you won't be disappointed..... And the service is exceptional.

This is by far one of my fav Izagaya on my book, and i am from LA, i have tried many places .One of the reason is their menu is very unique,other than the usual stuff that everybody have, they have something unusal like sashimi halibut fin, stirfly gizzer with garic leek,and some fish intestines that i never eat before and many other dishes.You just have to try it yourself.They also have late happy hour from 9.00pm to 12.00, the drinks are very reasonable.Every time i come to LV i at least come to this place once.Hope you guys keep up.
Good food. Good service. We enjoyed our lunch of 8 people in the group. I liked the Ramen and beef teriyaki.

It is very beautiful Japanese restaurant. The decoration reminds me while I was in Japan.  The food is delicious . I like that salmon sushi. It is very fresh. we also ordered the set my boyfriend like that beef set very much. The waitress is very polite. I like it. I will go back again. I would recommend this restaurant to friends also.

This is one of the few places that is actually ran by people that speak and can cook a decent Japanese meal. The fish is very fresh and they have real Wasabi, not the fake tube crap they all other places serve. So when you mix it in, hold on to your taste buds. The ramen is also a nice treat. The service is very prompt and highly friendly. The only thing that I am sure will be fixed shortly is that they don't have their liquor license. Otherwise I would give them 5 stars. I do miss my sake.

I was pleasantly surprised with the food here.
Don't let anybody tell you about it.,it's worth to try and see for yourself.

***DO NOT COME HERE. IT'S NOT SANITARY***

I hate writing bad reviews but this one was a must. Found this place on Yelp and wanted a change from the food on the Strip. First of all, parking was terrible. It's in a little strip mall with limited parking as all the competing storefronts were vying for the same spots. When we walked up to the restaurant, we weren't sure if it was even opened because the storefront was so dark. Upon entering, it didn't look too busy and we were quickly seated in the booth. 

Let me start of with I love izakayas. I've been to many in New York City and always had wonderful experiences. Japanese tapas-styled restaurants that let you try a little bit of everything and provides for a casual and comfortable dining experience, what more can you want? Having said that, I really wanted to like this place due to all the glowing reviews it had.

The menu was very vast as expected with a regular menu and a board with the specials for the day. I came with my family so we for our appetizers, we ordered a rainbow roll, a salmon avocado (Alaskan) roll, sashimi platter (3 kinds of fish), takoyaki, and beef tataki to be split amongst the four of us. For entrees, we got the shoyu ramen, kake udon, and yakisoba, and poke salad. 

The octopus in the takoyaki was a little cold but nonetheless it wasn't bad. The batter was nice and light and the sauce and dried bonito shavings were good. None of the fish for the sushi and the sashimi seemed fresh at all. The beef tataki was forgettable. Now onto the entrees, the portion sizes seemed a little smaller than I'm used to but that's fine because we did have a lot of appetizers to fill our bellys. The broth was ok but wasn't super rich with flavor. A little on the bland side. But right as my mom started eating her kake udon, she but into something crunchy in the spinach. She split it out to see what it was and it was a aphid in her spinach! She didn't want to make a scene so she just pushed it away and stopped eating it. But one of the employees came and wanted to see what was going on. We told them what happened and showed them the bug and they just stood there staring back at us. Then the waiter brought over another waiter to examine and they both stood there as if they were unsure of what they are looking at and walked away. Even if you aren't sure, good customer service is to try to correct your mistake. Not that we wanted it but to offer to make my mom a new one or take it off our bill would be the right thing to do! It's the thought that counts instead of standing there gawking at us and not doing anything. It just ruined the meal. Even with the terrible service, we still decided to give the 15% standard tip, which I believe they definitely did not deserve. I know how hard it is for waiters to earn money but still their behavior was unacceptable. 

Food was less than great here but still it didn't warrant a one star rating until my mom found that bug in her food. If there was better customer service to fix the situation than that would have helped but the service here is inexcusable. They need to clean their vegetables better. If my mom found this, I wonder how many other things they have done that were unsanitary that went unnoticed. AGAIN I REPEAT DO NOT COME HERE. I don't understand how it got such a high rating.
Food was excellent.  Services was great.  Small little place that I'd absolutely return for.  What else is there to say?
Love it here. Foods on the cheaper side but super fresh!! Cant ask for much more! Will be back when I come back! Super friendly service as well!!

Just found my new favorite Japanese restaurant!

In Vegas there's so many  so called Japanese restaurants and their main attraction is sushi, not Izakaya Go. There's so much selection, that I'll definitely be going back and back again to try them all! 

Salmon and Tuna Sashimi: One word. FRESH! Presentation is on point too.

Kara Age: fried chicken here is delicious! Cooked perfectly.

White fish tempura: Japanese friend of mine recommended it to me. If I was by myself I would have never ordered it. So good, the fish is so light and fluffy. My favorite so far.

Beef carpaccio: it is slightly cooked, not entirely raw. This too is delicious, the slight crunch gives it so much texture that you have to have more.

Enoki with butter: another dish that was recommended to me by my friend. And am glad I tried it. I've never had enoki before, it does have the mushroom consistency we all know, but it is a bit chewier than I expected. The richness of the butter and the chewiness of the enoki go hand in hand.

Yaki Soba: by the time the dish came I was so full from all the rest! The noodles were cooked great, and has nice flavors.

Black sesame mochi: I've never had black sesame flavored mochi before and had to try. It was delicious! It was sweet with little sesame seeds inside. I loved it.

Presentation: all the foods are pretty to look at. The beef carpaccio looked like a work of art! The chef makes sure it looks good, as well as taste good.

Service: service is excellent. If one of my waitresses was busy with someone, another waitress made sure we were ok. Drinks were constantly refilled, and our waitress' sometimes stayed and chit chatted. 

Chef: I spoke with the owner and he said their chef has 10 years experience in Kyoto! This food here is as authentic as they come!
The food is very good. The waiters are very friendly and they will explain the menu. They have many things in their menu, the presentation is good and it looks very authentic.
been here a few times... And every time it taste good.. The owner Go is very nice... They serve fresh unique fish... Would highly recommend this place

We went there for a late dinner during our vacation in Vegas. We were lucky to find this place. It's not too far from the strip and the neighborhood was ok too.
The service was excellent. The waiters were very polite and thoughtful. The food was excellent, authentic and priced right. We got to try different new dishes and we all loved them: spicy tuna cracker, octopus ball, cawanmushi, house fried rice, grilled tuna belly, and crispy pork belly. I recommend them all.
We will be visiting this place again whenever we visit Vegas.

More times than I can count, I have refrained from writing a review about a new restaurant.  I have friends in the food industry & know just how much hard work the owners, managers, and staff put in, not to mention the huge financial investment.  But after reading John Curtas's multiple articles singing the praises of Izakaya Go, I don't feel bad about writing a bad review.  After all, Eating Las Vegas has, by orders of magnitude, a lot more juice in this town than one little old Yelper.  So, in an attempt to add an eensy weensy bit of balance ...

I had such high hopes after reading how great this place was on Eating LV.  I love Japanese food, and I-Go had some very interesting menu items you don't see elsewhere.  After I put in my initial order for crispy pork belly and uni dumplings, the server asked if I had been to the restaurant before because I knew what the best items were.  Oh boy, this should be good!  Except it wasn't.  The uni dumplings didn't taste like uni, or much like anything really.  You could see little specks of uni mixed in with a lot of white flavorless filler in the dumplings.  I tried adding a little soy sauce, then some spicy mustard, hoping to get a flavor boost, but nada.  The crispy pork belly was just not good, not awful, but nothing I would ever order again.  It also suffered from "seasoning glop," that is, the kitchen seemed to like adding a big glop of salt & pepper on most of the dishes right before sending them out.  I'd prefer that the seasoning be cooked in instead of glopped on top.  Then I got the "house specialty," kara age (fried boneless chicken thighs).  Even though it was the house specialty, I've had far better kara age elsewhere (Yonaka and Izakaya Cocokala spring to mind), plus there was that annoying glop of salt & pepper again.  Now my favorite, unagi.  I love freshwater eel, and not that many places serve it as a main course, usually just as sushi.  The serving of eel was a very thin fillet, and the delicate sweetness of the eel was spoiled by - you guessed it - a big glop of salt & pepper.  The only really good part of the meal was dessert, a $2.50 bowl of pretty good vanilla ice cream with two decent-sized scoops.

I don't know why there was such a big difference in my experience at Izakaya Go and John Curtas's multiple visits.  All I can guess is that maybe the head chef prepared everything when EatingLV dined whereas my meal was prepared by some staffers who don't quite yet have the hang of it (the place hasn't been open long).  Who knows?  Anyway, there are several Izakayas in Las Vegas, with new ones seeming to pop up all the time.  I won't be returning to Izakaya Go.
Great tuna steak & the marinated miso salmon bowl were great! Bathroom clean, but service was slow despite going at 5PM and not being busy.

This place is amazing!!! I can't stop eating here. They got the best pickles. Great rolls and the curry with the fried chicken hit the spot perfectly. The curry soup was also really good the curry isn't over powering like in other places. Had the green tea and vanilla ice cream for dessert both were good.

Second time came here, all waitress service so bad,  we sit down like 10 minutes they didn't even ask for drink even we already took the order! And never clean the table ! This restaurant the food is not so good already , plus the waitress this kind the attitude! Will never come back here again!

Yo!! "Ichiban" (numero uno, haha) was my first impression!!

Why?!?!?  Because there was Japanese staff and cooks, plus Japanese people eating there, so I told myself "self, Let's do this! 

I sat at the bar & the table next to me just got served a grilled saba (mackerel) dinner. Told waitress I want that and then the dude next to me was "choppin" in this frickin badass Ramen that look awesome (I'll try it tomorrow) but his fried rice look scrumptious so I ordered that too!! 
Food came out perfectly just in time to finish this report and "MOP-UP" this great ONO-Oishi" Japanese grinds. 

"Mahalo-Gosaimas"

I really like and gave it 5 chop sticks!!

My dad was trained to be a chef the old school way in Tokyo shortly after WW2, and I grew up eating his food so I know what I'm saying when I say that eating here is like actually eating in a legit Izakaya in Japan. You'd be surprised how many of places like these aren't actually run by Japanese people, and those that are try to be way too fancy and high end and charge an outrageous amount for the fish. This place is reasonably priced, and the menu reminds me of the days in Osaka drinking and eating and having a grand ol time with my cousins. The menu goes from sashimi to ramen to yakitori, but whatever you choose it's good ol fashioned Japanese food the way it was supposed to be made.

This is not a sushi restaurant. Forget rolls, tempura and pickled ginger. Order the worst sounding things, get out of your comfort zone, and you won't be disappointed. Fantastic food, fantastic staff, and fantastic atmosphere. They have great drinks too.

Coming from San Diego and Portland I've been disappointed with the sushi at every place in Las Vegas. This is the first time I want disappointed. The salmon was fantastic. The chutoro was good although slightly fishy. I can highly recommend the yakitori. The fatty chicken hearts were amazing. They tasted like liver, but with a slightly different texture. And then the okonomiyaki was perfect as a finale to the meal. It was delicious. Beyond delicious.
Excellent service.  Extensive menu with wide selection.  Happy Hour Late night!  Staff in kitchen do their job---no monkey business. Owner knows what he is doing. Best in Vegas!
Great place great service! 10/10 recommend! Food was delicious with a large variety to choose from.
Very good and fresh fish, must order - special while fish. They will deep fry the bone after you finish the sashimi. Yakitori is great too. Chicken gizzard, chicken soft bone etc

Few meals more memorable in Vegas! Everything here was delicious and tasted very fresh. The happy hour is a great value and I left very full on just $22 worth of a wonderful variety of Japanese dishes like tonkotsu ramen, dumplings, salmon tartar, and tuna belly steak. Very impressed and will definitely recommend this place to friends visiting Vegas in the future!

I lovee this place. It was my first time here a few weeks ago and I still can't get over it . I'm from OC, CA. The food here is DELICIOUS and their seafood is FRESH. Our waitress was very nice and attentive. Their service is superb. She recommended a sake drink, my friend and I couldn't be happier on agreeing w her. I really like their uni pasta. They are not cheap on their uni. You see the uni everywhere in the pasta. We also ordered some sort of fish sashimi and it wasn't bad ! I hate the fishy smell, but it sure didn't have any fishy smell. I would definitely come back here again.

Very tasty food located close to the strip. Fish was very fresh and udon noodles perfectly cooked. Ramen could have been a little softer but overall it was great. Restaurant is very unassuming and the booths offer a great private space to eat. 
Great experience.

Love this place.  Been here many times in the last 2 years and it's one of my fave izakaya place in town.  Smaller venue compares to some others, but it gives you almost better service in a way because it's easier to manage.  The servers are always friendly and helpful.  The robata items are flavorful.  The menus are very extensive... it's a bit overwhelming at times because they literally give you like 4 or 5 menus with daily specials, special seafood, menus after menus.  Most of the things I have there are good.  The only thing I am sad that they've taken off the menu was the white fish tempura.  I think it'a halibut they used and wrapped in shiso leaves with the light tempura batter... too bad it's no longer the menu.  Their ikamaru (grilled whole squid) is not my favorite item from there.  Seemed like they poached the squid first then grilled it..or something, the texture isn't as bouncy as it should be.. or maybe just frozen squid and thawed out.. something isn't that right.  But other items are all very solid.  I wouldn't go for sushi burrito there either... 

Even with a few minor things I don't particularly like there, still my go to izakaya place and easy access in the complex.  Highly recommend this place.  The chicken wings, the chilean sea bass, the beef, hokkaido scallops are my favorite skewers there.  

They do have one big tatami table for larger group party.

We found this place while looking for a sushi restaurant that is open until 3 AM. The food was amazing!!! It is very authentic Japanese and they had a late night happy hour. It is a small restaurant but quite cozy and the staff were very professional and friendly. The menu is extensive and the prices are fair. The sushi rolls were good but they really specialize in Japanese dishes. If I lived in Vegas I would be here all the time.

always always amazing food and amazing service. Yuzu chuhai was the best drink I've ever had in long time. One of my favorite place in LV. A Korean girl who can speak Japanese was a server. She was super friendly and brought us food right away. Thank You and thanks to Izakaya go for a great time and food! i will be there soon!

So we went here because we were in Chinatown looking for supper.  Trusted my Yelpers and went here for Izakaya.   Sadly, we ordered items that we weren't to our liking...the only dish we really enjoyed was the poke, takoyaki, and the chicken skin yakitori.  What wasn't didn't taste great were the uni dumplings (a weird paste filling), and pretty much all the yakitori.  All the yakitori needed salt, and all needed a bit more char.   The menu is huge, so maybe we ordered the wrong things, I'd like to think if we gave it another shot, it might be better.  In the end, for 4 of us with 2 pitchers, the bill was $250.00, definitely pricey for what we ate.
Really good place, fresh sashimi, great girls, love the agedashi mocha and pumpkin croquettes! Better make reservations ahead of time, will be back!

Good just not great. This is my second time here since I'm a fan of the close location to the strip and relative proximity to the heart of Chinatown 
We were seated within 5 mins and our terrible service began. I had to constantly wave her down throughout the night. 

They are basically a neo American Japanese fusion place local influences of Mexican and Korean cuisine as well. It is quite well thought out and they have an amazing bar and selection of sake. My main complain is the portion size here is ridiculously small!! It is "tapas" style jap dishes almost and number of dishes such as their grilled fish does not even come with anything else like a bowl of rice or soup. All of us had to order basically 2 or even 3 items to get a decent meal. Overall decent but since there is so much competition close by, this is probably my last time here
I was craving ramen late night and decided to try this place out. The miso ramen was delicious, I'll def be back to try some rolls!

Came in at around 1:30 AM. Got seated right away. Server greeted as as soon as we got seated & took our orders. Great atmosphere & decor was great. As for the food, I would have to say it was superb! Got baked mussels for appetizers & it was the fresh! Also got a beef yakisoba & tonkatsu dinner plate. Wasn't expecting the dinner plate to have so many side dishes. Definitely recommend!

Wonderful solo dinner here! Great ambiance, delicious food, small place, excellent service. I had miso soup, halibut roll, & grilled asparagus & okra. All excellent! Arriving in Vegas for a work conference & feeling totally overwhelmed, this is exactly what I needed.

This place had fantastic "melt in your mouth" tuna sashimi... The slices of sashimi could be cut a little thinner.    I had a delicious salad. They have clams, in a broth, that is amazing. We ordered about 14 items off the menu and it was all delicious. The portions are a nice size for tapas. The decor was very elegant. I enjoyed my experience at Izakaya Go.  Let's get Lil Soya in Izakaya Go!!
Happy Hour is a go!!!!! Yummy yummy in my tummy!!!! Curry is so good! Poki is awesome!

After switching from ICHIZA, to IZAKAYA GO, this place is completely awesome!!! Their happy hour are running from late night. You can get a regular ramen size for just $5 and many more apps and izakaya! Services are excellent like really! Unlike Ichiza where you have to wave and look for your server to take a freaking order! This place deserves more stars and please give them a try.

Our experience was wonderful the food was excellent as well as interesting and the service started if really good but deteriorated as they got busy. Reservation is highly recommended because it is a small place.
Excellent low key and inexpensive restaurant away from the strip. Large menu with usual and unusual dishes. The fish was very fresh. Highly recommend!
This is my new favorite spot to eat at! This place never lets me down. Love their bento box.. And their drinks are good too!

I thought I was making reservations for a different restaurant and completely stumbled on Izakaya Go (IG). The cooked dishes were a tasty surprise. While I will avoid the sushi and sashimi in the future, I will definitely add this place to my rotation.

HOT DISHES
Gindara (black cod)
Hamachi Kama (yellow tail collar)
Spinach with garlic
Asparagus with bacon
Agedashi Tofu
Onigiri (with bonito flakes)

Cold Dishes
Halibut sashimi
Tuna sashimi
Mochi

I can't say how authentic the asparagus and spinach are, but I can say that they are seasoned well, greasy (in the best way), and delicious. The hamachi Kama was the standout dish of the meal. So often I've ordered this dish from other establishemnts and found the fish collar is overcooked, not properly crisped, or the piece of fish is naturally thin and lacking in enough fat or flavor. The collar here was thick and cooked very well. it's such a simple and comforting dish that I cannot help but base my impression largely on my experience with this piece of fish. I am always seeking a good piece of fish treated well.

We raved about our hot dishes, but the table was silent when we ate the sashimi. The tuna pieces were cut way too thick and there was chewy/difficult gristle in each piece that made for an unappetizing bite. Since the raw fish was only a small portion of our meal, it did not sully our experience. 

In total, I had ZERO expectations when we walked in the door. And I left pleased with the service and each of the cooked dishes. I really like this place--its vibe, the hot dishes, and the location. While I hit some bumps in my meal, there is so much more on the menu I want to try. Based on my first experience, I am absolutely going to come back.

Food was good but customer service needs a lot of work. We asked the waiter about our food because we were waiting for over an hour and his response was "asking when your food is going to come out won't speed things up." He was being very rude. He also looked drunk. So I guess that's also very unprofessional. Overall had a very awkward experience here.
This place gets rather busy in the evenings. It's no wonder, food is good. So busy, in fact that they forgot my sushi burrito. I drank in the interim. We hung out at the bar and dined.

I went this place with my best friend and we ordered Tako wasabi, Beef tataki, Tanuki Udon and, Tonkatsu go combo and shared.
Every single plate was Awesomely Delicious (even all of tiny dishes came with combo) !!Plus price was very reasonable. 
service was nice and not too slow despite how packed the place was. 
I'm glad I found this place and definitely gonna go back again if I ever visit Vegas again.
Good decent sushi at a good value.... there spicy tuna actually taste pretty good. Though they don't have a wide selection on the types of sushi, it'll be a go to spot for me when I return.

If you go here to have drinks and tapas, you will probably have a good time.  We had done our drinking already and just wanted some tapas.  The seasonings, broths, and sauces were all a bit watered down and our chicken was a bit under-cooked.  The service was very busy serving drinks, which, after all is the main idea here.  So, if you are coming here to party, you will probably have a great time; if you are coming here to eat then you might be disappointed.
On the plus side, they are open very, very late and parking is okay.

I checked out the review on Yelp, this is one of the best Japanese restaurant that I have eaten at in Las Vegas.  Our party came later in the evening hence some of the fresh fish for sashimi were sold out, we were disappointed on that, we'll have to come earlier next time to try them.  Other than that all of the other items we ordered were absolutely fantastic, so fresh and melt in your mouth yummy and delicious.  The sea urchin were sooo sweet, we loved them.  This will definitely our go to next time we visit Las Vegas.  Keep on rolling out those delicious sushi!!! .  

I highly recommend this restaurant to all the food snobs out there!

Holy crap i found a new go to for japanese food. The chef/owner is awesome. He came to our table and personally took our order and helped us to make our choices. From the homemade soy sauce, to the crispy pork belly, the amazing chef's choice sashimi platter (including Toro!), Takoyaki cooked perfectly, Tempura squid legs, Nabeyaki Udon, and Zaru Soba. This is the best Japanese food you will find in Vegas. Don't  forget the chef and owner go to the fishmonger daily to hand select the fish!
The issue i always have in here is the restroom , please fix the toilet. it's always no pressure on the flush omg, i have to wait forever to have the water running back up again.

I've been to many Izakaya resturants in America, but the new Izakaya Go tops them all.  

The atmosphere here is very nice and chill.  Not too loud like most Izakaya resturants but just right.  The design of the resturant is very Japanese so for those who love Japanese culture will want to experience this.  

The food here is amazing!  A couple friends and I almost ordered the entire menu.  Even though there are so many great choices on the menu I recommend the Tuna Belly.  It was just amazing.  It might be seasonal so get it soon!!

Definetely coming back when I come to Vegas.

First time last night. I was craving for Japanese food, found this gem in Chinatown.  Great food and very friendly staff.  I drove by a few times last year and they were still closed. Finally opened last December. Will be back for more.

Great service, great food. Music was interesting, but good atmosphere. Really glad we found this spot. Had the California and Philadelphia rolls both were good and the miso soup was delicious, I've missed good miso soup.

Came here hungry after our drive in. Lots of Japanese patrons so you know this place is legit. Call ahead for reservations because this is a small restaurant with only a handful of tables. Ordered the yellowtail collar, poke salad, yakisoba, eel tempura, and Japanese pancake. Everything came out great. Our favorite was the poke salad and yakisoba.
I needed a late night place to eat in Vegas and I found a spot! It is a very delicious Japanese restaurant 5 minutes away from the strip. The beer and food was super delicious! You have to try it!

Had to peep this spot out, excellent experience. 
Fairly small spot but the menu is authentic and on point! 
So much selection of lots of good, old fashion true
 ??? (Izakaya) style drinks and food. 
Definitely will be back and highly recommended to Japanese bar food lovers!

This place was great! HUGE food and drinks menu. It's a really nice cozy little place. We got there about 1am with that being said , I hate walking into a place that's about to close but it was the only thing open aside fast food. The servers were great about taking us in! I appreciated that so much!! Food was delicious! Definitely will come again

omg. every single food was tooooooooooo salty n not fresh. 
we ordered many dishes n we dont like any of them. 

poke was too fishely n we returned it. dynamite was too salty n we also returend it. we ordered some sashimi and it was not fresh as well. 

only good thing was service. one korean girl served our table most of time. she was super nice and good. 

i wish they upgrade their food. Food in Ichiza is much better for me.

Must go if you're in vegas. Minutes from the strip. Food is amazing selection is unbeatable and prices are beyond reasonable. We came here twice during our 5 day vegas vacation!  They also have happy hour from 10pm to closing 2am if you're looking for late night drinks away from all the glitz and glitter.

In the Top 3 Ramen place I've ever been to.  Wish this place in my home town. Shoyo Ramen was perfect spice level. Broth was flavorful and noodles were great.   Would return everytime I come back. Recommend to call in for reservations

After reading some Yelp reviews we came here for an early dinner on Valentine's day and thank goodness it wasn't busy yet and got a table. Overall I liked this place; I want to go back and recommend it to friends. The atmosphere is very welcoming and service was attentive. We had their craft beers, trout sashimi, uni, octopus takoyaki, salmon rice and mackerel.

Yay! I think I found another decent spot.  Open late, good food, happy hour, good & quick service all in one. 

The only downfall is that I wish it was closer to my house.

I came in for a quick late nite bite after my 12 hour shift and 4 hour ER visit.  I was hungry and tired and had no room for patience. 

Izakaya satisfied my hunger and made my night. I was seated as I walked in. The waiter, Travis, was very accommodating to my needs. I ordered the shoyu ramen and spicy tuna. Ramen came out in 5 mins. Spicy tuna came in 10mins.  Thank you Izakaya!!

I love sushi and was craving for a place to go as soon as I got into Vegas. We arrived later and was able to find something that was open late on a Sunday night. 
The ambiance was small intimate with great music. 
The staff were friendly and helpful with recommendations. We saw pictures that other people posted on yelp and was very pleased! 
The food was amazing and everything we ordered came fresh with hardly any wait time!
The price was very reasonable considering it was sushi. I wish we were able to try everything!
This is where I take my girlfriend every time I piss her off. She forgives me every time. That's how you know this place is good. It's so good it fixes relationships.

Slowly becoming one of my favorite izakaya restaurants in Vegas. I love their specials menu and their grilled skewers. I pretty much just order everything off their specials menu as I haven't found a dish I was disappointed in. Their truffle butter corn with cheese is delicious, the tuna steak is grilled to perfection, and their skewers are deliciously fresh off the grill. The restaurant is a bit small, so there can sometimes be a little bit of a wait. Other than that, I recommend giving this place a try!

I can not wait to come back to this place - I want to sit here for hours and just keep ordering plates! 

I had the fortune of coming here with a Japanese friend and everything she ordered was delicious. One of the dishes was so delicious I ordered a second one... miso glazed eggplant. 

This place is best described as Japanese street food - or small plates/tappas. 

The sushi was fresh and well done - not an absurd about of rice paired with it. The sashimi salad was on point in every way. 

There were a couple of dishes I wouldn't rush to order again; their flavor just didn't compare to their other dishes. One of the dishes was chicken breast with plum, it just lacked flavor.

So the gf and i decided to give this place another try, since our first visit a few days ago was subpar. It wasn't that we had shitty service or the food wasn't good the first time, it's just we never got all the items we ordered... 

I must say tho we are glad we came back. We got everything we ordered this time and all the food was excellent. The service was great our server Khiet was really nice and made sure everything was going well... The other two guys that took our other half of our order and checked in on us where awesome aswell... 

We ordered the grilled pork cheek with gingered scallions, that was really good!!! Definitely a Must order!! Another dish I really like here is the Garlic squid fried rice, imo it's a must try aswell!!!

We also got the standard Truffle edamame, spicy and California cut rolls. Half ramen with spicy miso, and a bunch of yakitori items... 

The happy hour that starts at 10pm is great and I highly recommend giving this place a try!!!

This is an awesome Japanese spot for whatever it is that you're looking for. Authentic with a slight modern take, incorporating Italian flare (talk about that in a sec). Ramen, udon, sushi, or yakitori? They've got it all, and at very reasonable prices. Food taste fresh and decor adds a nice authentic ambiance. Music doesn't seem to fit the style but it's good music (reggae). I was actually drawn to this spot because of their sea urchin pasta dish, and wow, it was bomb. Creamy with a hint of the uni in each bite and a hint of saltiness from the shiso leaves and white sauce. The Alfredo pasta was on point. Can't wait to come back the next time we're in Vegas. Lastly, staff was super courteous and friendly. Home run stop to eat at.

By now I would call myself a regular at Izakaya Go! So let me tell you a little bit about one of Vegas's best Japanese Restaurants.

First off the staff at this location are incredible and provide excellent customer service. 

Now on to what you really came to read about and that's the food. Izakaya Go is REAL Japanese food not AYCE sushi ran by non-Japanese workers. I recommend going during Happy Hour (10-close) not only are drink prices great but you can try a wide assortment of their normal menu items for a fraction of the cost.  

Thank you Izakya Go for all that you do in food and in service !

Great quality of seafood and variety of fish sashimi! The place is very casual and friendly, perfect to grab late night tapas or dinner. The place is usually packed but the wait is short! It is a must go when in town!

Great late night and decent service for a restaurant that constantly has so much foot traffic. But for a restaurant that offers so much menu-wise, it would be a lot more inviting if the interior itself didn't feel like the inside of cramped soccer van. 

Our group of four felt like we involuntarily became best friends with the group behind us with all of movement that happened during our meal between the servers and the diners.

With that being said, I love a good squid so I would recommend their yakitori just maybe for carry out instead.

Solid izakaya place. Good taste, reasonable prices, friendly service. Didn't have reservations at 8 on a Friday but still was seated within 10, 15 minutes. Recommend and would return.

Stand-out dishes for me: clams in butter, chawan mushi, fried rice (omg just what I was craving!), kara age. Shoot even a plain California roll is great here! All skewers were good especially chicken meatball, pork belly, and items wrapped in bacon. Wasn't too happy with the goma ae (too sweet) and that some of the salads felt too sugary from the dressing.
This is my favorite sushi spot in Las Vegas and it's always on my agenda when I'm there.  Try the whole fish sashimi.  It's the coolest presentation ever!

Great happy hour menu. 
My favorite go to spot for a late night bite. I live for their soft shell crab! 
Also, the free green tea cream you get when you check in tops it off

This establishment serves authentic Japanese tapas at a an affordable price. Their 10pm-closing happy hour specials (sushi rolls, grilled mushrooms, fried tuna belly, etc.) are all under $5. There is normal seating as well as a bar area, so this location is perfect for an intimate date as well as night out with a group of friends.
On top of that their music selection is perfect which really ties the atmosphere together. Most of the music that is played is dub reggae and lovers rock. I will definitely be returning very soon to get my fill of authentic Japanese food at an amazing price. 

The only downside that I can think of  is that sometimes parking can be tight, but that is not the fault of the restaurant .

Came here twice. Had the yakisoba and takoyaki (fried octopus balls). It was good. The prices are good too and they're open till 2 am if you're hungry late at night. It's just a few minutes off the strip. This will be our go to place when we visit Vegas again.

I had a great time. 

Daikon salad, shishamo fish, tako wasabi, softshell crab and more. The service was great. When a mistake was made, they were quick to apologize and always thoughtful. 

The only advice to the business, you shouldn't spread out the timing of the food delivery.  We were finishing everything and two more plates were nowhere to be seen.  I would be hesitant to order several plates for this very reason. Keep them all coming.

Went for an izakaya experience in the fall. Didn't end up writing a review until now. Honestly, it's exactly what you'd expect: great food and great service.

The server that served us, though lacking in energy a bit, provided us with a lot of time to decide and was caring. He made sure we were comfortable.

My friend ordered the ramen, which I thought was okay. I ordered the chazuke because I was craving umeboshi, rice, and different flavors. Very light, very distinct umami. The umeboshi was a nice addition to the dish: slightly pungent and very refreshing. We also had the otoro sashimi. I didn't get the melt in your mouth feeling I usually get, but it tasted pretty good.

Overall, nice dining experience, very comfortable and a nice addition to the Las Vegas scene.

I was searching for a new restaurant and found this! I can't be more than happier. Now I have a new go to Japanese place. This is a great Japanese restaurant.

First we walked in and saw only Japanese people in the restaurant. We are the only non Japanese in the place. After seeing that we initially thought this must be a great Japanese restaurant. We sat down and saw grilled squid on the table right next to us and they said it is really good especially when it's a bit burned. Lo and behold we ordered that and mentioned to be a bit burned. Came out and it's so delicious! We got the Omakase as well and its also delicious. However we ordered the uni pasta and we were surprised as it was not the same as the one we saw in the pictures. The pasta is so creamy and yes delicious so if you are on a diet this dish is not the choice. We just want to try it and taste what an uni pasta taste like.... it's  delicious. Try it. 

We also got a free ice cream just by checking in Yelp! That's very nice nice! We ordered 2 bottles of sake! It was just the right sake taste we were looking for, not so fruity and sweet and yet not so dry as well. Just perfect! I will definitely come back again in this place! It is now one my favorite Japanese restaurant here!

Great new spot to eat. The food was great, especially for just opening and changing things. The staff is very friendly and attentive. I met the owner on accident, and he is a very nice guy that started while still working full time. Great place to eat and support!! It will be fun to see it grow and progress.

Here for a late dinner. Service very fast. Food very authentic and tastes good. Price reasonable for this kind of restaurant. Order a variety of different things.
Heaven: pork belly! That's why some people ordered just pork belly I guess...
Good: Ginara (miso cod), beef tongue, miso ramen (not spicy), salmon sashimi
OK: takoyaki, chicken heart, chicken gizzard, chicken with scallion
Don't like: spicy chicken wing (don't like the gross Korean like sauce layer), scallop (don't like the taste of the rim, it's like you are eating the wrong part...)
Definitely try the pork belly and beef tongue! They were great!

After I read some of the reviews of this restaurant,  I figured why not give it a try? Best decision ever! Others are right. This place is a hidden gem.

I ordered  Ten Zaru soba w/ Tempura, karage, agedashi tofu, super go crunch burrito and unagi bowl.  Every item were tremendous and flavorful. I was so suprised to find  a good Japanese restaurant in Vegas. The price was very cheap :)

I would come back in the future !

I almost don't want to write a review, for fear that it will get super busy and then I won't be able to get a table! Haha! This place was GREAT! The owner/chef/manager blew us away with his friendly and attentive service. They had a surprising array of fresh fish flown in daily, some rare and tasty choices! Most amazing of all, is the price! It was VERY reasonable. Overall, it was great!
A good place to go if you want some small plate food. I ordered a lot skewers cause I love BBQ. Happy hour is after 10pm which is a better deal.

Some of the best food I've had ever.  Great experience to boot.  I tried things I've never had before.  It's a daring street food inspired restaurant with excellent cuts of fresh fish.  Couple that with laid back music; reggae when I was there and you need go nowhere else.

We went off the strip for dinner. It was really good. I didn't even know that there is a "chinatown" in Vegas. We were a group of 6 and checked all in to the restaurant, so we got free ice cream as a dessert. Unfortunately they only had green tea and vanilla. how about chocolate too? We will come back!

Great value! Coming from the Bay Area, we expected to pay $12-$14 for one bowl of ramen, but the ramen options don't exceed $9 here! 

In fact, everything here is quite decently priced, especially for the great quality of the food.

We started off with drinks--my friend ordered a glass of draft Sapporo, and I ordered a two-shot chuhai cocktail...and mine was only $6!!

Next we decided to try an appetizer we've never had before, and the first of those on the list was the Yamasen. The server asked us if we were sure we wanted it, and at first we were a little insulted because we thought it was just because we are white.

Turns out that yamasen is...unique. If you've never had it before, it's basically shreds of yam and nori in this cold, salty, thick, mucous-y liquid. I don't know the technical terms, but if that doesn't sound appealing to you, do NOT order it. I could only have a few bites, but my friend liked it so she drank the rest.

My friend ordered the spicy shoyu ramen, and I ordered the miso ramen with less spice. All of their ramen options offer custom spice levels, so that's a bonus for both those who like it extra hot, and those who do not! The miso broth was rich and tasty, the egg was cooked the way I like, but I wish the noodles were thicker. Overall, a great bowl of ramen. My friend loved hers, too.

I hope I have the chance to come back here in the future, and if I do, I want to try the other items! Ramen is great, but I feel like we missed out on a lot of their signature items.

Just stopped in because of the good reviews and I was in the area. The waiter, Adam, was very sweet and helpful. The dishes he recommended were delicious and the Edamame was the best I've had anywhere! 
The atmosphere was fun and lively!

The Service and food was great, and everything came out in a timely manner. 

Great experience all around.  Had the pleasure of sharing the following with one of my favorite people;

Fresh Halibut Roll 
Steamed Clams in Sake
Tuna Belly Grilled
Forgot the Name but Dish that had crispy pork belly (thin) and beansprouts/cabbage

All were great don't get me wrong,but If i had to choose one, it would be the tuna belly. my date liked the crispy pork belly dish w/veggies. Ill be back for something different!
The food is delicious! Also the ramen noodle spicy level is just delicious! It's a good place to go with friends and chill. Good music.

This place was just alright for me, but it's probably only because I tried a small part of their menu since it was my first time here. 

I got the Ton Katsu, which tasted okay. The "salad" under it didn't even have any sauce so I didn't really eat it. I feel like having it served with rice would have been more appropriate. 

We also got skewers: Pork Belly and Tuna Belly. Get the tuna! It was pretty good. I also stole a few bites of my cousin's Yakisoba and that tasted nice too. 

I had a good experience overall, I just wish I got lucky with what I ordered. Service was great, too.

I love Izakayas (Japanese equivalent to tapas)

I heard about this place through coworkers and as it turns out a friend of mine actually works there. 

This place is close to the Strip. It's on Valley View and Spring Mountain near Kuma. 

I love everything I have tried so far. My favorite being Deep Fried Chicken Cartilage, Garlic Spinach, Uni Pasta, Uni Dumplings and lastly the Kim Chee Tofu! Try this place! But it is a smaller venue so expect a wait during peak hours.

I think we came on an off-night because the food wasn't as amazing as the photos I perused on yelp prior to coming. We ordered the sashimi platter, the Hokkaido scallop sashimi, beef tataki, and the shoyu ramen. 

Their sashimi pieces are tiny; They're a little over the size of a quarter. The tuna wasn't very fresh and the scallop sashimi looked like they took one scallop and cut it into slices to make it look like there was more than it really was. 

The beef tataki was small too, and their dressing is so sour, which offsets the flavor of the beef.

The ramen was delicious, however, so that was their redeeming factor. 

3 stars for the ramen and excellent service, but I left the restaurant still hungry.

Thank you Izakaya for making us wait for almost 40 minutes for a table...because if you hadn't, we never would have walked out and found this hidden gem instead....Umiya!  

Horrible customer service here. Will NOT be coming back. Will be going to Umiya from now on!

Bruh! This place is a gem. You gotta go! I've been there 4 times already and every time we order something different and they never disappoint. 

Not going to write hella much. There is only one take away from my review: GO THERE AND EAT THIS GUYS DELICIOUS FOOD. The prices are awesome too!

ayyyyyyeeeeeee!!

I've been going to Izakaya Go since July 2015. My co-workers introduced me to this restaurant and it's by far my favorite place at the moment. Their food is always delicious and on point. Service is impeccable, and the owner is very nice. I love the interior because it's really cultural and authentic. They play Hawaiian music as well which is nice and soothing.  

SERVICE
Mr. Go (the owner) is always working when I visit and he's very nice and funny. Also the other employees are very friendly and attentive of a customer's need. If you ask your server about an item on the menu, they are very knowledgable about the dishes offered. 

FOOD
I have tried multiple dishes here, and each one I have tried are delicious. My favorite combo right now is the ten zaru udon (cold udon w/ dipping sauce & side of tempura) and chawan mushi (egg custard w/vegetables). If I'm in the mood I'll order a beef tongue yakitori (skewers). Unfortunately I did not start reviewing earlier and I couldn't take pictures of all the items I have tried. So far I have ordered: Deep fried corn flake halibut with homemade tarter sauce, Manila calm with sesame chili oil, Corn crime croquette, Spicy stir fried pork kimchi w/ pouched jidori egg, Half curry soba chicken, Chicken zosui, Deep fried baby octopus, Salmon flake onigiri, Salmon onigiri, Spicy cod roe onigiri, Truffle edamame, Seasoned French fries, California poki roll, Sushi Burrito super go crunch, Miso marinated salmon bowl. I have enjoyed every single item I have ordered. 

TIP
If you check in on Facebook and Yelp (I think) you get a complimentary ice cream. 

CONCLUSION
I will for sure be visiting again. Good authentic Japanese food, amazing service and great atmosphere.

You can't have high expectations. I give it 5 stars cause of the owner, hospitality and his creativity. He creates such chill ambiance for a nice dinner after work. Or even if you're coming for the food. 

If you know what izakaya defines. (is a type of informal Japanese drinking establishment that serves food to accompany the drinks. They are casual places for after-work drinking.) -Wikipedia. 
It comes off a really authentic feel with a bit of island music ambiance lol. 

The owner Go offers the typical sushi you could be looking for. Down to the creativity he offers of japanese tapas. They also offer a pretty good happy hour, if you're looking for a cheap beer and sake. I come about once or twice a week. And he knows what I like to get and offers the the fishes of the day. Cause I LOVE sashimi. His fried baby octopus is one of my favorites also. 

If you come after 10 the have skewer happy hour. Which comes with my favorite beef tongue skewers . I love the tuna belly cutlet. Beef tataki. And etc. Try new things on this specials menu if you're up for it :) happy eating !

This place is decorated with Japanese decor but they're bumpin island music. The poke bowl had spicy raw fish that melts in your mouth. I just left and I'm thinking about going back for a poke bowl dessert. It had the power to drown my gambling loss sorrows. In the words of my friend, MD, "it's slap your mamma good." Wasabi skewers were the best in my book. We're contemplating going for happy hour later tonight.
Very relaxed easy-going Japanese tapas stop. A good variety of sake, happy hour prices and extensive menu.
This place is bomb! Def try it! Go is a place where you can relax and have a drink. They also have late night happy hour so that's a def plus

Finally reviewing this place after a handful of visits! Izakaya Go has become one of our go-tos for late night eats!

Two words : Japanese Tapas!
I absolutely love small plates because you get to try many different things on the menu without being fully committed to a full, big dish! 

Pretty reasonable prices for items. Some dishes, I'll admit, are pretty pricey, buuuut that's what Happy Hour is for!

Dishes are cooked right, seasoned right, and freshness is there!
I've tried a lot of things on the menu, some which have me coming back for more :
*Ramen Burger with Seasoned Fries
*Crispy Pork Belly
*Kimchi Pork Belly with Poached Egg
*Truffle Buttered Corn
*Truffle Edamame
*Chicken Potstickers
*Go Crunch Sushi Burrito
*Scallop
*Chicken Karaage
*Scallop Carpaccio
*Shio Ramen (Half Order is the perfect size for me!)
*Miso Eggplant
*Yakisoba
*Curry Soba
*Asparagus Bacon Skewer
*Grilled Zucchini Skewer
*Pork Belly Skewer
Desserts :
*Yuzu Cheesecake
*Green Tea Pancake Sandwich
Drinks :
*Echigo Beer - Japanese Rice Beer
*Spiked Calpico
*Ikezo - Jelly Sparkling Sake
*Kikusui Junmai Ginjo - Cold Sake (best one I've had so far!) - $20
*Orion
*Strawberry Nigori - Creamy Sake 

Few of my favorites from the list above would be crispy pork belly, skewers, truffled corn, yakisoba, curry soba, and ramen burger.. AND all of the above for the drinks! :P

Service is always on point for us and the staff are always friendly and attentive!
I've yet to try the items on their regular menu, which means I don't have plans on stopping to eat at this place. We seriously might even be there tonight! Lol :D

Izakaya Go was a huge let down.  I went for lunch the opening week and got the salmon teriyaki lunch.  It came with your standard miso soup, salad, rice, soft tofu, and creamy potato side dish.  The food itself was good and what you would expect from a Japanese restaurant, but the long wait killed it... not on it's own.  The long wait to order, to get tea, for the food to come out, and then needing to ask for a spoon for the miso soup.  I understand this was opening week and some kinks were probably being worked out so I decided I should come back during dinner to see the full tapas menu and give it another shot. 

That day and the next they were doing 50% off the bill so the next day at dinner I recruited a friend to check out the tapas menu with me.  It was more of the same regarding service, despite having more than one server interact with us throughout the experience. This happened the previous day.  The other funny thing was the same primary server who tended to us at dinner was also the one who was taking care of me at lunch the previous day.  I understand when it's stupid busy and a lot of people are coming through, you can't remember everyone, but she didn't recognize me from the previous day even though she invited me back to check out this particular menu, and the place was never packed the both times I happened to be in.

The dinner menu is large and easy to get lost in, we got the chicken yakisoba which was great, the halibut roll, a couple other dishes that weren't memorable, my friend wanted the bacon asparagus dish, which had a hair in it.  We let the server know just so they could make the kitchen aware.  They apologized and offered us ice cream.  Overall the decor is very traditional and I can tell a lot of thought and care went into it.  The staff is friendly and I feel like they're trying but there has to be some disconnect between the front and back of the house.  The food was good but was coming out very slowly and sporadically, I think that's related to the previous statement. Oh and they have been picking the weirdest Pandora channels for music, it was mostly some super slow r&b and a couple Pandora ads. Some people might find it petty for me to mention it, but I noticed it and kind of found it entertaining.   I'm not sure if or when I'll try this place again because I feel like I got burned back to back, especially with the other reviews being so enthusiastic about this place.  Maybe I had bad luck both times?  I'll give it some time before taking another shot here, there are so many options explore in Chinatown alone, and all around Vegas.
If you haven't made it here yet damn your missing out on what this foodie calls Vegas most hottest spot in years!

This place is amazing! We spent a few hours here going Izakaya style drinking and ordering dishes. Everything was excellent. I can only urge you to peruse their "Fresh from the Market" menu and order one or two of the excellent sashimi dishes (our favorite was Breem) where the sashimi is served on the fish it came from. After you eat the sashimi they deep fry the remains of the fish, which makes for an excellent crunchy snack. Perfect for drinking black and tan (made from Asahi Black and Kirin or Sapporo)! Go for it!
Much better than going to these overpriced buffets on the Strip watching sad people stuffing their faces with all-you-can-eat crap!
Wonderful service!  Great quality food and reasonable price!!! Check this place out... does get loud and space can be better, that's why I gave 4 stars, but it's all about Good Vibez!

This is my new favorite Japanese tapas restaurant. Came here on a Saturday night and only waited about 15 minutes for a table. What really got my attention was their happy hour menu. They have a pretty decent variety on their happy hour menu, which makes me a happy camper. We ordered the fried squid legs (my favorite), spicy salmon rolls, salmon handrolls, half a tonkatsu spicy ramen, chicken meatball skewer, tomato bacon skewer, pumpkin croquette and many more items. Oh my, I was quite surprised by every dish. The service was really good. I will definitely be back!

My favorite place for Japanese food now especially sushi. The fish is so fresh here, way better than all the Las Vegas fancy restaurants.  The price is amazing too.  I always come here when I visit vegas.  Not to mention they also have really good sake.
Amazing food! We loved the service and the small plates. The squid ink rice was perfectly cooked and each grain was a burst of flavor.

Amazing service, great prices, flavors are spot on (add salt yourself), and the beer selections will satisfy any beer-craving maniac. 

Will be returning shortly. 

COME AFTER 10:00 TO ACCESS THE HAPPY HOUR MENU, THANK ME LATER.
Favorite Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas. Everything is very authentic, and best of all, affordable!!  I would recommend this to anyone and is very close to the strip.  Great service and better food

I've got izakaya fever and the only cure is... more Japanese tapas! Heads up that the lunch menu is more casual fusion fare (sushi burritos, for example) while the dinner menu is mostly traditional dishes, with a great board of specials- handily posted over each table for your drooling convenience.

As staples, I'd order the UNI CHAWAN MUSHI ($7)- delicate egg custard dish with uni and mushrooms, served in the cutest French china pot, which was second only to a phenomenal MUSHROOM PORRIDGE with egg (back page of menu by the rice bowls)- it's saucy and carby and comforting and flavorful all at once.  Not to mention packed with mushrooms.  
Other favorite dishes include the CRISPY TUNA CRACKER, which manages to be both spicy and crispy without being too spicy or too crispy. The TEMPURA WHITE FISH ($6) is divine- I'd order several for the table, the flavorful, flakey fish goes fast. If it's on the specials menu, I'd consider the TUNA BELLY STEAK ($12) a must-order; the dipping sauce and perfectly-cooked interior make for an orgasmic bite.

I did not originally plan on ordering sushi here, but was easily persuaded to try their sashimi specials- and the freshness of their fish rivals the top-ranked places in town. I also really enjoyed some of their simpler rolls, like the salmon and avocado- that section of the menu isn't too large and consists mostly of classic combinations.

Heads up that orders may take a while if there are several large groups- it's a small place with a small kitchen. I would like to suggest that they NOT use the first table inside the door for groups, as squeezing my butt past someone's face is NOT my idea of a good start to my meal- nor one I would want to experience.
Food was pretty good, waitress was SO nice and friendly. Rastafari music was kind of distracting

Love this place. I stop her every time I am in vegas. The food fair is awesome as the owner. I've been to dozens of izakayas in the US and this is the closest that it comes to the real deal...even the unfortunate, "we are out of that..."
A fun restaurant with lots of little plates of food to try and good to share. Reggae music is good and the staff is very friendly and helpful.

Unbelievable!!! That's how I'll start off this review with a special thanks to my fellow Yelpers(Without you/your reviews I would have never found this gem hidden within LV's Chinatown!)

We ordered several items after we were seated at the bar (more of a food bar than a bar-bar, if that makes sense?!?) Here's what we sampled:

- Spinach with garlic
- Whole grilled squid 
- Grilled Alaskan Butterfish
- Yakisoba w/beef
- Poke burrito
- Fried whole shrimp
- Green ice cream (check-in and you can get one too!)

All was excellently prepared and served by simply wonderful folks... The highlight was watching the grill master work hIs magic!

Here's the rundown:
-Satisfied? Yes
-Return? Yes
-Advocate? Yes

Great place!!!! Clean, nice lighting, great great great customer service!! The food was fresh and awesome and if they don't have what you want on their menu they will make it for you! 

They had a ramen burger off menu that was huge! It tasted just like a bowl of ramen right in the form of a burger. The meat is soy sauce pork like in typical ramen. 

I also had a dragon roll which is also off menu that came out great! The eel was fresh and cut perfectly. It's a great place to come anytime! 

It's open from 5am to 2am Monday through Thursday and 5 to 3 am the other days. 

Choi was definitely a great waitress that kept me and my company entertained. She definitely lighten up our night. 

I definitely recommend this place!

I walk in the location with my friend expecting lets try this new place and see if we like it. After sitting in the front still awaiting to be seated so we can even glance at the menu it took about 15 minutes before we started trying to make sure that the servers were aware we were there. 

Finally we got seated. It probably took a server about 5/7 minutes before she asked what we would like to drink. 

The food did not take long to serve but the quality was a disgrace. I felt like I was eating salt. Like someone though it would be funny to pour salt into each sushi roll. 

Finally when I was ready to leave after being seated so long with my food being complete I forgot the server had not yet given me the check and almost got up and left. 

So overall, staff needs work. Chefs, they definitely need work. 

And those mints.... were a lie! They were cinnamon!!
I have visited this place second time , and the love for Japanese food served here grows.

We left the club at 2 in the morning and came here for good eats. There was a wait at 2 in the morning! It was worth it. They have a late happy hour menu which has sushi, ramen, curry, etc. We had the ramen and it was perfect for late night eats.

First time tonite-sooo many good things to choose from-three menus, incl. a fresh catch of the day menu for whole fish, a great list of management's favs, offerings incl. sashimi and sushi, poke bowls, tons of delicious sounding Asian-fusion type tapas, udon, ramen, salads...too many things to mention. You'd think with such an extensive menu food would be mediocre, as how can one do so many dishes well? Well they do! We selected several items which were so good-crispy pork belly-yum!, salmon Kama-moist , otoro sashimi with fresh wasabi, house fried rice, crispy rice spicy tuna w/avocado, fried soft shell shrimp-light and airy-all dishes were fresh, generous portion sizes, attractively presented.  It was a very busy Monday night but staff was super friendly and attentive which made the experience complete-we can't wait to come back and try more of the menu. A new favorite spot for us.

This is an amazing place. 2 of us just wanted to stop by for a quick (and cheap) dinner and then go to the  bar....we've ended with $200. Just couldn't stop to taste everything in the menu. Food and service are outstanding.

Giving this place 4 stars.
The inside looks like a nice little Japanese restaurant/ bar. The food is very delicious I would give the food 5 stars, apparently the service wasn't the best but I'm not going to take off a million stars for that. 
They have this happy hour from 10 pm-closing and they have AMAZING happy hour options. If you want a bowl of ramen you can! For only $5 or if you wanna order some salmon handrolls it's like $5 too. 
They also have this deal you can get a whole tray with katsu as the main dish with side dishes like salad and a miso soup for like $14 but guaranteed to fill you up. 
The thing I like most about this place is that they have variety, it's not just like all Japanese tapas, I mean there are tapas, but there are also sushi or sashimi or ramen or katsu or fried tuna belly on a skewer.. and etc. plus did I also add this little place is also a bar? And they close around 2 am so you can eat/drink here late at night when almost everything else is closed.
This place is AWESOME! They have so many things I have never seen at any other restaurant. Excellent service too!

This the new place for us. The food is not real Japanese Food that we looking for. 
Yellow tail cut is not by Japanese chef that know how to cut and gave fatty part. Very disappointed. The pork Belly Yakitori slice very thin and look like baked in oven before charbroil grilled weak tase. Chicken liver is over cook burn. Asparagus very skinny wrap with bacon. Uni sushi is weir form and shape like don't know how to wrap rice with sea wheat. Savamushi taste good and very fine. 
Ice green read no refill. Service is very good.
Came here for the first time tonight with my husband. The food was wonderful. The sashimi bowl was outstanding and the mixed tempura hit the spot!
Open late, wide variety menu, cost-effective = perfect go-to spot for anyone who works in nightlife or on the Strip.

This is a legit Japanese izakaya. We had a tofu salad, rainbow roll, tekka maki, yakitori, and curry udon. Each dish was tasty, well seasoned, perfectly cooked. Their fish selections are impressive as they have stuff from Hokkaido and other parts of Japan. Friendly and attentive staff, too. This is going to be our go-to spot whenever we come to Vegas.
Yummy Ramen, great service, and the Topped halibut California roll was the BOMB!!! Def going back to this place again, oh and our whole dinner including drinks and tip only $60! Total steal!

This was a great Yelp find in Vegas! After walking around the Strip for a few hours, dinner was on our minds. My niece didn't want anything fried, so we all agreed on sushi. Living in Hawaii, I tend to be cautious of eating fish when land-locked. Not wanting to use up all my winnings on one meal, we took to Yelp. And as always, Yelp was spot on with Izakaya Go. It's located in the Chinatown area, don't know about parking, it was pretty full for a week night,  but we ride-share when in Vegas. 

The food, prices, and service were fantastic! They have an extensive menu, prices are good (compared to the Strip and Hawaii prices), and the entire staff is friendly. We got to say hi to the chef and thank him for the best meal we had in Vegas. 

Every thing we tried was delicious and fresh.  Squid legs in garlic butter, Poke "nachos", sashimi, salmon and ikura roll, grilled chicken livers, gizzards, and hearts. And when you check in with Yelp you get free ice cream, green tea was our choice, it was perfect for the end of a perfect meal. 

And I still had money left to gamble with!

Good variety of izakaya. Typical suspects here from edamame, yakatori, tempura, sashimi, udon and sushi dishes. Food is ok and fresh. Restaurant is a bit cramped and service us fast paced and rushed, not a place to relax and to have a causal meal. A bit loud to hold a conversation, ample parking.

My friends took me to Izakaya Go on my birthday during our May Las Vegas trip. I enjoyed the yakitori and fried pork belly appetizer dishes with a beer. The restaurant has so many appetizer offerings it was a little difficult to select my dishes. I like the Izakaya styled atmosphere.
Very very good ramen. Probably top three I ever had. Rich broth. Not too salty. Well priced too.

They have a pretty decent happy hour menu. Make sure to sign in when you arrive, we seen a few guest leave because they were waiting for awhile to be seated but was not told to sign in. . . .
We ordered Curry w/rice and steak, Takoyaki, miso ramen, and shoyu ramen, all were flavorful.
Music may be really loud so be prepared to limit your conversations unless you want everyone to hear lol. besides that service was great!!!!

This is a really neat place. Especially notable is the truffle butter corn which is amazingly savory. I like to order the shiitake mushroom skewer and add it to the corn. The fish is always fresh, flavorful and great service..A great value for the dollar.

Was here once before when it first opened, I remembered really liking the food so came here again after a show. 

We came in around 9pm on a Saturday night, the place was pretty full but not crazy packed, we did not have to wait or anything. We were greeted immediately and quickly seated, our server brought out water while we looked through the menu. 

We wanted to try a bunch of items on their specials menu but 90% of the items were not available...So...why did the hostess even give us the menu? Why didn't our server tell us that they are out of the specials before we spent the time choosing what we wanted?

We ended up getting pretty much the same items as before. Food was really good, don't get me wrong. But you should be stocked and prepared for the weekend crowd, I am not sure if they sold out for the day (we came in at 9 so not even that late) or they don't currently offer those dishes anymore.. regardless, either stock up for the weekend or don't offer the menu. It was disappointing after spending time choosing and getting excited about trying new and interesting items then being told literally all items you wanted are not available.

I definitely enjoy the food, some really good stand out items, just disappointed not being able to enjoy their specials.
went there on a Saturday night was very busy but the service was on point. Food was awesome I love the salmon carpaccio.

Came here with a coworker as we've heard a new japanese restaurant near our working place had opened. 

  We were greeted warmly by the workers and was allowed to choose our own table !
  There is a wonderful and broad selection on their menu , wether you're craving burgers , noodles , rice etc and the portions are generous and well worth the price! 

  My favorites are the karaage and tempura that are nice and crispy , ginger pork which has a unique flavor  and esp the Salt Salmon combo which is grilled to perfection and boneless !
The entree is accompanied by a bowl of rice and chef chosen healthy side dishes which are delicious !

  Definitely dying to try their ramen burger and crab cream croquette burger , which may not be for a while because I am forever addicted to their special combos which leave me ever so satisfied and not grotesquely bloated or sick when we finish.  

  The owner is very friendly and always checks up on you to see if everything is ok. Everything is EXCELLENT! He and the other workers even recognizes us as regulars x3

this place is amazing, the quality fish they provide is over the top and they have amazing customer service.
my server was Brian, and I asked his opinion on the catch of the day fish,l, he was very thorough in explainijng the differences and making a delicious suggestion. He also added that the fish bones could be fried after so that one could eat them; I thought about it for a second as weird but I decided to try it before I made a decision not to like it, and it was amazing!
thanks guys for the wonderful food and service.
One of the best Japaneae resto here in las vegas.  Place is nice and clean. Definitely i will bring my good friends here.

We caught the late happy hour that starts at 10:00PM. Amazing selection of small plates, open late for after show dining and low key, friendly ambiance. Parking is easy, the happy hour prices were extremely reasonable and the service was excellent. I could eat here every day. My previous go-to Tapas restaurant was just so-so last time I was there. May have been an off night so I will give them another chance, but this place has just taken the number one spot in my book!

Big fan of this place.  So many options and so far everything I've tried, I've enjoyed.  Service is a bit slow but worth it.  Some of my favorites are the shiitake skewers, tempura udon, spicy tuna cracker, squid tempura... We were a little bummed out the last time we went because they didn't have any uni which I was very eager to order because my parents love uni.  Hoping they will have uni the next time we go back.

I don't write review on yelp. But this is the worse experience I ever had. My first time and my last time. Food take forever to come out. I can't find my server. She never checking on us even she came and dropped the food that we order awhile ago.

My boyfriend and I ordered ramen here and had mix emotions lol. I liked it but its just not as creamy as the other ramens that ive tried. But the flavor was alright. The broth was salty and spicy and pork was on the sweet side. We were not really an fan of the sweer pork tho. But it was a good blend to the spicy and salty. My bf ordered Spicy Miso Ramen and I ordered Spicy Tonkatsu Ramen. We also ordered soft shell crabs. Its not very crunchy compared to others that we tried tho.

Love the tofu yakisoba. We came here twice within 3 days. If you don't want all you can eat buffet or pricy food on the strip, here is definitely the place come. Their takoyaki is tasty and crispy. Love it.

We just left this place without ordering.. Walked in. Mentioned it was our first time. Waitress with some-what orange/bleached hair immediately ignored us. Had to mention twice we were new and we're not sure how to order. Just got an "okay" and she walked away. It was obvious she was uncomfortable with us being there. Immediately turned us off. We left. 
Never again. How hard is it to explain a menu? Or to smile? 

Customers remember the greeting and the good bye. 
Going somewhere else.

Amazing place!! But prepare yourself for a 30 mins waiting!! One step down from raku, but most time they can seat you the same day. Food quality is very food and service is outstanding. I have been going to this place for the past two years and always had pleasant experience.

First time here & itsss Happy Hour from 10 - "Closed" lol 
All Gucci. Would come back for sure. 

Everything was bomb & drinks were cheapsss
Excellent late night happy hour.  Service with a smile and great food without pretense.  Little bit loud, but in a good way.

One of my best favorite place in Las Vegas.

A relaxed atmosphere, common Japanlike  mood, kind servers and the taste are nothing to be desired. 

Today, we ate Karaage dinner plate, marinated miso salmon bowl, salmon handroll and cold sake.  Karaage, my first priority here is worth to be recommended.  The rest are good, too.

If you go there first time, be sure to get Japan fried rice. The taste is better with miso soup.

Actually, most served food here are great and through severs here, you can feel how kind Asian (esp. Japanese and Korean) are.
