If you go there with 3 or more, you can make a reserve seat by calling and always many people love  Izakya Go like me.

Very recommendable ,,,,,

We were in town again and went here for dinner last night. We were disappointed because the food was not the same anymore. We asked our server and she mentioned that they change their happy hour menu all the time. And that explains why we didn't find some of our favorite food on it. None the less, service was great.
Hands down, one of the best places in Vegas. Service is amazing, the food is delicious. The ambiance in general is great!

A cozy little place in Chinatown. Great food, service and happy hour. 
Usually no wait after 10pm. 
The staff is quick and attentive. The owner always greets us and checks for satisfaction. 
The strak bento box and fresh fish are my fav.
The truffle edamame is a must.
Very good place for Thai food so nice place too open all night I love it good service too

2.35754 stars to be exact. Everything was just okay. Nothing special that really wowed me except the crispy pork belly and uni chawan mushi. 

My boyfriend and I came in on a Saturday around 1 am for a late dinner. It wasn't busy at all and there was only one server. 

We ordered: 

CRISPY PORK BELLY: honestly my favorite dish. It was crispy and chewy. I liked the salt that was sprinkled on it. It brought out the savory taste! 
CHICKEN KARAGE: Felt undercooked and needed to be more crispy. 
UNI POTSTICKERS: hmm I really wondered what I put in my mouth. I think there was only a smidge of uni at the top and the rest was weird mushy stuff. 
HALIBUT AND ABALONE: okay seriously for $15 I expected a lot more. The halibut was seriously the size of my two fingers and the abalone was very tiny also. They just serve it with a side of ponzu.
GO WINGS: were drenched in some salty teriyaki sauce. The breading was hard and I didn't like it at all. 
UNI CHAWAN MUSHI: very savory! I love the seafood that was in there and how it's served to you in a small cute cup.
BEEF TATAKI: very small portion. Only five small pieces. I did like the sauce and topping they pot with it. The meat was tender and chewy!
SPICY MISO RAMEN: the noodles were very undercooked and came out warm. The broth was light and just okay. 

The owner Go was nice enough to let us try his small clam dish. 

Don't think I'll be return though unless it just take out of the Crispy Pork Belly.

Typical Japanese tapas fare. Our servers seemed annoyed at us when we asked for water or napkins and it was a Saturday night, so naturally, it was busy. We ordered yakitori, ramen, sashimi, a soda and 2 pitchers of beer. It was $186 for four people without a tip. A little pricey for the food since it wasn't huge portions or anything, but again, I've been to places like this and there isn't anything to write home about, especially from this particular place. I would say I would go here again if I had to.

Good sushi and even better fried foods had fried baby octopus best thing I had. Spicy tuna was okay needed more flavor. The eel amazing and the spider roll was okay had a funny texture but great flavor. Also had soft shell crab crunchy some nice flavor which was really amazing. Will come again when it town. My waitress was beautiful as which was a added bonus.

WAY overrated.  I guess when a restaurant puts out a "Review us on Yelp" sign, you can expect the reviews to be skewed in the positive direction.

I think the mistake I made was forgetting that the word "Sushi" is not in this restaurant's name but the first category it is listed under on Yelp IS "Sushi Bars"

I had both Sushi and Izakaya.  First off, first place I've been in all my travels and hundreds of sushi bars that they actually don't have a Nigiri menu (only roll menu).  This should have been the first red flag.  Second red flag is they had a bar area like a sushi bar but no one was standing behind it making sushi. 

The sushi was LAME.  Edible, but the pieces of fish were small, quality of fish was average, rice was mediocre and construction and presentation also mediocre.

The Izakaya was good but I've not eaten many places so I'm no expert.  Had mushrooms, pork belly and tuna belly.  Pork belly was so so, the other two were good.  

Service was uneven.  I guess if you live in the area and like Izakaya, this is not a bad choice, but overall this place is unremarkable and the Sushi was very lackluster.  4 stars for Izakaya, 2 stars for sushi = 3 star average.

In search of an Izakaya Resaurant in Las Vegas, *Izakaya Go* popped up and so I thought I'd check this place out. This is located in Chinatown in a shopping center that's not as busy as the other parts of town. The server who helped us that evening was very nice. The food was pretty tasty and everything I ordered was good, as well as the other orders I sampled at our table. 

My order: 
~Pumpkin Croquettes: MmM!
~Crispy Pork Belly with a side of white rice: delightful :)
~Goma-ae: Boiled Spinach in sesame dressing: great side

The only reason I deducted a star was the weird order of the food coming out. First and foremost my food came out first which was cool, but then no other orders were coming out for a really long time. The orders were coming out at random timing with really long gaps.. so basically we all could not eat at the same time. By the time the ramen came out everybody was done eating except for that last person. That was super sad and strange, I don't understand the back up and it was really awkward to watch the last person eat while we were all done.. it's like the last order was forgotten and never placed to begin with. 

Overall, a decent spot, with a great variety.. however just beware of the interesting service. (:

The Skinny: the street food is great especially the takoyaki but fried items are just okay(3.5) the service was fast and efficient (4), value: very generous serving sizes for the price (3.5 bump up to 4 stars) 

I was coming off a late night shift and hungry as hell. The hubs said why don't we try this izakaya in Chinatown. I am all in. 

So we head to Izakaya Go which is tucked away in a small plaza behind a Starbucks.  Parking and is free but has a 80 minutes maximum in front of the restaurant.  Seeing how it was late and there was not much going on there,  this didn't bother us too much. 

We were promptly seated and orders taken. Service is solid with complimentary hot green tea. (FYI -  iced green tea is never free... Don't ask me why but it is a Japanese thing). 

Like most izakayas, the menu consists of many small dishes that go well with alcohol. Surprisingly,  there aren't any kushiyaki or yakitori on the menu. I also found it funny that they offered ramen and soba

First visit: takoyaki,  yakisoba,  tonkatsu dinner, buta kakuni. 

The takoyaki was on the mark. This is the closest I've had to the takoyaki you get in Osaka's Dotombori district.  The batter is fluffy on the side,  crispy on the outside. Served with shaved Bonito flakes, mayo and takoyaki sauce,  it is totally delish and a great value for the price. 

Yakisoba was another favorite.  The stir-fried noodles had a nice chew to it while the slightly charred (in a good way!)meat and vegetables gives a mild smokey flavor. 

The stewed pork belly (buta kakuni) was a generous portion without too much fat. Marinated in a sweet soy base and served with a bit of mustard,  the meat was moist and delicious.

The tonkatsu dinner was a good value. Only thing is the tonkatsu crust is a bit too thick and heavy. Overall it was okay but nothing we need to order again. 

Round 2: stir fried mushrooms,  sautéed spinach, miso glazed eggplant, California roll, crispy pork belly, karaage. 

Stir fried mushrooms were great. Loved the buttery flavor with a nice sear. 

California roll was pretty standard stuff. Okay but nothing to write home about. 

Crispy pork belly texturally was too hard and a bit too salty. The karaage had similar problems plus was served with an aioli which was too heavy. Pass. 

Miso eggplant was very sweet and could almost be categorized as candied eggplant. Pass. 

Sautéed spinach was okay but really nothing special and a small portion to boot. 

Given the food overall,  there were some hits and misses. But given the good items are so good,  it is enough to have me coming back for more. (3.5 bump up to 4 starred review).

I stumbled upon this place by checking yelp. This restaurant definitely deserves five stars. The food was very good and tasted great as well.

A bonus is that the raw fish here also tastes fresh, which is sometimes rare for seafood restaurants. The service is decent here too. The ambiance is calming and gives a good representation of a Japanese restaurant.

The prices here are also fair compared with other sushi restaurants in Las Vegas. I recommend here for every one who craves sushi when they come to Vegas.

Daaaaamn ! That bang bang chicken was on point! Very delicious and genius! Our server Boram was amazing she recommended the dish and I trust her with my life!!! lol The crispy pork belly.....HEAVEN IN YOUR MOUTH! Kimchee Tofu....LIGHT

Came here after attempting to eat at my favorite place on Spring Mountain and they appear to be closed permanently.  As far as Izakaya Go, their food was good.  I had the Karaage Chicken dinner with miso soup, salad and rice.  Everything was good.  Service was a little lacking but not a major deal.  The chicken gizzard yaki-tori stick was really good and the crispy pork belly was awesome.

So good!!! I would definitely love to come back here whenever I visit Vegas.
We ordered a lot of dishes and everything was really good. What really stood out to me was beef tataki, uni dumplings, and takoyaki. Their menu has so many things on it. I wanted to try all of it. 
Service was great. Everything came out in a timely manner, and they checked up on us regularly. This place has a lot of variety on their menu. You def need to come back a few times to try everything that looks good!

This place is a must-go every time we come to Vegas. Off strip prices, great service, amazing food, huge menu. The staff is super friendly and you can tell they are into what they are doing because they are excited to explain items on the menu and always make great saki recommendations. A meal like this on the strip would be 5X the cost. 

Typically very crowded on weekends so make a reservation. If soft shell crab is on the specials, get it.
Ten Zaru soba w tempura is the nuts. Not heavy clean and filling. Great seafood from hokiado. Yakitori is very good too. Highly recommend.

Excellent Japanese restaurant off the strip.  I really loved the fresh whole fish sashimi, fish are flown everyday from Japan and are beautifully presented for your dinning pleasure.  Every dish is top quality, and the service is great.
Very fresh seafood and prices are great. The ohtoro is the best I can consider this is the fattest cut I be ever tried! Uni too, very fresh!!!!

The food at this place is just so so to me.  The price is kinda high for the small portion.

The service was not impressive especially the server made a mistake but didn't even care to apologize.  We already the monk fish liver but I didn't want the server to get confused whether we wanted fish liver or beef liver, I told her one more time it's fish liver and she said okay okay.  After a while the fish liver hasn't come so we asked about the fish liver and she said we ordered beef liver.  I told her that we emphasized that we want the "fish" liver and she asked if I talked to her about that.  I was like my husband placed the order but I mentioned one more time after that I want fish.  

Later she just said okay okay and I was gonna tell her that it's fine we can take another beef liver, she just seems so frustrated and ran away.  

I just felt that her service was really bad and the food was just overpriced for the portion.  The only dish I liked was the blue crab salad.

I love coming to this place with my friends. 
Their happy hour is at 10 pm which is usually the time that we all get there. 
The wait line isn't long usually but it's very much worth it if you do have to wait. 
We got their fish and chips, octopus fried rice, salmon bowl, tuna belly skewer, fries, unagi bowl and the spicy salmon hand roll. 
Everythig we ordered was really good, their rice bowls come with a tofu miso soup with seaweed inside. 
Everyone enjoyed their food a lot. 
The only thing I would really say is that after you order your food, the wait for your food is a bit longer than usual. But eventually the food comes and it's really good. So I do recommend going there to try out there food whether it's happy hour or not. It's really good.

What to eat when you're out and about at 2am in Vegas. There are very few spots that stay open that late.  We drove in from OC around 1am.  I didn't feel like having a heavy meal so we found this spot on Yelp.  I know that it's somewhere outside the strip.  The Uber driver took us here so I don't quite remember the exact location.  

This restaurant is small with a bar area and some booths.  The service was ok but it's Vegas and people are not chipper all the time.  They have HH here.  The menu is pretty extensive from sushi, ramen noodles, udon, rice dishes, tapas and more.  

We wanted something light so we opted for ramen.  The tonkotsu ramen was ok.  Not the best but it will do when you're hungry or hungover.  I tried the spicy miso ramen.  It was more tasty than the latter.  Again, it's a last resort.  I probably wouldn't choose this spot again for late night eats.  There are better options around the area!

I haven't heard much about izakaya go, but I have seen so many pictures of their food online so I was excited to try it out. It was oddly cold this night so I decided to get some miso ramen to warm myself up. It wasn't as tasty as I wanted it to be. Too many green onions were placed in the bowl so that was all I tasted. The noodles were plentiful but a little too soggy. I wish it wasn't cooked so long. The opposite was true for the bean sprouts, which were a little too crunchy for my taste. 

My friends and I came here for an early dinner, 6pm on a Saturday night. There was no crowd when we got there but it got busy after a while. Once the place filled up, it was hard to get service. The food also came out very slowly, one at a time. Probably 10-15 minutes in between each person's orders. Typically, this wouldn't bother me, but it's a little awkward when only one person has their food and everyone else is waiting for theirs. At the end of our meal, we looked at the wall and saw a sign that said free ice cream with a facebook check in. We asked the server about it and she seemed hesitant to give us the ice cream but after checking our facebook pages, she took our ice cream orders. I know this place has a lot more to offer. I'm excited to come back and try some of their other items!

Came here to get rid of a very strong Japanese street food craving after watching YouTube videos of the street food venders in Japan. Ordered the Japanese pancake as well as the takoyaki balls and I feel like it under delivered as far as the sauce and slightly over cooking it went. Other than that; it is great to be able to order these authentic Japanese dishes here in Vegas. The ramen was actually not bad compared to the fully dedicated ramen joints. The spicy pork is more mild, but the flavor of the pork and broth was very tasty. The hot Japanese green tea is fantastic if you are in the mood for tea. I would avoid eating an onigiri here (as it is just rice wrapped in nori) but the salmon belly skewers were delicious, and cooked to perfection. The grilled corn had a nice flavor to it as well. Overall a great place with a very excellent, expansive menu which means many new things to try! 

--Reserve a table or get there early as seating is very limited!!--

Went with my hubby, our baby and friends. It was our first time here and we were craving for some ramen. The place was small but it did accomodate all 12 of us. At first we got divide into 2 tables but we saw a big table and we ask them if we could move there, one of the guy was nice to say it was ok.  We already ordered before we got moved so by the time we got all seated the foods were coming out. 

We ordered in their HH menu, the portions are not bad, some of us ordered appetizers too. The food is good, the ambience is nice plus it's more fun eating with a big group of friends hahaha. 

Oh, one of my friends told the server that we're celebrating my husband's bday which we are. It's suppose to be a surprise cuz the turn off all the light and sing to u while they bring a little dessert but someone else was celebrating their bday so my husband knows already what's gonna happen, but was still gun.

The only think I notice is when one of my friends ask if she could get an extra bowl they gave her a 2 small ones and when she ask if she could get the same size as the HH ramen bowl the lady server said to her that she already gave her one and wasn't very nice when she said that to our friend. 

We might come back here but it depends if we're in Vegas again.....hahaha.....oh they open late that's why we went there.

late night dinner before driving home

so many things to choose from!
had chicken skin, fatty heart, ramen, and sashimi platter.

everything tasted good and so affordable!
would come here at least once a week if i lived here

Hands down the best Japanese restaurant that I've ever been too. They have such a huge selection of everything.  From sushi to curry rice and to different kinds of ramen.  Every dish is full of flavor. If you are wanting a warming atmosphere and great food Izakaya is the best choice.  The staff is all amazing and very attentive and friendly.  They will treat you like family. You will have no regrets coming here.

While in Vegas, someone mentioned that Spring Mountain Rd was *the* place to go for ramen, and Asian yumminess in general. 

The scene: It's a very small storefront. Upon entering, you are instantly sent to a busy little hole in the wall Japanese local hot spot. Servers are super friendly (although ours was a little less knowledgeable about the sake/wine menu).

The menu: There are a lot of items (and a lot of menus! We were given 3: specials, main menu, drinks, and a tally sheet for smaller dishes), so it can be a bit overwhelming. It would definitely suggest ordering some items off the tally sheet! They are small, taster dishes so you can try a little bit of everything!

The food: Delicious and perfectly timed. We had the cracker roll appetizer, crab brain shiso tempura, spicy beef yakisoba (bf and I split), new zealand lamb skewer, bacon wrapped quail egg skewer, beef tongue skewer and tuna belly hand rolls. It was all SO good, I officially cannot pick my favorite. I will be returning for sure!

This place is amazing! Everyone on staff is at the top of their game and the food there is exquisite! This is the top 3 places to get fresh well prepared and presented and traditional Japanese food, with a creative splash, in LV. The owner plays reggae so the dining area has a great chill ambiance.

This place is my favorite Japanese tapas. The food is always fresh and delicious, love the ambiance so relaxed and welcoming. The staff is fantastic and very friendly. Some of my favorites are Tofu salad, yellowtail carpaccio, and lamp chop. Overall love this place.

Not that spectacular. Their grilled squid really sucks, it tastes like they boiled or steamed instead of grilling. Vegas has so many good Izakaya places, so I don't think I will ever go back. Uni pasta was okay, not that special. you won't be able to taste uni, and you can make a cream pasta by yourself and put some uni on there. Probably the same taste.

First visit today and definitely not the last! Extensive menu with great variety of options. The menu is a bit overwhelming but the servers were very helpful. Lychee Chu-hai cocktail was absolutely delicious with a refreshing summer floral taste. We ordered the tonkatsu ramen, miso salmon and tuna belly appetizer all of which were delicious! Overall, good service, great food and yummy cocktails! Cannot wait to return and taste the other delicious menu items!
Great Japanese restaurant with a large menu!  Delicious food, with lots of options for everyone. Cool ambience, great staff, I can eat here everyday

Absolutely love the sushi, always fresh fish and quick service. Beef Tataki is a must try, one of my favorite things on the menu. As well as the yellowtail collar. Some of the friendliest staff in the city, always consistent. The music is also good for the atmosphere, nice chill reggae vibes. It's definitely a good stop, wether just for a snack, or a full service dinner.
Nothing Special. Overpriced for small portions of average food. I had asked the waitress for hot tea three times! Either she's absent-mindedness or laziness.
Wow! Thanks a lot for this food experience. Everything was on point and pricing is more than fair!
Amazing and awesome selections. Really cheap and extremely unique for great quality food. Definitely coming back

I was actually a little disappointed in izakaya go, the interior was a little small but didn't pose a problem finding a seat. We ordered the Takoyaki, cooked ika tentacles in butter, uni pasta, and the ramen burger (both their most popular dishes). The uni pasta when it came out had a funky smell which was not appetizing at all, but the smell was deceptive. The pasta was rich and creamy, and tasted of a light fishy version of an Alfredo with onions and..who'd of guessed it? Uni. The Takoyaki was okay and came with 10 pieces, but I really didn't see anything out of the ordinary in this dish. The ika had a good flavor of light citrus and butter, but had a crunchy uncooked texture rather than the tender texture like the ika butter at kyaras tapas. I wasn't a fan of the texture since it was a little more difficult to chew and digest. The ramen burger wasn't very much impressive either. It just tasted like soggy ramen smothered in pulled pork and onions. The sauce was too strong on it, and the ramen buns had a very unappetizing texture and plain flavor. Service was mediocre, our waitress was nice but when our food came out, our chef looked very annoyed or uninterested and spoke very quietly and monotoned like he just wanted to leave and go sleep in the corner.

Over-all, for a fine dining establishment, I didn't feel the fine dine experience at all and left a little dissatisfied. I probably wouldn't come back, but i suppose it's worth a try if you haven't ever been yet.

Not sure what the big deal is with this place. Maybe because there aren't many Izakaya joints in the area? The food was underwhelming. Usually there's some innovation with Izakaya...some new flavour profile etc. The menu was very basic...the most basic sushi options and the typical deep fried stuff. Fried pork belly...was fried pork belly. Would not go out of my way to visit again

This is a great place to get quality Japanese food in Las Vegas in a relaxed environment, with excellent service. The menu can be a bit overwhelming with so many choices, but we had about 8 different plates and all were excellent, and the prices were definitely reasonable. I agree with other reviewers, the crips pork belly is an unexpected winner!

4 for the price points offered, 3 overall. Cool offerings such as sea cucumber, raw octopus, silverfish however quality and freshness was not peak on all of them.  Robata was a high point, sushi rolls were mediocre. Service was surprisingly efficient and fast. Fun Japanese beer selections, lots of reasonably priced Sakes.

Izakaya Go somewhere else for great Izakaya! Lunch was okay but dinner was a huge letdown.

Service (from the owner) was great the first time we came in for lunch! We shared tempura, salmon and chicken lunch combinations, and while nothing wowed us, the service and promising looking dinner menu made us want to come back right away to check out dinner. Our first time in for dinner we were eating light and just came in for a few items at the bar...nothing was bad, but nothing would bring us back. We were the only ones in the restaurant and service was inconsistent as they had just opened and were still preparing for the evening shift. Our server (and the small staff in general) was in the back of the house the vast majority of the time, but the specials board as well as a few menu items sounded too good for us not to return. On our third visit the service was horrible. Our server was new, had not been trained properly, and she didn't know anything about Japanese food or the products being used. We ordered several items and once again, we were not impressed by a single one. Not only that, a few dishes were rather bad. 

Items that let us down:
Spicy Tuna Bowl
Uni dumplings
Crispy Pork Belly
Hamachi kama
Battera
Tuna Belly Steak
Chawan Mushi
Tororo Udon with grated mountain yam 


Lunch certainly saved this from a 1 star review in my opinion...but I would not have gone out of my way to eat lunch here aside from the bad dinner experiences. I've heard that they have improved recently, but I will have to hear that for a while from some trusted sources before I want to venture back.

I used to love this place, but the other night my Gf and I waited 25 min for a table. We were waiting for a Table for 2, cuz I despise eating at the bar.

Alas our table for 2 was called, and we were stoked cuz we were both starved!  10 min after ordering one of the servers came back to our table (that seated us), and said I responded to the wrong name.  I'm like "Dude, I wouldn't respond to a name thats not mine..." so than he switched it up, and said oh well I made a mistake, I have to move you....

I'm like Okaaaay, I need a table. He's like we only have the bar. Wouldn't have waited 20min for the flippin table to end up at the bar; the bar seats were open from the beginning.

All you have to do is apologize and comp drinks or something.  Last I checked, this is F&B, its only customary..... My average check in there is $75, so there lack of empathy, no apology, means I'll take my biz elsewhere.

I had the worst experience at this restaurant last night. I brought a party of 9 people from California and Hawaii for dinner. 2 people ordered the soba noodles with tempura. The soba noodles look like ramen noodles in texture and color. It also didn't have the taste like regular soba. The service was also lacking. I did not get my order of the sea bream sashimi until everyone was finished eating! I had eaten here before and it was great! But last night the service was lacking in the timing of the dishes. I'm sorry Mr Go, but it was not a good experience last night.

Came here for happy hour (10pm- 2). The prices for happy hour were great. The food was also great. The only thing that was a bummer was that there was quite a few things we tried to order that they ran out of.  Other than that - food was great, service was good!  

Must try dishes:
Seasoned cabbage
Salmon tartar!! 
Tuna belly steak!! 
Calpico red wine ( for the sweet drink lovers)

Great food and Asahi beer (my fav). We ordered like 10 things and they were all good. Agedashi mochi and tonkatsu delicous. The crunchy sushi (shrimp tempura w tempura bits) yum!! Finished with black sesame mochi ice cream. Definitely going back.
The best place for happy hour hands down. Everything is made to order so be patient, you won't regret it

Best Japanese curry I've ever had! 

The vibe is very chill and inviting. Tonight there was reggae music which made the experience so much better. It reminded me of eating or hanging out at local bars along the beach in Hawaii and Guam. 

It's a small venue with a window view into the kitchen. So if you want to see your food being made, sit at the bar. Although, it through me off that the guy cooking and plating the food didn't wear gloves but rather wipe off on a side towel everytime he touched food. 

Service is great! The owner Go speaks English and Japanese, so I found it a bit entertaining to hear someone at the bar showoff their Japanese skills by speaking the language . Although Go means 5 in Japanese, it can mean other things too. Here I am thinking it's the 5th restaurant of its kind...like Thai Noodle house 1 2 3 4 and 5...

The food was amazing and will be back to try more. They also carry Junmai Sake which is one of the best Sake out there. 

Tucked away behind Krung Siam, it's a bit difficult to find, so just find Krung Siam and it's on the back lot of the restaurant.

My first visit to this new spot in Chinatown felt like a quick trip back to Japan. First of all, the atmosphere of the place was exactly what I'm used to see in my hometown. With all the decorations and spot lights surrounding the entire restaurant, the first thing that popped in to my mind was this is what an real Izakaya should look like. While I was impressed of the décor, my next question was, will this place have the right quality food that matches the place. Oh yeah they did and honestly it exceeded my expectation. Sashimi (raw fish with no rice) no doubt was as fresh as it gets, fried chicken (karaage) and kimuchi tofu went so well with beer. Moved on to drinking sake, grilled black cod, king crab legs, sea urchin dumpling, and tuna belly steak was so yummy, I couldn't stop drinking..... I closed it out with their Shio ramen. Their chashu was tender and flavorful and the soup had a nice kick spice in it, and liked it for the fact that it was chicken broth instead of pork. Well recommended and am going back to this place very soon. Oh and the service was great too.

The Uni Chawan Mushi caught my eye on here and was the main reason for my visit. It definitely did not disappoint. I also had a grilled tuna belly which was cooked to perfection and seasoned elegantly. My tummy left very happy. 

The only reason why I hesitate to give a full 5-stars is the service left something to be desired. I asked my server what he would recommend to accompany the Uni dish, which he could hardly create an answer for. He just directed me to the specials board, which worked out fine. But I was hoping for a little more guidance on the very extensive menu. Maybe a starchy dish to complement the egg custard? 

The other note on service was about 7-8 minutes after I had placed my order, I was looking around the restaurant (dining solo tonight) to soak in the authentic and homey decor. My server must have thought I was being impatient as he then warned me that the specific dishes I ordered do take a while to cook. I was not concerned about the time, but you think this warning would be better suited as I'm placing the order not 8 minutes after.

Regardless I definitely plan on coming back, with more people, to enjoy a better variety of the awesome menu.

Authentic Japanese not far from the strip. It is very crowded during dining hours. I waited 30 minutes for a spot at the counter at 8:00 pm in January. Service was okay. Only checked on me a few times, but when they did check on me it was courteous, kind, and prompt. The food was great except for the ramen. I love ramen and it tasted like Americanized ramen. The noodles were like spaghetti and the broth didn't taste like it had been made from scratch. On the other hand, the takoyaki is the best I have had in America.  Come here for me everything but the ramen. For that go up the street to Ramen Sora or Monta Ramen

I don't really understand how this place has 4.5 stars..I've been to many izakaya places especially since I am from LA area & been to most of the famous places around LA & I love good sushi, japanese tapas & ramen!...basically this place is NOT WORTH the money & the wait!!  Don't b fooled by the ratings..I called to 2 make reservation & they said since I was on my way I didn't need 2 since max wait time was 30 mins...waited an hour...ordered food & the waitress came back & said 2 out 3 items we ordered were not available...don't even think 2 order any chicken dishes since none are avail...just filled up my stomach w/beer & fried rice which I could have ordered at the Chinese restaurant next door for better taste & price!!!  Don't waste your money & time...I should know since I am asian..

After so many visits, I can finally say that this is my favorite restaurant. I have introduced so many of my friends to this restaurant and most of them love it too! Since they are open so late, I always come here during their Happy Hour times which is 10pm-close (2am or 3am depending on the day). I always either order their half ramen shoyu or half curry udon with chicken. They are so delicious!! They also have another menu for skewers and I never miss the opportunity to order some beef tongue, it comes with a lemon to pour on your beef tongue and it's so good and chewy. Their California poki half roll is very delicious too, I occasionally order this when I'm craving some sushi.

When I'm not ordering from the Happy Hour menu, I either buy the tori udon or one of their combination dinner plates. The combinations are so fulfilling because it comes with so many dishes! My favorite side dish from the dinner plates is the cold tofu they provide. 

The workers are super friendly and helpful but sometimes it takes a very long time for them to notice me calling for them and getting the check takes some time too.

Food: 5/5
Service: 4/5 
Interior: 5/5

On our first GO, we were a little let down by their menu selection. Did we come too early in their grand opening? Did they not expand their menu yet? Maybe the classic "it's not you, it's me" situation, but we just weren't really feeling it! Nothing looked truly original or even exciting, except for an item or two.

We felt that the small tapas style plates were leaning closer towards the pricey range. However, we did find a glimmer of satisfaction in 2 of the dishes we sampled. Here's what we ended up with:

Spicy tuna cracker $6.75 / From the appetizer section. Alright, so you heard me, this isn't original and I can definitely get a great spicy tuna cracker down the street (Gyu-Kaku, Jinya Ramen Bar) but it's still a pretty darn tasty execution of a classic, cult favorite dish. Beautifully presented; fried crispy rice, topped with spicy tuna, avocado, a dot of sriracha, and drizzled with a creamy spicy mayo sauce. Nice proportions  and we enjoyed the delicate, subtle spice. Flavor rating: 5/5

Asparagus bacon $4.95 / From their stir-fried section. It came out in a bowl, super limp and soggy, with about 2 inches of oil at the bottom. We felt that it was also way too salty for its own good, so we ordered an extra side of rice to eat it with. Granted, bacon is supposed to be salty - it was overkill. And what's up with that pool of oil? Flavor rating: 2/5

Uni chawan mushi $6.25 / From the steamed dishes section. This, to us, is an exotic find; we haven't seen it at most restaurants. Also, we can't compare this dish to anywhere else as it's our first time trying it, yet we thought it was exceptionally bland (I apologize in advance if this dish is supposed to be flavored in that manner.) As gorgeous as it was, with the elegant presentation, it wasn't our favorite dish of the evening. The uni flavor was terribly muted and that is a shame. Flavor rating: 2/5

Fresh halibut roll $10.95 / From the sushi rolls section. California roll topped with fluke sashimi, yuzu juice, and natural salt. Extremely simple, however, the fish was very fresh, naturally sweet, and we loved the brightness that the yuzu offered. The surprising sprinkles of salt set off our taste-buds in a explosive direction and we really enjoyed that. Flavor rating: 4/5

We would be curious to return (eventually) to taste their other specials such as the "uni dumplings" or try other popular dishes that our Yelper buddies rave about.

You may find them on a better night than we did - but for the variety seeker, the Izakaya connoisseur, this spot might be a NO-GO.

I thought this was a real nice restaurant and reasonable prices! Seemed like a good place to get a drink because it's homey and comfortable. The food wasn't bad at all, although it does rank 2nd in our book to Soho (which is also closer to us).
Staff was very friendly and helpful and unrushed. If we're in the neighborhood, I would definitely come back here, but otherwise, it's a little far from home

Love this place!!!
1. Great atmosphere
2. The menu has tons of choices that will satisfy anyone in your group
3. It is locally owned and operated by the Chef (Go)

If you are looking for a fun and tasty meal, on a date or with a group of friends this place is a no brainer.

Super disappointed in the experience here. I was so excited by the reviews  Ramen barely had meat, the beef udon soup was okay, sushi roll was falling apart :( The only thing that was tasty was the fried pork. 
On top of that customer service was so bad  They only had 1 menu for 4 people to share. When we asked for a new sushi roll to be made because it was literally falling apart before we picked it up they said "no that's the way it is". When I pointed out the ramen only had two scraps of pork the owner acted like a child. He was unprofessional saying we were causing the problem & asking what our jobs were? Super sad that it wasn't as good as it is cute.

The only problems were with timing.  We made a reservation for 6:30 and they kept us waiting for about 15 minutes after arriving on time.  Then, my daughter's dish came out well after all of the other food even though it was all ordered at the same time.  

To make up for it, they gave us free edamame and ice creams for the children.  

The food was excellent.  We had the udon tempura soup, bacon asparagus, garlic spinach, miso soups, sashimi bowl, soft shelled crab tempura, buttery corn, grilled shrimp and cucumber rolls.  This was almost enough food for the five of us.

We decided to try something off the strip and we were pleasantly surprised that this place exceeded our expectations!  No big name chef here and totally not needed!  The chefs here really know their ingredients and were able to create incredible, flavorful dishes! The waitstaff were beyond attentive and can recommend dishes based on what you like, don't like, or are craving.  We ordered 6+ dishes and enjoyed every bite of them.  The chefs make everything to order so it may take 5min longer than at a fast food joint but take a swig of one of their many imported alcoholic beverages and enjoy the eclectic music they play on the speakers! 

I highly recommend coming here and it seems like the locals do too.  We will definitely be coming back for more next time we're in Vegas!  

And...the bathrooms were clean too!

Ordered enough food to cover 3 tables: we had sashimi, yakitori, udon, sushi, tapas.... Only tried 1/2 of them because my kids move faster with their forks and hands. Well the half that I ate was wonderful, one of the best! If u are in Vegas, don't miss out. If you are in LA, what the heck, just drive!
Love the food and service. Brian was amazing and very friendly. We came after work and had a great time with happy hour and sake! We will be back soon!

The food is good and everything is reasonably priced. From the izakaya menu, we ordered scallops, asparagus, and beef, all were good but a little salty. The beef yaki udon came out on a sizzling plate and was delicious but it had two pieces of beef in it (literally two). I was really excited for the Pok? bowl but the ratio of poke to rice was way off. There was barely any of that delicious tuna in the bowl.

Been to this place twice now and every time I always leave full and happy. The food here is amazing, they have tons of choice some being traditional Japanese food while others are more fusion type. Overall love this place their kara age is juicy and filling and so is the Ramen burger, plus their season fries are perfect. Highly recommend if you're looking for fair priced Japanese food

Some friends brought me here for the happy hour. We ordered a few things off the happy hour menu and they were just okay. Spicy tuna, poke, and California rolls do not excite me. The pumpkin croquette was very tasty though! I saw Tony T.'s review and knew I needed to order the teriyaki chicken set as well. The chicken was nicely grilled and glazed with a teriyaki sauce. The bowl of rice was perfect, and the different sides (miso soup, salad, cold tofu) were very tasty. Be prepared to wait if you come during dinner or happy hour--this restaurant space is tiny.

If I could give zero star I would. There is no host or hostess to manage the waiting list. We were there waiting to be seated long enough to notice that the waiting list doesn't mean anything they will seat you by whatever rules they have. It doesn't go by first come first serve. So please be warned.

Such an amazing experience!!! With the Japanese theme interior to the food..right on!! There was a big kotasu table in the middle for big parties..don't forget to take off your shoes before sitting!! A bar and tables..perfect seating arrangement! The menu was so spread out, with lots of delicious options!! There was a variety of both authentic, fusion and simple meals..and we got a few from each! But my favorite was simple..the ume chazuke!! Felt like I was in Japan on a cold spring morning!! This is a definite return spot!!
One of the best places for Japanese food in Las Vegas. But, everything comes in very small portions.
The 3 kind sashimi and ton katsu was great tasting though the prices don't match the serving size.

YUMMY TAPAS & SOME MAIN DISHES AS WELL! This place can definitely add up at times since the tapas can be small and even though it's a few dollars, it could end being more than you expect. So just be careful when you're getting carried away! 

The beef tongue skewers are delicious as well as their soft crab. There are just way too many good ones to name :( 

I like their combo meals at the back of the menu if I want a full dinner/lunch that will definitely fill me up without the tapas. Their fried rice is delicious as well! I like to add hot sauce obviously to add more flavor!

ALSO, don't forget to check in to get free ice cream. Why would you want to miss that?!
Good came early and beat the dinner crowd everything was delicious. Otoro was awsome along with the kamakazi roll

This is my new favorite Japanese joint in town. 
The menu options were many. Fresh uni, 
Whole fresh fish sashimi style, Ramon, amazing grilled selection okra, Chicken liver, hearts, and a new selection for me sashimi octopus. 
This place is super yummy with great service.

Went here after a Cirque show for a late bite and had a wonderful experience. Had the poke salad, rainbow roll, albacore roll and halibut roll. Food was fresh and delicious and staff are super friendly!

Solid value, chicken cartilage and meatball were both tender.  I also ordered their half bowl of spicy ramen and it was excellent.

The service was on top of everything and were very friendly.  

I only ate some of their selection due to it being a late night meal, but I can definitely see the quality here.  I would recommend coming here, esp for their happy hour menu.

Sevice was pretty bad tonight.  We had to chase after the wait staff to put in more orders.  Food is pretty good though.  Maybe if they didn't seat my friend & I in the back where we were easily forgotten as customers left & emptied the place then maybe they would've served us better.

Super friendly and quick service. Food was on point since we were hungry and ordered 15 items for 3 ppl. Much better than Raku up the street. Btw, when did a traditional izakaya (which is what Raku is) become snooty and self important? Beef tataki was the best item we ordered! Giving 4.75 stars as the gindara and buta kaku were a little salty. Will come back again and again!

Loved the food! Pretty much everything we ordered was yummy. Menu can be a little bit overwhelming, so much to choose from, maybe do a little research before you go. Seats were a little bit uncomfortable, wait staff was very nice, but seemed a little overworked. Loved the manila clams in garlic butter sauce, green mussels, the oysters were very good but it was about $10 for 3 oysters so its pricey. The spicy cracker tuna and poke burrito was also very good. The chocolate cake for dessert was just okay.
Great shoyu ramen, meat was tender and juicy. It was such a comfort to drink some soup after a long night clubbing.
Legit izakaya! Everything was delicious and service was impeccable. Great new spot! Can't wait to go back when I'm visiting!

Who would have thought you could get such authentic Izakaya in a strip mall off the Strip in LV?  The setting itself is cozy and reminded me of a Japanese restaurant, not some linoleum covered fast food joint.  We ordered a variety of dishes and all were very tasty.  The service was excellent.  It wasn't busy but you could still tell they wanted us to enjoy our meal.  

Restaurants like these are the best reason to rent a car in Vegas--get out of the casinos with their overpriced food.  I would definitely go back.

Excellent, Good Price, Fresh Food

Izakaya is excellent.  The service was good.  I would highly recommend this place.  I was a little hesitant to try it after experiencing Kyara and being let down, but it was a great experience.  The oysters were fresh and tasty.  The sashimi was excellent.  The small dishes were great!  I'm looking to coming back again and trying all the other dishes.  So far, I've tried the corn, enoki butter, oysters, sashimi (5 ways), uni dumplings (yum!), asparagus with bacon, and probably some other dishes that I'm forgetting.

Overall great experience here. A bit of a wait to be seated but the staff handled that with ease. Quite a lot of small dishes on the menu, but everything was tasty. Well varied happy hour menu with perfectly cooked dishes. Agedashi tofu and tuna belly skewers stood out in particular. Good choice of tasty Japanese whiskeys as well as fruity drink options for the more sweet inclined. As a lover of all things sweet, I would recommend the lychee soju in particular. Would gladly come again.

I came here because I was looking for good Okonomiyaki in Las Vegas. The Okonomiyaki here was excellent. Everything else was really good too- sashimi was fresh and I could tell that food was prepared with quality in mind. I will be back!

Izakaya Go was a no for me with their Shoyu Ramen. I will explain in a bit. 

My sister suggested that we try out the place so I went with her. First off, the ambiance was very casual and this place has some points for some of its aesthetic decorations. Service was very prompt and great. We were quickly asked if my sister and I have been served and brought out waters. 

They have a Happy Hour menu starting at 10pm- closing. I wasn't really in the mood to try much this night so this may be a disadvantage in the review for everything else. But after experiencing many other ramen places, I would not go here for ramen if that's what you're looking for. 

Their Shoyu ramen is made with egg noodle and come with bamboo as the topping and a half cooked egg. As in my photo, you could tell that it was lacking variety. The broth was very flat and one dimensional. 

I forgot what the dessert was called, but it was made with green tea pancake sandwich with red beans and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. If you like green tea unsweetened than you'll enjoy the green tea bitter after taste. I took a scoop of the red beans and vanilla ice cream with the green tea pancake and you get an un-orchestrated concoction of taste. The vanilla ice cream over powered everything. 

On a side note I was told to try their tuna dishes and poke salad, so I may come back next time with a bigger appetite to try other things on the menu. 

IMHO I would rather go to Ichiza... But I'm willing to give this place a try again some other time.

Husband and I went on a Monday night so it wasn't too busy and a lot of parking was available. Upon entering, a nice gentleman welcomed and immediately seated us. It's a small, quaint restaurant, a lot of booths and tables that can seat more than it looks. My husband was surprised the horigotatsu could seat more than 8 people! It was both our first time there so we weren't sure what to expect. The employees were very fast, our orders came out almost immediately. And that was awesome because I was starving! lol. I was excited to try the uni pasta, chawan mushi, and well...pretty much everything. ;) their uni pasta was $17 and it came in a generous portion. It was creamy and filling. They gave a generous amount of uni topping. The chawan mushi was really good as well. My husband enjoyed it (it was his first time). I enjoyed every single dish that we ordered. We will definitely be back again. Checking in on yelp also scored us a free ice cream! I opted for the green tea ice cream and it was the perfect dessert to end our date night.

I consider myself a sushi snob, and I am definitely a fan of this place.  Not your traditional sushi place, they have tapas-style plates and exotic Japanese dishes you normally don't see at a Japanese resturant.  I tried a few things on the menu: spicy tuna rice cracker was amazing!  Also tried the white fish tempura - it was super delicious.  I loved the tempura batter; it was seasoned nicely and was crisp and light. The chicken Karaage was tender on the inside and crunchy outside. The sashimi was high quality, the fish selection fresh and buttery. I'm definitely be back for more!

Great little spot, seating is limited and crowded but the food is great and the service is good. Definitely need a reservation if you come on the weekends or in the afternoon as it gets pretty busy. I don't think you can do  anything larger than a party of 4 unless you book the large seating area in advance. They have a good selection of a la carte items/tapas style. My teriyaki salmon was good just a tad bit over cooked. Overall, I love the atmosphere and its intimate setting.

Wow! So glad I found this place. Had some customers tell me about it and decided to stop in - the menu options are incredible! Wasn't too hungry, but I fully devoured the Albacore Jalapeño and Tiger Shrimp. The sauces they were in were both incredible and I had to scoop them up with my shrimp tails till the plates were dry! Really, really reasonably priced for a place this close to the Strip too. Highly recommended!

This place is great late night especially when you had a long day at work. Not only that but they offer happy hour. We thought the portions would be small considering how cheap it is, but they're actually fulfilling! Staff was very warm & friendly as well. Restaurant is really small but I noticed you can call in advance & make reservations! I'll be back soon!

This is my probably my 6th visit for the past 6 months and always an excellent experience. Great food with so many choices!! They are getting so busy that you need to make a reservation now!! Owner GO is always so friendly!! Highly recommended!!

I thoroughly enjoyed stopping here for dinner after work one day. I love that it is small and reminds me of those small restaurants that you seen the alleys of Tokyo. The food was very good and the selections were great. There's some things that you crave that aren't on every menu in a Japanese restaurant such as cheese corn done right. I would definitely come back here again.

Overrated.  The Shu Mai was frozen,  we sent it back...warm and still gross.  We ordered 10 things and only were good.   The otoro and garlic shrimp.  Pick the things you can do right and narrow down the menu accordingly.  Also, the service was less than stellar.

Well  I Stumbled upon this Japanese tapa place by china town after I couldn't wait anymore longer at the long line at pho Kim long during the holiday craziness.... 
I was still looking for some hot soup, the tok kosh spicy ramen was more than satisfying! One of the best ramen I have had in Vegas, the broth was not so salty and the noodles were very fresh, great flavor. 

We also got some skewers to try, my personal favorite was the shiitake mushrooms!

The server did a good job selling the catch of the day menu, we got the barracuda I believe.. the sashimi fish was incredibly fresh, cheaper than most American sea food restaurants too.

The dessert was the cheese cake with yazu? Server said the cheese cake is made in house, it was fresh and delicious and just the right amount of sweetness.

This place was a lucky find..would definitely come back again

Im very disappointed:( I really like this place because all of the staff are very nice and the food is  fresh. 

We've been coming here a lot and I even introduced this place to my family even after so many disappointments. Lets just say almost every time we come here theres always something wrong except for our first visit.


So previous visitS...

-found hair (our server offered us  free appetizer as an apology)
-Waited TOO long for the food to come in (about 40mins and ramen wasnt even served yet. Also rice took extra 10mins)  btw its busy but not too busy to the point theres waiting list. 
-fruit fly on our water (its okay since they cant really control that)

Tonight's visit...(ordered for pick up)
-gave us miso ramen instead of tonkotsu (went back to get the right one) We werent mad or anything....once we got home and opened all the food...-REALLY small portion of takowasabi (I always order that so I know)
-found hair

I was just a lil irritated cause so many things happened in one order :(

I love their food so I cant give them bad rating. Im just unfortunate when it comes to ordering food.

Seriously it's just okay. Small pieces, omakase presentation is non existent, miso marinated salmon was salty, and the mochi ice cream...the mochi is supposed to be chewy and soft but it was like plastic. I was so hoping they would ask if everything was okay but never did. The only thing that was good, but really, how can you go wrong with tuna rolls and kake udon? At least the kids were fine until the dessert came out.

The white, rainbow-esque, shiny pearl bed of the grilled oyster sitting in front of me, littered with diced scallions like the end of a Game of Thrones battle scene is a testament to the grandeur chef behind the line, sweating no-less, and his skill that would vault him to the seat of any throne. Bravo! 

I'd like to empty my stomach for a 2nd go-around, please.

My wife and I endured the brutal, laboring task of consuming a bill totaling $100 (which should have cost $500 based on taste and experience!). 

If you dare to come to the City of Sin, A La Vegas, I-z-a-k-a-y-a G-o!

I came here with a party of 16 during happy hour and the service was wonderful. I love the atmosphere here--Japanese with reggae vibes. It definitely brought me back to Okinawa. The food was also great. Everything was perfectly portioned, reasonably priced, and delicious. My boyfriend and I ordered Japanese curry with braised pork belly, salmon flake onigiri, spicy salmon cutroll, and tuna belly steak. Everything was so good. Between the two of us, there was a lot of food to keep us full and satisfied, all for $27 (happy hour prices)! I also tried a bite of my friend's okonomiyaki, and it was amazing! If you check in on Yelp, you get a free scoop of ice cream. I got the green tea ice cream and I loved it. It was probably the best green tea ice cream I've had in a long time. Overall, I really enjoyed my experience here. I will definitely be back in the future. Thanks Izakaya Go!

Great saki great food great customer service 
 favorite was the deep fried halibut, and pork cheek. Best Japanese tapas I've had in a long time

Had this bookmarked for quite some time for when in Sin City.  Finally made our way there last night and boy am I glad we did.

It was pretty busy upon arriving and had to write our name on a waiting list.  We checked out their menu while waiting, and we were super excited to get a table and try out their eats.  

We started off with the Hawaiian Tuna Belly Steak, Scallop yakitori, and 3 kind sashimi platter.  
(We had salmon, yellowfin, and maguro on the sashimi platter--okay portioned.)  
The tuna belly was BOMB and so were the scallops.  We also tried their Miso Ramen and Octopus balls.  The ramen was slurpin good. The octopus balls presented well with bonito flakes that waved and moved like the dish was alive, but they were so-so.  We also got the grilled whole squid and that was BOMB as well.  

All in all, I shall be back here soon the next time I am in Vegas!

The host was great and professional.  The selections salon the menu are large. There is enough to choose from to satisfy every guests tastes.

We ordered a sashimi sampler which was probably the best thing we picked.  5 items for $19.99. It tasted great even on Sunday. Service was fast and most of the food came out promptly. 

The only item we were disappointed by was the dynamite.I can only believe that the cook forgot to put in the seafood.  All I can scoop up was a couple of shreds of mushrooms. The rest was mayo.

The ramen is serviceable . The udon was good. This place has a good vibe and a good change of pace for someone who wants to venture away from the strip.

This is our favorite Japanese place whenever we're in Vegas. Pretty authentic, and reasonably priced. Not cheap, but good Japanese food don't come cheap. We usually stick to the traditional menu, chawanmushi for me, okonomiyaki, takoyaki and some kind of grilled fish for hubby. Tried some of the new menu, not much of a fan there. There's usually too much mayonnaise, and strange fusion of ingredients. Chef is trying to be innovative, but we are just conservative and like the standard stuff.

One of the best Sushi quality for the price I have ever had. Very good atmosphere, great beers, great desserts (did I say it's cheap!). Easy parking outside, happy hour and close late, I can't ask for anything more.

I love this place. Its not too fancy or hip or trendy Just a great place to go to for a drink and some bites after work or on the late night. Their happy hour is awesome and the uni pasta dish is a great deal and even better quality. They have pretty much everything that I crave for in regards to japanese food, and everything I've tried has not disappointed. All at very reasonable prices. Izakaya Go see for yourself.

Absolutely love this place. Hubby brought me in for our anniversary loved the service and the food. The owner is very nice!! Took the time to talk to us and recommend some dishes. Will def come back again

Fantastisk japansk sted i Las Vegas med happy hour-priser på maden og virkelig gode kreative retter, som jeg klart kommer til at drømme mig tilbage til igen og igen. Det kan være lidt svært at komme derhen, hvis du bor et stykke væk fra Chinatown (jeg vil anbefale taxa), men det er alt muligt transporttid værd. 

Og hvis/når(!!) du så kommer af sted, må du love mig at prøve deres ramen burger - for pokker altså hvor var den god. Et bomstærkt bevis på at ramen burgere ikke bare er en ny smart madtrend, men faktisk noget med hold og bid i og alt det der. Sushien er frisk og sindssyg happy hour-billig (Spicy tuna-rulle til 4 dollars. Er det overhovedet muligt?) 

OG så må du love mig én ting til; Deres edamame-bønner med trøffel. Wow! Det smagte bare usandsynligt godt. Suppen jeg fik til hovedret var desværre ikke noget særligt, og den er den eneste grund til at stedet ikke får fire stjerner, for alt andet var bare perfekt, stemningen dejlig casual og positiv og priserne nogle, man kun kan klappe af. (Og ja ramen burgeren var min medspisers. (øv!) Den mandlige tjener var i øvrigt super cool og hyggeligt at tale med.

Mit tip: undgå suppen og gå all in på resten - så kan det kun blive en god aften. De har også sake-drinks og øl lavet på sweet potato, hvis du er klar på nyt eventyr på væskefronten.

So we sat at the bar, which I like because I love scoping places cook and make sushi . Our server was nice, gave us a bunch of good recommendations. I liked this place because it was small plates/ Tapas style and we were able to share a lot of different things.

Place is cute, small but charming. Decent wine and alcohol options. 

Ordered:

Pork cheeks- good! But ours felt slightly over cooked 
Halibut roll- super fresh and delicious
Spanish bluefin - very happy with 
Hamachi - comes w/ jalapeño and tomato slices. The jalapeño on this were HOT
Kimchi pork- really enjoyed but could have been more spicy
Chicken skewer w/ plum sauce- cooked good- didn't love the plum sauce. 

The menu has SO many options. I'm looking forward to going back and trying more.

I'm picky. This place is chef-driven but laid back and consistently brings the A game. Every time I visit Vegas, I eat here. It is small and in an unassuming strip center. Don't let that fool you. The food is on par with NY and LA. Amazing.

We've been meaning to try Izakaya Go but usually just end up at Ichiza. I took my parents here when they were in town and it was a pleasant experience. It's a very small restaurant and we waited about 10-15 min for a table on a Friday night. We started off with mugi shochu (a Japanese alcohol made from barley.) I can't find anywhere in town that sells it except a few restaurants so I always try to take advantage. Ask for it on the rocks it's very mild but similar to vodka or sake.

We ordered a bunch of little plates to share:

Okonomiyaki: seafood pancake. It's usually a lot thinner than it was served here but everyone agreed the texture was perfect. It was spongy and had a great ratio of batter to filling. A little heavy on the sauce but still good. A good portion size too for sharing.

Karaage: standard fried chicken but served with mayonnaise, interestingly. The seasoning was a lot heavier than I've ever had it but it was great. 

Kimchi tofu: one of the highlights. The flavor was amazing. It was served in a bed of broth with tempura crunchies inside. The mix of textures and the sour kimchi was perfection.

Shoga yaki: I've never had this before but loved it. It's stir fried pork with ginger. If I wasn't very hungry I would have just ordered this with a side of rice.

Tsukemono: I love tsukemono (Japanese pickled vegetables) And the waiter was impressed we actually ordered it. It's a great palate cleanser and very refreshing.

Hamachi Kama: Always a must have at izakayas. It's yellow tail collar. Mix in the daikon with the soy broth. You can pick at the collar for a long time and still get some good meat.

Yakisoba: Probably wouldn't order this again. Very similar to the shoga yaki with the vegetables used and felt a little heavy at this point in the meal. 

Crunch roll: standard crunch roll. Small order though so it wasn't too filling. 

Overall I liked Izakaya Go. Their menu isn't as adventurous as Ichiza but it has all the right stuff. I could definitely come back for some shochu and skewers. The night we went they were out of a lot of the skewers we wanted to try so we skipped that. It's also very close to the Strip compared to the rest of Chinatown so I'd recommend for tourists staying at the Wynn or somewhere nearby.

Great place, good service, all the servers had a positive attitude! 

The food was great. We tried the appetizers clams and soft shell crab.

Main course was some udon soups and the yakisoba noodles. Their rolls were just right with just amount of rice. 

Will definitely come back!

This is a nice little tapas bar. It's recommended for large parties to get a reservation because they can get very busy and are only a  70 capacity. Any of the skewers were very good. I highly recommend the pork belly, because it's crispy, smoky, and satisfying. Very friendly staff and if you sit at the bar you can see your food being prepared.
Excellent sushi spot. I love their tuna it's some of the best in the area. Easy parking and not too crazy inside. If you want be best service sit at the bar, chefs will just keep it coming

Came here because of a Restaurant.com deal because I didn't want to eat at the standard touristy joints on the strip since we were going to be here for just 2 days. I am glad we made it here. The service was very friendly and very fast. The food was very authentic and at a very reasonable price, even without the Restaurant.com deal. I would gladly come back here on my next trip into town.

Three times in 2  weeks... it's our new favorite spot to unwind to tasty dishes Izakaya style. Here is what I've tried so far and what I think of the dishes.

Takoyaki - a ball shape dough cooked in a special pan stuffed with a perfect piece of octopus, this place by far serves the best one I've ever had in Vegas. 5 stars

Grilled Tuna Belly (from the special's board) top quality fish grilled to perfection and lightly seasoned so the natural taste of the tuna stands out and with a not so over powering Ponzu Sauce was pretty good just unfortunately ours was a bit raw on the side almost made it felt like we were eating a seared fish but we still ate it all because it was still tasty. 4.3 stars

 Uni Chawan Mushi is their egg custard with veggies topped with sea urchin was just amazing. Very gentle and subtle to the palate with the combination chosen. Better word for it... comfort food like a Japanese version of chicken noodle soup for the soul 5 stars

Deep Fried Chicken Cartilage might not be for everyone. But if you're like me who loves that part of the chicken then this is a must order! If you have eaten this before then you'll know what the texture is all about but it's battered and deep fried so it's masked and once you eat it... it's so weird in a good way. By far my favorite thing to order every time I go here 5 stars

Deep Fried Octopus it's octopus and it's deep fried... need I say more? The mayo dipping sauce was a bit too much for me I prefer it with just the lemon and seasoning in tbh 4.4 stars

Karage Chicken at the time when I ordered it, I felt it was a bit heavy on the salty side. I had to squeeze 2 lemons to balance out that sharp salty taste from my tongue. Maybe I just had a bad batch thay night.  I'll order it again to see if it changes 3.4 stars

Still have more foods to review... will post when I get the time .. lol

Don't forget to say hi to Go, he's amazing and I believe owns the place. His soothing choice of music to play reggae in his restaurant has me coming back for more because it's just so laid back, perfect lighting,  good vibes, alcohol, no tv so you can actually conversate with people you're with there and you can't go wrong with his prices. Let's just say I've been going here once a week and it's definitely not my last :)

I love love love this place. My favorite is the salmon sashimi, and the uni tray is so fresh! I always come here with my husband and friends every week. The atmosphere is so casual and you can spend hours here without even realizing it. The staff is always so friendly and attentive. They always greet me by name when I go! Brian is the best ever! He's so nice and funny! Hahaha. I'll be eating here for years to come!

JUST LIKE HONDAYA IZAKAYA IN CALI

**2017 Yelp 100 Challenge LV #12**

I have literally been WAITING to try this place out and I FINALLY got the chance this year & it was great!!  It was just like Hondaya in Tustin, CA which I have been really wishing would come to vegas so I didn't have to keep choosing that place every time I go back home. 

Service was an INTERESTING start.... not too friendly... but once I started to order things got different. All the staff were smiling & coming by to check up on us. They all greeted us bye very loud & genuinely.

Atmosphere is just how I would have imagined it. Wood furniture w/ cushions & has that whole Japanese late-night bar hangout place. Plus they are open late so it's my go-to after a hard day's work!!! 

Now since they are a tapas style.... this is what I ordered.

PUMPKIN CROQUETTE $1.50
AGE DASHI MOCHI $3.95
DEEP FRIED SOFT SHELL SHRIMP $6.50
GRILLED MOCHI W/ COD ROE CHEESE $5.95
SAUTEED BUTTER MUSHROOMS $4.95
LIVE FRESH OCTOPUS $14.95 - ehhh I wouldn't order it again  
HALIBUT CARPACCIO W/ UNI $14.95
SEA URCHIN PASTA $- lots of UNI flavor yummm
TRUFFLED BUTTER CORN ON HOT PAN $4.95- definitely pass on this one cuz it has NO TRUFFLE taste at all
DEEP FRIED SQUID LEGS - their squid legs are perfect!
GRILLED HAMACHI KAMA $10.95
QUAIL EGG W/ BACON $2.50
CHICKEN GIZZARD $2.25
CHEESE DUMPLING $3.95
DEEP FRIED WHOLE HALIBUT
SALMON TARTAR $3.95
GRILLED ROCK OYSTER - these are freaken HUGE!!!JUICYY
GIANT CLAM SASHIMI $8.95
SEA URCHIN SASHIMI $18 - they give you this cute little wooden plate filled w/uni!! Love it 

There is so much more but I will post in pictures instead.
Excellent service!! Food and happy hour price is awesome!! $5 for Ramen, can't beat it. Plus free ice cream for using yelp check in. They also give Military Discount. Highly recommended!!

Ramen soup addiction cannot be countered by anything else. Okay well I haven't given any sushi a chance here. I don't even know how extensive their sushi menu is since my eyeballs search directly for the ramen noodles; aside from their skewer apps since it's on a separate piece of paper.

Shiyo and Miso ramen are checked off my list. Next up Shoyu and Tonkatsu. The waitress mentioned they have Tonkatsu ramen now ooooooh :×D. I was able to order with the hot oil on the side. It's a killer spicy level and didn't need much to cause nose dripping... No not in my bowl thilly wabbits.

I save the egg for last. Not sure why I do it but always eaten after all my noodles are gone. Please don't watch me too closely when I eat ramen. Uuuuh you'll find me sifting through what's left of the broth trying to get every last bit of noodle. Warning: it might annoy you. 

On their skewer appetizer list, we've stuck to the greens: okra, asparagus, zucchini. For a chubby treat we tried bacon wrapped okra. Seven seconds off our lives for each bacon strip? I dunno, then there goes almost half a minute. I think swallowing chewed gum is worse.

So cute in this place. The center of the seating area has a large table for traditional Japanese dining... I think... Cuz guests removed their shoes. But then again I might've seen them sitting properly as if on a bench. It's a cool addition to a dining experience here. This particular table area in the center is like the centerpiece to the rest of the restaurant.

Haven't tried sake yet - surprising myself with that since I used to go sake tasting in the OC quite a bit. So they've got an assortment of bottles displayed on the corner wall and behind the bar. The beers are Kirin and Asahi.

We've been served by the same two people each visit. Just want to acknowledge their hard work. Service is good considering how busy. Keep up the friendliness and smiles. You're doing a fine job.

Looking forward to the next dining splurge. I almost went again tonight. However I didn't want to bore my appetite even though I kept thinking of their ramen noodle soup.

The current Yelp rating speaks for itself. Diners love it - always full house every time I've dropped in. Yaaaay full bellies!!! Stay happyyyyy!

Great late night find! Vast menu, excellent selection, everything we tried was tasty and delicious! Prices are phenomenally low, great value! Conveniently location not far off the I15, far away enough from the strip but not too far that it's a pain to get to. Highly recommended; will definitely be back!
This place is absolutely Delicious! The ramen burger and super crunch burrito were so flavorful. I would come back.

Great Izakaya place in town! Awesome food and staff! Make sure u call for reservations if ur coming in because they're always packed!  They have an extensive amount of fresh fish and sake!  Me and my girlfriend frequent this place a lot and have a great experience every time!  If you're on the braver side and want to try something u never had before, just ask the owner GO what's he's got off the menus  ENJOY!!

Pretty decent place, the service here is very good.  Servers check in with you often, patient in answering questions, detailing the menu.  We went late night, they have a HH from 10PM - close, great prices.
We got a bunch of stuff to share:
- Tonkatsu & shio ramens (come spicy so if you don't like spicy request mild. These were ok, your basic ramen soup. Nothing special)
- Yaki soba (way too sweet, wasn't a fan)
- Poke hand roll (basic, pretty good)
- Tuna Tartare Yukke (surprisingly pretty spicy, great flavors w/ imitation crab meat underneath and chunks of avocado, raw egg on top)
- Pork belly yakitoro (very basic. Grilled pork on a skewer w/ a lime. No special seasonings)
- Bream sashimi (not on HH menu, but best thing we ordered. Very fresh, then they take the bones and deep fry for you and bring back. You also have the option of making it into a miso fish bone soup)

All in all - pretty good place. Would come back, especially for the HH prices!
This is my first destination every time I come to LAS. Out of all of the great places to eat in this town this ranks as one of the top 10!

Food is a little bit above average and the prices are reasonable.  What i felt was lacking was the quality of the fish.   I wouldn't say it's the freshest but i didn't feel the quality was a miss.   I just felt that the sushi slices were thinner than most places.  But at least the portion of the food was a decent size so you are getting a bigger bang for your buck.  You also can make reservation so you can avoid the wait.  This place does get packed so come early or you will have to wait.   The servers were nice and attentive.  They came back a couple of times to refill our tea and glass.  

Don't order the chirashi bowl.  They don't give you much fish and the fish wasn't fresh.  My fiancé ordered the udon and he loved it.   He finished even the soup.   lol...   

I would come back here for the quantity and reasonable price of the food.

The food I ordered was mediocre! Beef tongue was chewy. Kawanmuchi was pretty good though. The food took a while to bring out to our table! Some of the servers was very nice but some  wasn't! I won't be back. I will stay at all favorite next time on our visit!
They have variety of food with some exotic ones. Portion is small - tapas style. Price is reasonable

Recommended: 
Uni wanzen
Grilled black cod
Pork face

No need to wait for a seat, it is a new spot!

One of our favorite restaurant in Las Vegas trip?
I recommend to book ahead since it's a small Place.

My friends brought me to this place for the first time and I fell in love with the aesthetic atmosphere and the type of food they serve. I finally got to try the pork belly but it was great! Pork belly's usually doesn't last long so take that into consideration. Another great thing about this place is that they are open late. Also happy hour is 10pm - close (2am or 3am) It's a perfect after work type of place! Staff has been always friendly to me and even make me laugh at points.
Very enjoyable experience and I would recommend anyone that loves tapas, sushi, great backgrounds and a nice environment to go check out this place.

This review is for 4.5 stars.

I went back for Happy Hour again, tried new meals, and had a great time, so I had to up my review a bit.  The waiter was awesome and gave great recommendations, all off the Happy Hour menu, so he wasn't trying to upsell or anything.  And again, the saki deal for $4 is just too good.  Cold, hot, both - I'll be back.  And it's about 10 minutes from downtown so a great pregame if you're in the Japanese mood for your alcohol fix.

Got my favorite appetizer Tako Wasabi here! Really cool spot to spend your Saturday night here. 

The price is moderate, the only thing thing I can say is maybe give Kyara a try if you want to make a drive to the restaurant, if not this is a good location in Chinatown area!!
Love this little joint. Recommend to anyone that is in Vegas and looking for a good Japanese place to grub without paying Vegas price!
Food was good, but food service was not.  Two of our 5 meals were magically ready after we asked for our bill.
One of my top 2 izakaya places in Las Vegas. Great selection, quality and service. Rarely a wait for a seat. Five stars for the Uni pasta, but be sure to share as it's a very rich tasting dish.

Worth the wait for happy hour!  hubby got the tuna steak which was delicious! He also enjoyed the deep fried shrimp skewers. Half bowls of ramen are always good. That's what we got our daughter  best believe mama got a Kirin draft!  lol I also got the tako wasa but it's not on happy hour. Anyways I like it for happy hour.

This was our last meal before the flight back home.  I am glad we went here (even though a good amount of food is seafood). We ordered family style which included many yakitori sticks and lots of sharing items including the chef's choice, waygu carpaccio, salmon carpaccio, tuna steak, grilled squid, soft shell crab, tuna roll...etc

The place is not that large, but has that cozy feeling to it. The service is a bit choppy at times as they were pretty busy inside. We didn't mind that too much as long as the food kept on coming.

Finally tried this restaurant! ( went there few times but always packed) Absolute love it!!! Whatever I tried, they all great!!!! 
Tried few of this kind Japanese bar food restaurants but never really impressed by them. (Expensive and taste just ok!) But somewhere somehow, everything we ordered, we all love it!!!!!
Three of us ( big guys) we spent around $160. Not really a cheap dinner or late night supper! But I will definitely go back there!!!

The only reason I give this place less than 4 or 5 is because we were there earlier than just about everybody else but our food came later than everybody else's buy a while. The food was quite good though other than the sushi burrito, that I could have done without. The ramen was cooked to perfection and the large sake for $3.25 was quite a deal.
A nice change of pace off the Vegas strip.  Comfort food and a laid back atmosphere but great service.

My friend and I went here because it was late, and I was craving some takoyaki. The staff were nice, we were welcomed and they said goodbye. Our server was attentive and patient, I don't remember her name but she was great.
     Since I came late, they have a special discounted menu, which had some great deals. I ended up ordering a half Miso ramen for $5 and the truffle edamame for $4. I also tried my friend's order of the takoyaki. The ramen was well worth the money, and it came with pork, a piece of nori, and an half an egg. The edamame was buttery, and the flavor is subtle. The takoyaki was delicious, it's about 6 pieces for $6.
     I would recommend this place if you aren't too hungry, and have a friend. It can get pretty expensive if you order too much. The traditional and fun Japanese atmosphere/theme makes for a good social spot.

We've been coming here quite frequently and its always quite an experience every time!  The service of this food (not to also mention the food from Chef Andi) are amazing.  They're a super friendly bunch and always try to be accommodating to ur needs.  They're daily fishes are always great and the other foods, magnificent.  They have a pretty large menu so they can cater to a lot of different palates.  Make sure you call in to make a reservation because they can me slammed any any given time.  They're open late so early dinner or late night dining, they got it covered.  Don't even get me started on the sake selection, lets just say I haven't tasted one that I don't like.
