We liked the ambience, food, service, menu depth, price... There is not much not to like about the place! Sashimi is amazing and lower priced than competition. Braised pork belly is amazing. Server was very helpful. One of the best Japanese places we have been in a while.

Izakaya is a type of what Japanese would call bar food. It's the type of stuff you would eat with beer or drinking in general with friends. But they have more than just your typical Japanese bar food. They have full on entrees and other foods you can go for, but that's not what the purpose of my visit was. 

Depending on what you get, it can start to add up. I think our bill between two people was around $90 hahaha but we also got some of the more expensive stuff on the menu though. 

We got a bunch of stuff off the yakitori menu.....like one of each at least if not two. They were all pretty good, nothing too special to note, just really get what you like. This is where the price starts to add up, it gets pretty expensive when each skewer is around $2-$3 and they're not filling on their own. 

We also got the delicacy sashimi plate which consisted of sea squirt ovary, wasabi herring roe, and salmon kidney. We were told to eat it in that order. All I can say is the experience was interesting and I'd do it again. It's one of those things you should try at least once in your life. 

You can usually tell how good a place is by their karaage. Theirs was decent at best, I didn't really expect much but most places offer ketchup with it and instead they offered mayonnaise. Just note that Japanese ketchup and mayonnaise are totally different in flavor from American ones. 

Overall it was a good place. I'll definitely look forward to the next time I go and try other stuff off their menu.

Fabulous, just fabulous. The sashimi was fresh, generous portions and everything was tasty to the palette. My girlfriend who lives here in Vegas took us here tonight and we will be back!  Service was excellent, our waitress was polite and always came around to make sure we were happy.

Talk about a low key spot that has really good food and great service. This has been added to our "sema week must eat " places without a doubt. They have the best miso salmon bowl i have ever had in my life! Hands down a must order! Their poke is fresh , the jalapeño poppers are mouth drooling. And honestly i forgot a few names of the stuff i ordered but i saved the pictures to order it again next time i am in town.

Why go here? Their ramen is sour and their chicken wings are burnt plus their food is overall bad. Plus the staff didn't care about any of it. Not mad.... just disappointed. Think they bought their ratings....
This place is so good, worth every penny! The service and food is on point! One of the best Japanese food I've had since moving here from Hawaii!

Went here on a Friday night with some friends and I have to say it was a pretty good experience! The atmosphere was lively and that positive energy just made the experience even better. We got to sit on cushions on the floor and even took off our shoes which was an interesting experience lol. 

I ordered the Tonkatsu dinner plate which came with a bunch of things like: tofu, 2 pieces of gyoza, rice, miso soup, potato salad, salad, and obviously the tonkatsu lol. The tonkatsu was really crispy and flavorful and it left me wanting more! The gyoza tasted different compared to other ones I have tried, but it was tasty for only having vegetables inside of it. One of my friends didn't like it because of a weird tangy taste. My least favorite component of the meal was the tofu because it just tasted like a bland, firm block lol.

There is also a check in deal for free ice cream so I definitely took advantage of that and got a scoop of green tea ice cream. It was a nice finishing touch a delicious meal (who doesn't love free dessert?!).

Overall, you guys should check this place out if you have a group of people looking for a lively place to have dinner. I only paid about $15-16 for a bunch of food which left me full afterwards. Considering that this is an izakaya, that is pretty good. I be back next time to try some other dishes!
Food was good, but serving sizes were not commensurate to the price, especially the sashimi platters--would list this place as a 3 $$$ vs the $$. The combo platters are good value though.

Four of my friends and I went here last night and we ordered lots of different things. The edamame was good and the hamachi Kama was amazing! But the ramen they got was undercooked and the poke wasn't good either :( we also ordered salmon nigiri and the salmon was really fishy. I've never had salmon nigiri taste like that and gummy ever! they also forgot to bring my friends rice and when they brought out the checks separate, it was all wrong and some items were on the others.

They didn't bring our food together and they didn't bring all the checks together either. The service was not great. I'm willing to try it again though next time hopefully it'll be better ?

Izakaya Go is located in Chinatown; Valley View and Spring mountain. It is a great place for  an authentic Japanese tapas food experience. The place is small but trendy. You have a good view of the kitchen where you can see the chefs working. 

The menu offers a wide variety of mouth-watering starters, sushi burritos and traditional dishes. All the food we ordered were exquisite. I have to say the Ramen burger was different and something we never had before and was very delicious. It had a fried egg and a large piece of pork cooked to tender with large portion of seasoned fries that taste like sweet potato goodness. A standout for me was the fresh octopus ball.  It came in six and they had a nice flavor and as you chew it had different textures. The Poki "Burrito" was fresh as well. The portion is bigger then a typical sushi rolls, and instead of tortilla a sheet of nori seaweed with rice help contained all the ingredients. Deep Fried Soft Shell Crab served with ponzu sauce was fresh and crispy with a light batter and so was the fried baby octopus. You also get  a cup of complementary green tea in the end.

The seafood were fresh and flown in from Japan. They have a wide selection of sake. However, they did not carry Kurosawa which is one of our favorite but did get an equivalent kind called Kikusui Junmai Ginjo.
The servers were welcoming and attentive. 
The only thing I would advise is the music, they were playing Reggae when we were there. I would suggest to make it authentic is to play Japanese music.
I would recommend this place and would definitely return and try something new.

Excellent food and service! 

The atmosphere was fun for a Thursday evening with Reggae tunes playing in the background and the hum of chatter filling the air.

The staff provided a high chair for our toddler and were so accommodating to toddler requests for additional napkins, dropped cutlery, etc. This was the best service I've experienced in Vegas. 

The food was a veritable delight. The food quality and flavours were on point. 

I enjoyed all the dishes but here are some I loved : 

Aga Dashi Mochi 
Shrimp with garlic chilli 
Shishito peppers 
Pork cheek with ginger scallions 
Grilled Lamb chop 

Check in on Yelp for a free ice cream. I got the green tea ice cream.

I come here for their Yakitori. My favorites are chicken gizzards, chicken hearts and liver because not many places serve those in Vegas. All of their Yakitori chicken skewers are absolutely delicious!! I wish they were open for lunch time...
Last time I ordered fried chicken cartilage (torinan) and it was very greasy for some reason. I've had better in Ichiza. Sad.
This place is always so busy so sometimes my Yakitori order takes more than 20 minutes to come out. It's worth the wait though!!
Right off I-15. I always have hard time parking.

Wow... what else can I say? This is a small little restaurant that is easy to miss. We walked in and it was very cramped with the tables close together and very little wiggle room. It's a tight but very pleasant atmosphere. The first thing they do is give you a LOT of menus, I think we had 3-4 on our table for both of us. It's really confusing at first, but once you sort through what each menu is for, then you can start to make decisions. 

We started with the Octopus Carpaccio and it was absolutely amazing (see picture). It is pricey, but worth the experience. It was thinly sliced and not chewy at all. Whatever they do to it makes it well worth the price. For our main course, we had the ramen and it was wonderful as well. Lasty, we had some Eel yakitori which was heavenly (see picture). 

Another thing worth mentioning is the Green Tea. I don't know what they do to make it taste so good, but it's the best Green Tea I have ever had (and I usually don't like Green Tea).

Lastly, don't be in a rush here. When you order something, keep in mind that they are making it from scratch and you may have to wait a bit. When we ordered the Eel, it took about 15 minutes to get it (at it wasn't very busy). So... have some patience and you will be rewarded handsomely with some of the best food.
Great food for late night! Cheap beer, great cocktails, and lots of small plate food to eat. Definitely recommend it for smaller groups. I love the fish and chips and curry rice with cheese.

This place beats allllllll ramen places in Houston, tx. Lol not only was the ramen delicious but their service was incredible! They were all incredibly nice. After asking them what their favorite ramen was and failing to have the full ingredients our waitress AND the chef apologized. Lol it was so unnecessary but still a kind gesture. The whole outlook of the place was nice also. I wish we could have a place like this in Houston

Following the decline of one of my favorite restaurants in town, I thought I would never smile again.

Izakaya Go has me smiling once more.

Every restaurant scene in any respectable city has to have a good selection of tapas joints (among other things of course). I am especially fond of the "small plate" joints as I tend to be a light eater, yet I love trying many items at once. Japanese tapas has always been on the top of my restaurant list because, well let's admit it, the Japanese just do food better than anyone.

We stopped in late night for a small snack before heading home. Of course as always, I ended up eating way more than I should have. 

While I thoroughly enjoyed my Udon, the highlight of the evening was certainly the Ramen Burger. Using pork belly instead of ground beef was a simple stroke of genius, and the sauce was absolutely amazing. This just might be might favorite dish in all of Vegas.

Service was great (I think the owner was our server), but the place was a little slow. Which was too bad, I think more people need to hear about this place, I think it has a good chance of taking the place of that old favorite down the street that recently fell off its perch.

I definately recommend giving Izakaya Go a go.

Yay, Japanese Tapas! This is one of our favorite places to go. They serve traditional Japanese tapas as well unique fusion dishes, skewers, ramen and sushi. We have always received wonderful service and our food has always been delicious! The menu is so extensive that we look forward to trying something new every time we go. I really enjoy their Blue Crab and Tofu salads, mochi dishes, salted white fish and bacon wrapped okra skewers. The restaurant is small so I would suggest calling ahead for reservations.

"New Izakaya Kid On The Block"

ATMOSPHERE:

Tucked away in the former Koraku Ramen Spot, Izakaya Go is fast becoming a force to be reckoned with in the Izakaya arena. We stopped in for a quick bite and perusing the menu, it is an interesting spread with your usual lunch combination specials, as well as a section for Curry, their take on Asian fusion burgers and burritos, and an entire page of noodles.
Clean inside, and no distracting TVs, but the counter full of congratulatory flowers kinda gave me the heebie-jeebies thinking I was in a funeral parlor...YIKES! Thank goodness that's temporary! The owner, Chef Go approached our table during our meal to see how our lunch was...always a plus to know that the Chef/Owner is actually in the restaurant cooking.


BITES/BEVERAGES:

I went with the Tonkatsu Lunch Combination($9.95) and we also decided to split a *Poki Burrito ($9.25) *should be spelled Poke, and is pronounced Po-keh, NOT Po-key, FYI...Hot tea is complimentary, just ask for a pot...Out of curiosity, I asked to see the dinner menu, and my eyes immediately zoomed in on the Uni Chawanmushi($6.25) which sounded pretty slammin' , so our waitress was nice enough to check with the kitchen if they could fire one up for us, and sure enough, they were able to! The lunch combinations served here have got to be the biggest ones I've seen! House salad, miso soup, tofu, takuan, and potato salad are included with your entree on one massive tray! My Tonkatsu was cooked to perfection, crisp, juicy, and not greasy at all. Poki Burrito(Think Jogasaki) was good but there was something HELLA SPICY in there! I grabbed a bite of Wifey's Enoki Mushroom and Shrimp Tempura from her Tempura Combo($9.95) tons better than that disastrous tempura at that Michelin starred chef's place... Oh man, the Chawanmushi? Money! loaded with mushrooms, shrimp, and uni, I would definitely devour this again!

CLOSING STATEMENTS:

Same plaza as KUMA Snow Cream on Valley View and Spring Mountain...

Remember, the lunch menu is totally different from the dinner selections  . The more traditional Izakaya items and Japanese dishes, and seafood specialities are on their dinner menu. However, if it's not busy at lunch and something on the dinner menu tempts you, just ask...they might just make it for you!

MASSIVE portions, great prices...you won't leave hungry here. Trust me....

Still have yet to explore dinner here...it's kind of a mix of Kyara, Soho, and Ichiza...
Speaking of Ichiza, This may be a better option after Ichiza's constant run-ins with SNHD.  ALOHA!!!

Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uu  4.5

Will I Return??? Oh yeah!

Quite possibly the best sushi experience of my life. The grilled shishito peppers were the best I've ever eaten, then the fresh halibut roll made me literally groan in ecstasy. We moved on to the grilled scallop skewers, the tuna belly skewer, and drank unfiltered, cold sake. Heaven! The coup de gras ... We met Go, the proprietor. Wow. Just wow. He personally visits the fish market every day and suggested the snapper sashimi (perfection) and house made soy sauce. We will be back. Go ... You are The Man!!

While there is usually a wait in the evenings, and definitely on the weekends, this place is totally worth it! I love how diverse the menu is and all the food I've ever ordered was really delicious. I love taking people here who have only ever had sushi for Japanese food as it's a little glimpse into other options for food in small plates, so less commitment. The atmosphere inside is very lively, and feels like you're almost not in Vegas. Parking can be a pain, but usually able to find a spot.

We took our client from NYC who's also been to Japan, & he thought it was the best Japanese he's ever had. We agree! Uni was fresh & perfect, they made custom nigiri for me that was phenomenal. Rolls, miso & dessert were also excellent. A hidden gem in a strip mall of Chinatown! Very reasonable $$ too!

I LOVEEEEE Japanese tapas sooooo much. I've been wanting to try this place for years now and finally had a chance to over the weekend. It was super late so our only other option for Japanese would've been Sushi Samba, but we literally had that the night before so we gave this place a try. There was no wait when we came around 11pm, but we took the last table.

Ordered:
x Spicy Tuna Roll - we usually don't order rolls, but lately we've been ordering spicy tuna rolls everywhere we go. This one was a little loose and lightly wrapped, but still flavorful and delicious. Helped that it was on the happy hour menu :)
x Spicy Tuna Over Crispy Rice - I LOVEEEE crispy rice, but this one tasted more like fried. Super sticky rice in the middle. Still good, but won't order this again.
x Sea Urchin Dumplings - It tastes exactly how you would imagine it. Eating warm uni was a little strange for me, but the boyfie thoroughly enjoyed it. 
x Truffle Corn - SOOOOO GOOOD. There's actual pieces of truffle hidden around the corn. MUST order.
x Whole Grilled Squid - I love grilled squid and this one did not disappoint. 
x Albacore Handrolls - Probably my least favorite of the night. The albacore wasn't fresh and there was just SOOOO much rice. Usually hand rolls come with cucumbers or sauce or SOMETHING, but this one was just fish, rice, and seaweed. Meh. Maybe I'll get the spicy tuna next time.

The food is good and it's a pretty fun environment. Coming here for happy hour makes everything 100x better. Beers were only $3 and our check for all of that was only $50!!! We left stuffed too :) Usually when I eat Japanese tapas the check is ALWAYS over $100. So happy about this place. Even better because it's only 5 minutes away from where I stay.

Happy Hour everyday from 10pm - Close.

I was told about this restaurant from some friends so went semi late on a Thursday (11pm) . It's a small restaurant in a strip mall but it's very busy . We were lucky to get a seat at the bar and the restaurant filled up quickly as soon as we got there . They have a few different menus including a happy hour menu and a fish menu and small plates as well . The service was good and attentive . We ordered some happy hour menu items and some regular menu items .

Monkfish liver -good
Baked muscles -ok
Uni pasta -amazing but very creamy 
Marinate Cabbage -good 
Wagyu sushi -great

We had other things all were average or above average . 

We will go back to experience more of the menu and get into the fish side of the menu .

We did not get into the grill items but that will
Be a future trip too .

Service is great, they welcome you and treat you great! Knowledge of food products and its source is low! Price is $$$ for an off strip location! Food overall taste great! Limited bar! Very small location but it's not really busy!

This is my fav Japanese Izakaya in Vegas - located in china town, just 10 min uber ride from the strip. 
First off the menu is huge...and a lot of Izakaya items. Service is super fast...and friendly. After my few trips waitress remembers me and I don't have to order m, they just bring my fav items to the table. 

Quality of food are excellent. From kimchi pork to ramen I have nothing to complain about. 

They also have take out option - i was fortunate to have a fridge and microwave at my hotel and took advantage of take out every night!

Arrive early before dinner hour, or call ahead to be certain of a reservation. Everything on or off the menu is a certified delight.  Need to close a sale, or pitch an idea for a movie blockbuster, there is a great variety of beverages and the beer is served Ice Cold...

Ok. I gotta go back and eat more stuff, but I'm just reviewing the RAMEN BURGER for now. 

I tried a ramen burger from L&L once back when I took a trip to Hawaii. I was so traumatized. It was so greasy. 

So I was a little apprehensive of this one at first, but then I took a bite, and I lost my damn mind. At first in the photos I thought it was roast beef in it, so I was like "IDK if that'll be good. That doesn't sound good..." 

Plot twist! It's pork. I wanna say pork belly. But it it was just so tender and ripped apart so easily in every bite. 

The consistency of the ramen bun was perfect. Crispy on the outside for a nice crunch and then a perfect (not soggy) noodle on the inside.

I'd go back for this for sure, but also aiming to try that bomb looking uni pasta.

Super fun mix of Japanese sushi bar and tapas that have a Asian flair. This was a great discovery. It's open late but we were here early and had lightning fast service and food. Great concept great execution. 

Don't get the wings. I got them for fun and they were good but overpriced and maybe the novelty wasn't worth the cost. The tongue, meatballs, pork belly, and yaki soba noodles were awesome. The charm of this place is that you can sample lots of great dishes. Good service. Clean bathrooms.

This place is awesome. Their seating is pretty unique as well. Along one side of the restaurant, there is a line of wooden booths with separate seat cushions that you can sit on. And there are two larger wooden seating areas in the middle of the restaurant, where you are able to take off your shoes to enjoy your meal. We ordered the assorted sashimi platter, the teriyaki dinner combo and the ramen burger. The ramen burger took a while to come out, but they did let us know before we ordered. BTW THE RAMEN BURGER IS BOMB. I ate it with my hands as if it was a "burger" lol because I wasn't sure how to eat it. As I was eating, the juices from the burger kept dripping down my arm. Nonetheless, it was DELISH. RAMEN BURGER 10/10 RECOMMEND. All in all, it was a nice experience eating at this restaurant. Would come again.

I really was impressed with the service and food. But more important the close that it looks to a traditional izakaya. Prices were reasonable and quality of food were really good. We ordered 2 small bottle of sake, that were smooth. The service these guys give is very good even I heard a happy birthday with lights out.

jfc this place is great and I accidentally came here half my April. "What do you wanna eat?" my friend asks. I usually replied with "I dunno. Izakaya?" What I love about this place is Go. He's the owner and he works hard as a server and an owner. I respect these types of places a lot and it's part of the reason why I keep coming. Obviously the food is great.

I get a lot of food here for $15 during happy hour. The quote "can I get veggie dumplings, two avocado rolls, and two pumpkin croquettes?" is etched into my brain since I've been saying it all month. This place is soooo good and is constantly good aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa.

Service is great. Every server I have gotten is extremely polite and treats you like a guest in their home. Go's hair is heavenly too. His hair is so beautiful and it's the real reason why I keep coming. Yeah, that's right. Forget about the food and the service, just come over, pay for dinner during happy hour and admire Go's luscious hair (Im kidding, dummy. Although, Go's hair is pretty gosh dang amazing).

My bill that comes after my inspirational quote I said earlier that mentions 2 avocado rolls, 2 pumpkin croquettes, and veggie dumplings comes out to be $20 (with tip) during happy hour. Pretty cheap considering I leave dying from eating so much. Sure, I can easily stop eating or ordering so much so I can avoid those post I-almost-vomited-from-eating-so-much burps; but the food is so good when it's fresh.

I have tried other dishes in the past besides my usual. I only remember having the curry with cheese. It had acceptable taste and was a huge portion. Izakaya Go is an izakaya restaurant, so it's not like them having an okay curry really affects them. Them only having okay tasting non-Izakaya foods matters as much as okay tasting chicken fingers at Cheesecake Factory.

Tips: Don't you dare disrespect the servers or I'll cut you. Order izakaya dishes, its their best ones considering it's an izakaya restaurant. Come here after work or during late hours for happy hour (DUH. ITS AN IZAKAYA RESTAURANT, DOOF).

Pros: Nice staff, the owner is a server himself and is a leader rather than a boss, great food, amazing prices during happy hour, Go's hair (so dreamy).

Cons: Uuuuuuuuuuh?????????? their curry, a dish that isn't specialized here, is only okay???!!! ugh!! If I could rate 0 stars I would!!!!! grr only okay!!!!!!!!! I can't believe this non izakaya dish isn't as good as their izakaya dishes!!!! 0 stars!!!

A pretty good place for Japanese tapas.  

Came here for dinner one night and we had a pretty good meal. I have to say the Ramen burger was the bomb, it had a fried egg and a large piece of pork in there along with some well seasoned fries. Very tasty. The Halibut carpaccio with Uni was very pretty and presentation but not very tasty, the quality of fish was mediocre. The tomato and yam salad was very good, very unique in presentation and taste. Must order if you are an adventurous foodie.  

The service was very nice, and drink filled regularly. The store manager also came often to check on us to make sure everything was good.

Izakaya NO...

Service was wonderful unfortunately the same can not be said about the food. The staff are so welcoming and attentive from the moment you step into the restaurant that it made me sad to walk out with such awkward flavors in my mouth. 

Items: 
Tuna belly steak 
Miso Soup 
Spicy Tuna Bowl
Uni dumplings
Crispy Pork Belly
and then some

The only thing that I would re order if I were to come back would be the Crispy Pork Belly. It was both crispy and chewy, very delicious. The uni dumplings were a bit of a disappointment. I wasn't sure what was in the mush filling when I took a bite. It was obvious that the top had a bit of uni but the rest was questionable. The Tuna belly steak was overcooked and tasted very fishy. It tasted like fish that I had left in the freezer for too long. I was also really disappointed with their sushi rice. 

Their service and price points are great....

I was really hoping that this cursed location has finally found tenants with a concept and product that could survive...but who knows... maybe I just came on a really off night.

Everything tasted fresh and delicious . I'll be back soon , FOR SURE ! 
Worth to try it out , not expensive and such a welcoming small place . 
Thank you!

Food and service is excellent. Had stir-fried squid legs in garlic butter, okonomiyaki,  stir-fried chicken gizzard with garlic greens, sashimi salad, yakisoba, and grilled mackerel. :)  We loved everything. The grilled mackerel was the highlight for me.

Was in vegas for a reunion and visited "IZUKAYZA GO" on a recommendation.  WE WERE  NOT DISAPPOINTED !!
A dozen of us went the small dish route.  
Off the extensive menu we picked things to try.   2 of each dish that we shared.   The server recommened somethings to round out our eating experience.   I think we had maybe a dozen things to try......Everyone had there favorites.....
Mine was the "deep fried baby octopus".... It  made your standard calamares seem so regular.
Service was excellent we never felt rushed and the food came out one dish at a time.   We also left with full  tummys !!
When all the eating was done,  the only thing we complained about was the bill.    We thought it was not enough.....
Thank you Go.....we will be back !!

This place is seriously awesome. A great place to come with your friends/family. It's a small intimate restaurant with amazing food. The prices are more than decent and the quality is more than you can ask for. It's also a fun to place to get your drink on with some liquor or sake bombs. Some people get fun and a little rowdy here and it fits the vibe. 
Their happy hour is really enlightening, there's a bunch of items that are a steal for what you get. My favorites are the, katsu curry, truffle edamame and wings. So much more that I can't think of atm.

ALSO, when you get here you MUST try this layered white chocolate crepe cake. You will not regret it, this work of art is so delicious you will melt.

When it's National Ramen Day, getting ramen is a must. My friend saw that this place has good reviews so we tried it out, unfortunately they didn't have too many ramen options, but they did have a large variety of menu items (from ramen to udon to sushi to takoyaki). Of course I got my usual ramen order, the shoyu ramen, in honor of this national holiday, but it wasn't all that I had hoped it would be. The takoyaki was very good and they have a jelly-like soju that is awesome. I may have liked this place more if I had something else, but based off of the ramen it wasn't my favorite. You get free ice cream when you check in, which is great, but the green tea flavor had a strange taste so I would go with the vanilla instead. I would give it another chance, especially since it's the only place I know of with the jelly-like soju.

Ramen is amazing here.  One of the only places in town that uses chicken broth!  Definitely a plus.  The yakatori is amazing and decently priced.  The poached egg was cold :(.  My only complaint is they don't open till 5pm...some times you just want ramen for lunch...you know?

5 stars for service
4 stars for food

I'm no stranger to this restaurant. The best tip I can give you is to come on Monday's when they get their fresh shipment of fish in. 

This place gets busy so I usually come right when they open. Otherwise, expect to wait - but it's very well worth it. 

Izakaya go has a large menu, so if you're indecisive, ask your server for some suggestions. Also, the chef usually gives you complimentary dishes. Yesterday we got conch, and mantis crab - very different but very tasty. 

Here's what I ordered:

Corn butter: delicious but I wish they melted some cheese on top 
Dried Mullet Roe w/ Miso cream cheese: salty but goes well with beer
Oyster shooter: great but if they added a quail egg, it would've been perfect 
Baracuda sashimi - amazing and when you're done, they can deep fry the head for you. 
Porkbelly skewers, chicken skewers and the beef tongue was my favorite. All delicious and perfectly grilled. 
Potherb mustard yuzu salad with shrimp and avocado - dressed nicely and the shrimp is raw 
Ramen Burger with Fries - MY FAVORITE ITEM. Instead of using a regular beef patty, it's chashu pork. 

Service is excellent however when it gets busy, just please be patient. They're doing their best and I can definitely see that.

I love this restaurant! FOOD AND SERVICE are both great! my friends and I eat here at least twice a week. Servers know our orders already, somewhat embarrassing and amazing at the same time!  Love their sushi, I always order the Crunchy roll and sometimes the Philadelphia roll ---rarely, but still flavorful. Their deep fried squid legs (tentacles) is amazing especially after a night at the bar! :) I bring my friends from out of town here so I highly recommend it! :)

Went to this restaurant on a road trip back from colorado with my gf and my bro. We were all pretty hungry as we had been driving all day in an effort to get back to LA ASAP. My bro and I split an order of the albacore sushi and the spicy tuna rolls. I ordered baby octopus as we all finished eating since I was still a little hungry. He ordered a poke sushi burrito. My gf ordered the shoyu ramen. We also ordered a few beers.

What I enjoyed about the restaurant:
-Awesome fresh tasting sushi at a pretty reasonable price. The amount of food and the quality are both definitely worth what we paid. 
-My gf enjoyed the meat in her ramen and we both enjoyed the texture of her noodles.
-The beef ponzu was seriously on point. The texture of the beef and the umami flavor of the ponzu sauce was pleasant while also not being too salty. It came with two dumplings, rice, and two edamame-looking peppers, and a light salad with a pretty flavorful dressing (again, not too overbearing flavor wise).

What is left to be desired:
-The service is definitely wanting. Other customers at one point felt kind of dissatisfied with how long their food was taking. I ordered a small order of baby octopus while still in the middle of our meal and it took over twenty minutes after I ordered that dish until it finally came out. It's a relatively small restaurant; sorry, but I view that as poor service.
-The broth of my gf's ramen did not taste particularly appealing. It had a slight fishy taste even though the ramen she ordered came with pork- I find this a little strange. She also ordered the ramen extra spicey; this ramen was not even remotely spicey. 

Overall, I enjoyed my experience here and left satisfied and full. It definitely hit the spot. There are SEVERAL amazing restaurants in Vegas however, so it may be a while before I come back to this restaurant. Considering the value for my money, I don't see why I wouldn't- just not anytime soon.

Place is nice and clean. The service was kind of slow. As for the food the fish was fresh but the best bang for your buck is the bento box. I ordered the teriyaki chicken and there was a lot of food! I would go back and try other things on the menu.

So i relied on a friend of mine to pick out a good place for dinner when we were in Vegas, and he chose this place. After asking him why, his reply was simply, "I dunno they were the highest rated Izakaya on Yelp in Vegas."

So it's great that Yelp was around and he did some homework. The reviews don't lie, Izakaya Go was pretty good for an Izakaya in Vegas. They have a wide assortment of dishes including deep fried goodies, Yakitori, steamed, grilled and raw. The drink selection is also pretty large. Don't be surprised if you take awhile to order or keep ordering things you just discovered on the menu. Go with the sushi and Yakitori morsels!

Came here twice over Halloween weekend after drinking with friends. The first night my coworker told me she wanted sushi burrito and that's how we ended up here. We got here around 2am and they had happy hour at that time, sushi burrito either poke or crunchy with miso soup was $10. Hooooolllllly smokes it was amazing. It was so fresh and full of flavor that when I went out the next night I had to drag my friends who were visiting from out of town here! Defiantly will be coming back to try there other foods. My friends all loved the sushi burrito!

Love this place!! Love all the flavors and the same options. Although I could have sworn I ate the tiniest baby octopus sautéed  with salt and pepper! I've yet to find them here again...I never thought I'd eat let alone love octopus!

I absolutely love this place. The food is all amazing, it always comes out relatively quickly and it all tastes delicious! My boyfriend and I always go here for happy hour, but their menu is pretty big and affordable regardless. Their spicy tuna is one of the best I've ever had, and that's our favorite roll in general but some other places manage not to make it anywhere near as good as Izakaya does. I've tried all of the ramens and like every single one of them too. The owner has been at the restaurant every single time we've been there. I respect that SO much from a business standpoint, AND he is really cool! There was a party the last time we went and the people had gotten a little rowdy, and not only were the servers and the owner totally accommodating and cool with it, they joined in on the fun all while maintaining the rest of the restaurant successfully and professionally. That balance is hard to do and again, I really respect it! It makes for such a positive atmosphere from many different angles. Overall even with that, the restaurant isn't crazy loud, it's totally reasonable where you can talk easily to one another and still enjoy the buzz of a busy restaurant.

Bottom line: the food is delicious, the happy hour deals are amazing, the atmosphere is fun, and the staff all around is fantastic. This is an absolute must-visit!

Great restaurant to eat asian fusion and traditional.  He has authentic items and not so common dishes. 
Definitely recommended
Great place for izakaya. The menu is slightly overwhelming due to just the massive variety. The fish is fresh.  Okonomiyaki is good as well. Great for a late night meal.
Excellent service and food. This place is one of the best Izakaya restaurants we ate at.
My new favorite tapas place! Everything we ordered was so good! Happy hour prices makes it even better. Great service  Must try!

This place is great! Happy hour is 10-close. The food is amazing and the service from the staff was superb! I definitely recommend the Tuna Belly Steak,it was so juicy and fresh, cooked to perfection, also the dinner plates are a great deal for all you get and the skewers are amazing as well! Definitely a great spot and open till 3am on weekends :)
Food was delicious and they have a lot of choice of food. I love yakitori a lot shiitake mushroom was so yummy.

Good late night Japanese tapas food in Las Vegas! I love dining like this because the dishes are small and you can try a variety of different things. AND, the prices are reasonable! I wish they opened for lunch though. But I do like the fact they open late night. 

Everything looked good, so we ordered a lot of food! My eyes were bigger than my belly. We ordered (pictured): sizzling sautéed corn, pork belly skewer, beef tongue skewer, tempura, California rolls, beef tataki, cold soba noodles, deep fried octopus, buttered enoki mushrooms, ramen, miso eggplant, and edamame. My favorites were the sizzling sautéed corn, buttered enoki mushrooms, beef tataki, and miso eggplants (soo good!). Will definitely come back and try other dishes! I highly recommend checking out this place.
I was so excited to try this restaurant! Our friends came and loved it. The food is amazing! The service is wonderful! They are accommodating and so friendly! Can't wait to come back again!

When I travel and try new places, I always ask myself the same question: would I want this restaurant back home near me so I can go there again and again. In this case, the answer is a resounding YES.

When the waitress brought over a stack of menus almost 10 inches high, I had my doubts. How could they possibly do a good job on so many different items. Pictures looked good so our party of three ordered grilled, raw, and from the kitchen items to try. Fish was perfectly cooked and seasoned. Raw items were fresh and briny. We also ordered the uni pasta, creamy with a hint of sweetness and sea. Overall everything was very good with maybe one or two out of 10 dishes we ordered were 'only' good. Service was also friendly and prompt. We never felt rushed even know there was already a long line on a Monday night at 7:00 PM. We will go back again before heading back to New York for sure.

Last but not least if you like to drink, there are a wide variety of Japanese whiskey and beer at very reasonable prices. BONUS.

Man I wish we had a place like this near me.

Great food! Loved it so much went back twice in two nights. Great friendly staff. Go was awesome and prices are amazing for the quality you are getting.

Will see be back next time I am in Vegas!

We had a group of seven people who shared several plates.  Items ordered:

Salmon skin salad
Battera
Unagi bowl
Hamachi kama
Takoyaki
Agedashi tofu
Chicken KaraAge
Chawan Mushi
Ten zaru soba
Tororo Udon
Mushroom Zosui
Tuna Belly Steak

A standout was the octopus ball.   There were six and they had good flavor and different textures.  The agedashi tofu was good.  The broth was very flavorful. The mushroom porridge was OK but we hadn't yet gotten sharing bowls so we each had some in our small soy sauce saucer.  The udon was also OK.  The mushroom porridge was my favorite dish.

Major fails:  tuna belly steak - overcooked and very dry.  The tempura was not good.  It had not been cooked enough and the batter had an unfinished taste.  The soba noodles were not good and had little flavor.  I was very disappointed in the chawan mushi.

I don't understand why they charge $2.50 for iced green tea but hot green tea is free.  The place is very small.  Maximum capacity sign said 70 and that would be pushing it.  The noise level was high.  

There are other izakaya restaurants superior to this.
The best Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas!!!! Very authentic. Everything on the menu are delicious. The fishes are always fresh.
One of my go to Japanese restaurants in Vegas. Total local spot and open late every night!!! Very Authentic food and delicious

Called in and was able to make a reservation on our way the restaurant. When we arrived, the place was busy but our table for 7 was set and ready! 
Service was great and everything we ordered was delicious! The raw fish was very fresh and just melts in your mouth! 
Oh and I believe they have late happy hour-I'm going to have to come back one of these days!

Great food and great prices. It was my first time at Izakaya Go and it definitely lives up to its hype. I went for their Happy Hour (10pm-close) and their prices are very reasonable and their portions are are generous. I would say Izakaya Go will be one of my top choices for whenever I go to Chinatown now. 

I got the curry with braised pork belly and I thought the portions were going to be smaller due to happy hour prices, but it definitely exceeded my expectations. The curry arrived in a big plate, half rice and half curry with a small pork belly on top. The meat to rice ratio was 1:2 so I had a lot of rice left over, but that wasn't a problem for me. I ordered 2 pork belly skewers and I ate that with my rice and the curry is so delicious. The skewers were actually very tasty as well. We tried the mango and lychee cocktail and it was pretty strong in my opinion. Next time I go I want to try their hot pot or ramen. 

The service was very nice. We didn't wait too long to be seated and we ordered right away when we sat down. The food arrived in the usual amount of time it takes to make.

Izakaya Go is undoubtedly my most favorite Japanese restaurant in Vegas. I come here all the time after a draining day of work to unwind and enjoy all the delightful tapas. It's almost to the point where you can find me either working, sleeping at home or eating at Izakaya Go. After +20 visits here, I felt that I should list some of my favorites for those that never visited, or for people who are looking for something new to try here. 

Since I come here late at night, I like to order from their Happy Hour Special (10PM to close every night!). California Poke Roll is my favorite out of all. Half-size but for $3.50, portion is generous and it is delicious. 

Fishes they use are uber fresh. If you follow them on Instagram or Facebook, you will know that this place gets fresh fish from all parts of the world. For that reason, I recommend their sushi and sashimi. My personal favorites are salmon sashimi, fresh halibut roll, salmon avocado roll and Philadelphia roll. 

Curry is surprisingly good here too. Just like Zen Curry, you can add toppings to it and also adjust the spice level. I would say that curry here is better than Zen curry. Generous portion, reasonable price (cheaper) and delish! 

If you are starving and can't decide what to eat, go to the back of the menu for their combination plates. You choose your main dish and it comes with small dishes on the side, rice, miso soup and salad. My personal favorites are their karaage and tempura. My friends enjoy their katsu and salmon (specifically the salt flavored). 

In addition, their special menu has all the good stuff! Baked mussel is my current favorite right now. Must order! Their uni pasta is another good dish-creamy and rich uni flavor. I also enjoy their pork kimchi with jidori egg. Pork cooked with kimchi and poached egg on top. Kimchi adds a little kick to it and this alone with a side of rice is enough for me sometimes. 

Support your local business! Top-notch food, attentive/friendly service and a restaurant that makes you feel at home. What's not to love about that? ????????????????

Went here for the first time the other night.  My first time being at an izakaya type place.  Everything was great.  Uni pasta was a great size for the price, and so good.  Also tried uni chawa something, a savory egg custard topped with uni.  Yes I love uni.  Tako wasa I think raw tako with a wasabi sauce excellent.  Takoyaki again awesome.  Maybe I should take pictures of these things.  I will be back for mote

Excellent!
I love their happy hours from 10pm to 2am closing time. Everything we ordered were tasty.

I just checked out Izakaya Go after seeing some great reviews on Yelp. I love Ichiza even though it gets a bad rep: totally understandable. I figure this new place would be modern, clean, and familiar.

I've gone through the yelp photos many times so I new exactly what I wanted.

I came Thursday night at 12:30am. It was EMPTY. I was so happy. We were greeted promptly and basically had the entire staff to ourselves. The seating is cute with butt cushions that I really liked lol

I recently cut out meat as much as possible so I had a pretty vegetarian friendly meal with a friend.

We got French fries, oysters, cucumber roll, crispy rice, agedashi tofu, mushroom porridge, and the uni custard.

I have to say our meal was delicious. We just wanted something light but left ridiculously full. Everything came out prompt, hot, the presentation was nice, and everything was cooked well. I enjoyed all of the above listed items. My one criticism is the dishes all seemed to be missing one little element that could make the food even better. 


Maybe some fish eggs to top the uni custard? Maybe something crunchy to top the mushroom porridge? Maybe a house made aioli for the fries?

Although small in size, the oysters were probably my favorite dish. They were fresh and seasoned so well with lemon and ponzu. 

I also really loved the uni custard. The texture was almost like silken tofu but it tasted so good! There was some shrimp in there and some other goodies. 

I really Enjoyed my self as did my friend. We both left super full from for a total of $40. I can't wait to come back to get some more of the delicious oysters, super comforting mushroom porridge, and that special uni custard.

Maybe it's because we had the place to ourselves, maybe it was because our servers only waited on us, or maybe we just got lucky. I hope to try the sushi burritos and ramen burger soon.

The free hot tea was nice.

I hope they add more desserts to their menu.
Best Japanese food in Vegas! No questions asked! They have a huge menu so coming here never gets boring. Love the music and vibe in there. The Chef, owner (Go) and staff do a wonderful job.

This was a toss up between 3.5 and 4 stars. When we first got there, they didn't look all that busy, but they only had space at the bar. Because it was just two of us, that was fine. It took them a while to greet us, even though several people walked right by us, but that was fine.

We ordered a few types of yakitori, a chawanmushi, beef ponzu, and shrimp yaki udon. I will say that everything was good on flavor, 4.5 to 5 stars for taste. My only gripe was the yakitori with plum, which was clearly bottled plum paste that I use at home and on the hiyayako (tofu) they definitely used ginger paste instead of fresh grated ginger. 

The reason why I was torn between 3.5 and 4 stars is because of the service. It was slow and the order the food came out in was so random. We got one of the yakitori then our main dishes then another yakitori. About 3/4 through the meal, we got our final yakitori. After we finished our meals, I inquired about the chawanmushi. It finally came out, 45 minutes after ordering, and wayyy after we had finished our meals. It was definitely delicious, but it was kind of sad to eat it at the end of the meal. We asked if we could get the free ice cream for checking in on Yelp. The waitress asked if we wanted green tea or vanilla. I ordered vanilla since my bf doesn't like green tea, but they brought us green tea anyway. I love green tea ice cream, so it was fine, but I felt bad for the bf. At least twice, two different people brought us things we didn't order and we had to tell them that wasn't ours. 

Overall, it was a good meal at a reasonable price, but I think there are better izakaya type restaurants in the valley. When we left they were super busy and had a huge line.

The Spicy Miso Ramen was top notch.  I drank all the broth right to bottom of the bowl -  it was that good.  I like a Japanese restaurant that's not all sushi and tempura.  The Poke bowl needed some onions and different seaweed, but the shredded daikon and shiso was really appreciated.  The Salmon and Ikura bowl was awesome.  Since this was my first visit it will take me a while to narrow down my favorites.  The menu was so extensive that it was really hard to choose.  Service was really friendly.  The food came out really quick.   I tried to go there for lunch last month, but found they were only open for dinner.   I'll go back again for sure, but I'm usually in that area around lunch time rather than dinner.
Awesome find while visiting Vegas. True izakaya place. Fresh fish, small pupu/tapa plates. Asian gods at its finest!

Visited on a busy Friday evening around 9:30 PM with my foodie niece and her grandma.  Japanese tapas sounds like a win win for us.  Let's go..!

Service: 3/5  We stopped in without a reservation and the place was packed.  We were seated withing 20 minutes, not bad at all as the restaurants total capacity is only 70.  The waiters were very friendly and were extremely busy.   We sampled a lot of dishes and they got the orders correct and to us as soon as it was ready.  The food was brought out timely but it was hard for them to keep the drinks fresh on a hot Friday evening.  

Food: 4/5 We had a blast trying sampling a lot of food.  Here are our highlights from this visit.
Yellowtail Carpaccio: $8.95 Kicked off the evening perfectly.  Fresh and tasty to get you ready.
Ramen Burger w/ fries: For $9.95 this was a very heavy entree with fries.  Very well put together and tasty.  I will most likely order this again if I don't hit up the Udon
Tempura Udon: Great broth and noodles and a good serving for $8.95
Sea Urchin Dumping: $8.00 gets you 3 very filling Sea Urchin dumplings.  I was a little worried that this might not turn out well. The risk was worth it, very tasty and highly recommended!
Sashimi Bowl: $11.95 very nice sampling that my picky niece was happy with.
Chicken fatty heart: $2.50 to try and was good, different texture but still tasted like chicken. 

Value: 5/5 We took the route of ordering tapas and entrees and everything was very reasonably price for the quantity and the quality of food.  The tapas/a la carte route gives a lot of options to try numerous dishes and keep the evening relatively cheap, love it!

Ambiance: 4/5 The Japanese decor and vibe made me feel like I was in Tokyo when I visited a couple of years ago.  Even down to the cramped seating as real estate is limited in Japan and many of the restaurants we visited we setup like Izakaya.  I saw as many as 6 people seated in the booths and smaller tables that seated 4.  I hope you feel comfortable with who you're dining with. =)

This is my current favorite place in vegas to get that Tokyo dining experience I enjoyed so much when I visited Japan.  Good food, great selection of dishes to try and all for a reasonable price.  It gets crowded quickly so you have to be strategic with planning a visit and be ready to sit down for awhile.  Nothing some sake and beer can't handle to help pass the time with your close friends as you sit together close af.  Enjoy..!

Excellent all around! Staff offered suggestions and were highly attentive. We tried a bit of everything and loved it all-poke California roll, bluefin roll, ramen, chicken gizzards, fatty chicken hearts, pork belly (a fave), plum wine...and price was outstandingly  for value.

I was in Vegas visiting and needed food after watching a late night show at UNLV (with cocktails).  I figured only ratchet places were open at midnight ish but heard about this place.  Glad I know about it!!  LOVE Izakaya Go.

This place has everything your Asian palate desires and it's open until 2am.  They have amazing happy hour deals, but I ordered mainly off the regular menu, so it's pretty affordable regardless.  How affordable, well less than 60 bucks fed 3 hungry people and we ordered a lot!  Ambiance and decor is modern Japanese. We had a cool table that is like a Japanese tea house.  Staff was friendly and on point with customer service.  I had yakitori (chicken hearts 4; okra 2; asparagus 2; pork belly), sautéed gizzards with stir fry vegetables, curry rice with chicken cutlet, sushi, AND kim Chee soup (and ice cream).  Everything tasted really good too.  They have a huge menu of exotic dishes, I can't wait to come back and try more (Uni pasta, sushi burrito, and more).
Always a great time here. Great food. Good service. Happy hour genshu. If you like skewers and ramen, this is the place.
Best Happy Hour late at night, the food is so gooood. This place is a gem.The Happy Hour prices can't be beat.The back wrapped asparagus, and chicken meatballs are fire

Never had a ramen burger and boy i was in for a surprise. The BEST mouth explosion...EVER!! Our wait staff was very patient, attentive she kept our drinks full! Deep fried tofu was something NEW to my mouth. I will visit again and for sure try another Ramen burger.

Love the happy hour specials my favorite is the curry rice topped with braised pork belly- delicious! They give you a bowl with white rice on one side and then a pool of curry gravy on the other side. You have a choice of topping like katsu, teri chicken, pork belly and we always get the pork belly , sometimes double portion. The pairing is amazing- the curry gravy is perfect, smooth, a hint of sweetness and a touch of Spicy finish the sauce. Mix it with the rice, pork belly and the diced pickled radish and it's Christmas in my mouth!

This place is fairly new and opened in December. I've been wanting to try this place out for a while and my mom and I decided to go today, and we were so happy we did!

Decor: Small, quaint Japanese restaurant near Kuma Snow Cream and Starbucks. The place was nicely decorated and had a decent amount of seating. They even had a seating area in the middle where you could take off your shoes and sit on the floor to eat (with cushions of course).

Service: We were seated almost immediately after entering the door. Our server was very nice and always checked up on us, refilling our drinks, asking if the food was okay, giving us extra napkins, etc. I think he was the owner, too. I never had a problem with anything.

Food:
My mom got the Grilled Saba dinner plate and she said that it was very delicious ($10.95). Overall, the food was excellent and so worth your money.
I ordered the ramen burger ($8.75) and it was heaven on earth. The pork was cooked to perfection and melted in my mouth, the grilled egg was a nice touch of flavor, and the grilled onions were perfect. Although a bit messy to eat (I had to use a fork and knife because my mouth was too small for me to just bite it), it was all worth it. Everything was perfect and I'm still salivating over it as I'm writing this review.

I'm so happy I finally got to try this place out. I can't wait until I get to return! I'm dying to try their sashimi!

This place is SOOOO good. The owner used to be a fish distributer (or monger if you will ) and has access to some of the best quality fish from Japan. That paired with his head chef's creativity makes Isakaya a place I will come back to again and again.  Make sure to order the tuna crackers from the appetizer menu, the salmon sashimi, and then request a chef's choice because it will be amazing.

After a colllld long day, I knew I needed some ramen to fill my stomach, and this was one of the very few ramen places still open at 1 am ( which by the way, happy hour is from 10pm- close!!)

We got seated at the big table. We shared it with 3 other ppl, but my bf and I were on the other end so it wasn't too awkward.

So for the both of us, we ordered:
1 lamb chop
1 tiger shrimp
4 pork bellies
4 beef tongues
Takoyaki
Pork gyoza
Ramen burger and fries 
Half miso ramen with spicy on the side

LOL. I let my eyes order bc I was clearly full before finishing all this food.

The skewers were all wonderful! Priced between 2.50-4.95. For some reason, my first round of pork belly tasted better than my second, but it was still fatty & delicious! The beef tongue was my favorite, but it's always my favorite to order. I could've skipped the shrimp, and the lamb chop was very tender and juicy!

The takoyaki was amazing :) it came with their takoyaki sauce and I'm going to guess mayonnaise? But altogether probably one of the best I've had!

Their gyoza was good too! I've been on a gyoza kick lately so it really fulfilled my appetite. It came with 6, and if I wasn't with my bf, I would've eaten all 6 of them to myself. 

The ramen burger is prolly a 3/5. It's messy, too soggy, not as flavored as I'd like. If I were to come back, I probably wouldn't get it again. The fries were good tho!

And the ramen itself was good. I had the spicy on the side, but I ended up adding it in after. It was good! Loved the actual noodles themselves. It came with the same toppings as with a regular ramen, just a smaller portion obviously. So I still had egg, pork, seaweed and bamboo which I highly appreciated for it only being 5 dollars. 

All of that food for only 60 bucks!!  All in all, I'd be back bc I love Japanese tapas and their happy hour :) just skip the ramen burger.

My favorite weekly sushi spot. Fresh fish daily... flown in daily. I've included some pictures of the sashimi. Also, the Uni Chawamushi is a must try. Delicate flavors as it melts in your mouth. If you're bringing kids, can't go wrong with the Unagi Robata and Izakaya Go Fried Rice.

Great little spot with amazing food and very reasonable prices. I've already went twice on this trip and will be back again. I personally like the beef tataki the most but I feel you can't go wrong with anything you order here!

After being turned away at Raku up the street (they had tables empty) and going to an AYCE Japanese  Buffet and reading their yelp reviews in the parking lot and calling Kaysatsu at SLS who was closed. I ended up here.   Parking is never  an issue. 

I ordered a cold Sapporo beer and started off with deep fried fish cake in broth garnished with hot mustard, Shigoku oysters on the half shell, pork belly, beef tongue and, shiitake mushrooms tapas, combo sashimi, and lastly Korean BBQ ribs & green salad. Everything was spot on delish and perfectly executed along with friendly stellar service. 

I finished  my incredible  meal with green tea ice cream - which was complimentary and refreshing! 

They say thinks happen for a reason and after this experience I can't agree more!

Amazing, new favorite Vegas Spot!

The Miso Black Cod and Salmon collar are must gets, as are the enoki mushrooms.  Good sashimi as well, and I loved the sharing of a ton of variety of small plates. 

Definitely worth the trip off of the strip.

Came here for dinner while was in Vegas! 
I ordered salmon with rice and a salmon roll. The rice bowl was definitely not good. I didn't enjoy it at all because the salmon was waaaay too salty. I didn't expect it to be so salty and I couldn't even finish the bowl. 

Service: the service was great. I didn't expect them to give me anything when I told them I couldn't finish my food since the salmon was too salty. They gave me extra sashimi on the side as complimentary. 

Overall, it was a great experience since the service was great, but the food didn't hit the spot.

This is the poor man's Raku. I was solo and got the terrible end bar seat staring at the register. Izakaya Go interior is kinda beat up but not unacceptable. Very difficult to get served & no assistance from the staff at all. Love the large mugs of cold Japanese beer. I ordered a "special fish flown in from Japan"(sea bream) sashimi style. After the strange looks from my server, it took over 25 minutes for it come out. Actually all the dishes took 15 minutes minimum. The overrated sea urchin dumplings were sticky, overcooked and boring. I ordered 3 different yakitori and got 2. Those 2 seemed like they were precooked and reheated on the grill. I stopped after the yakitori due to no service and just average food. There are more civilized options in Las Vegas.

Pros: Good food (authentic Japanese Izakaya - tapas), good service. Reasonable price. Variety of food. 
Cons: Limited parking space but this does not stop me to come back. 

Try Tonight's Specials. 

Thank you so much for spreading the goodness of Japanese food other than sushi!!

Their miso ramen is one of the best ramen I've had in the U.S. 
Definitely hits the spot for a hangover.

Tuna sashimi came out warm and slimy.
Yellowtail sashimi had half edible white meat and half pink tissue and skin.  I thought maybe I'd give it a chance and try something new but my common sense kicked in quick after the first bite... Not happening.

Server, although nice, disappeared for 15 minutes ... Not sure if it was a dinner rush at 11 pm or just understaffed.

Food-wise, this is a fantastic izakaya. The menu is full of interesting things I have never tried before, from the shark cartilage and yam to the uni chawanmushi. Yes, they were out of many things even on a Monday (which is when everyone here seems to recommend coming for maximum freshness/availability), but there were so many things to chose as back-ups that there was really no disappointment at all (except maybe missing out on the uni dumplings - we'll be back for that!). Be ready to make substitutions!

The drink menu and presentation was somewhat lacking for an izakaya. They have a decent sake selection with many unique sweet options, but no shochu and a rather lackluster beer/wine selection. I think based on other reviews and info online they may have a decent Japanese whisky selection, but it's not well presented/curated on the menu, so unless you're sitting at the bar, I guess you have to ask for more detail. 

Minus another star for atmosphere and parking situation. I know, it's Vegas, whatever, but the staff didn't need to encourage the creepy misogynistic bachelor party going on at the table next to us by taking shots with them and obliging their requests to show them their tattoos, etc. There are plenty of more appropriate places for that stuff in this town. And then parking: despite the location in a rather ugly strip mall with what looks like it should be plentiful parking, we had to drive around the lot a few times to find a space, even on a weekday. When we finally got a space, we saw that all the spaces were marked as "80 minute" parking. Seriously? In a strip mall?! Plan ahead and arrive early!

Izakaya Go is a relatively small Japanese joint designed for a drinking crowd. With a variety of food types and sizes, just about everyone from the extremely hungry to those just wanting a beer and some sides can find what they need.

That being said, with such an extensive menu, everything is about average when it comes to quality and flavor, which should be expected given the size of the restaurant. Just from a structural point of view, a menu this size in complexity would struggle with a crowd that they serve. Don't get me wrong, I was reasonably happy with the food we received but wasn't blown away enough to signify a higher rating. 

The drink menu is also quite extensive, so everyone you are with should be able to find something for them. 

Granted, this place is quite busy and I expect that reservations should be made if you're hoping to get in without an extended wait. The staff is definitely friendly, although could be a bit short-handed sometimes with the few people covering the whole restaurant. 

Bottom line, Izakaya Go is a good choice for those with groups of people with varying food desires or a group wanting to try a variety of Japanese style foods. Don't expect the best version of anything you've ever had, but I think few places can match this restaurant in terms of selection options for the size.
Come here for some good Izakaya! Favorites... soft shell crab, pork belly and agadashi tofu

I come here often after work for the late happy hour, and I must say it's one of my favorite newer places in town. Go and his staff are always helpful and friendly. I have my favorites but always seem to find something new each time through friends selections.  The enoki mushrooms in the soy butter sauce from the main menu are my standout must have, and they always have a daily fresh sashimi selection. Whether I am craving meat, fish, or veggies, Izakaya Go has something delicious and unique to offer every palate.

First time here and already im in love.. Awesome customer service and awesome food with awesome pricing..  its really hard to find a good Japanese restaurant with good price.. im happy most definitely going to come back..
Had late night sushi and ramen with the wifey and we loved it. Cool feel in the heart of China town. A must try.

There is a few of those times where you walk in to an establishment and everything flows perfectly from the start. The service, vibe and homey local feeling really makes you feel right at home. My girlfriend and I had the pleasure of being served by GO. You can ask him any questions you want and he will answer.  The spanish mackeral and red tuna were our favorites.. Along with the yakitori (quail egg in bacon and cow tongue a must.) Will always be back!

The uni pasta was hands down bomb. All the other stuff was good according to my fam--poke chips, crunchy roll & takoyaki. I had the 3 fish sashimi platter...couldn't go wrong with tuna, salmon & yellow tail. The salmon skin hand roll did disappoint, b/c I'm used to some salmon on my crispy warm skin even in a no-carb hand roll. This was straight up super crisp falling apart salmon skin only. Maybe just not the style I was accustomed to, but now I know! Good service and would love to try the big party table in the center with floor seating like in Japan!! Looks like it would be a cool experience. Next time

I have been here few times, and never understood what the hype was all about until this time. Yes, there were still some server who were not as friendly as other japanese restaurants, but it did not bother our dinner at all.

We had a little wait, but were seated as soon as a table was ready. The server came, and I really wanted to try their catch of the day sashimi, yet they only had one kind and aji-mackerel left. Not so sure if they are kept alive, but it didn't seem like it since they did not have a fish tank on display to show the activeness of fish. Another kind, the server explained it to be a tougher texture so we ended up ordering a regular 5 kinds sashimi. The halibut was really fresh, and so were the rest. The tuna could have better color but when I tasted, it was still very tasty and soft. We also got blue fin tuna carpaccio with cruncy garlic, yummy!!! It was really red and almost melted in my mouth. Tako wasabi was a generous portion. Shitake mushroom and tiger shrimp skewers were worth every penny, but Kyara definitely has better ton-toro skewers. We added the truffle butter corn, shio ramen and spicy salmon cut roll at the end. The truffle butter corn definitely should not include truffle in its name, since I couldnt find a bit sign of truffle in the dish, yet it was REALLY GOOD-YOU SHOULD GET THIS IF YOU LIKE CORN AND BUTTER.  Shio ramen was a half portion but was more than enough. Spicy salmon was a bit too spicy for me but t was bearable. 

I would go back again and try their catch of the day. Good quality food, definitely a good joint to hang on the weekends.

If you're looking for a place to meet friends after office hours, I think this is the place to go to. Nice ambience, a very small place but good enough to hang out with friends or co workers. I love their grilled prawns, scallops and sweet sake.

So the chef/owner opened this establishment after his successes in Los Angeels with Hondaya Izakaya, and a bunch of other Hondaya restaurants. I've had the Izakaya in L.A., and several people I know are fans as well. 

What I ate: 

Steamed clams in garlic soup/sauce- 5 star. SOOOOOOO GOOD. I don't even like clams very much and LOVED this dish. The clams were cooked to perfection, and the garlic soupy broth just makes this dish stellar. I think I could eat 5 bowls of this. 

Yakisoba - 5 star.  I've had so many different Yakisoba's in Japan. This one was very good. Unlike most places, it had a ton of veggies, and a couple pieces of really yummy pork. MAKE SURE YOU GET IT WITH PORK, not chicken or beef. 

Fried octopus- 5 star. Everyone at the table loved this dish. It's crispy and delicious. 

Chicken porridge (chicken zosui)- 3  star. This was good, but I have had better before. The broth could have been a bit more flavorful. 

Spicy miso ramen- 3 star.  It was good, not extraordinary. The spice level if average, and the miso flavor is a bit weak. But hey, this ain't no ramen place. 

Halibut carpaccio with uni on top- 3 star. I thought this was an OK. Some other people liked it so, it could be a personal preference. 

Salted chicken wings- 3 star.  The chicken was a bit hard on the inside, slightly over cooked. I loved the outside flavoring. Make sure to sprinkle some SICHIMI (Japanese red pepper) on it, and it will be a game changer. 

Miso salmon sashimi- 2 star.  I wasn't particularly fond of the flavor of the miso. 
Spicy tuna on crispy rice- 1 star. I personally did not like the flavor of the spicy tuna at all. 

Service- 5 stars.  I'd come back here to try more items, as the menu is extensive. The service was on point, and it's a nice place to come with a small group of people (up to 4).  There's only one table that I saw that can seat a larger group.  Portions are small for the appetizers/tapas, so if sharing, maybe 4 people can get a bite at most.

Long ago this place was popping to the point that a 20 minute plus wait was expected no matter what night. Showing up on a Friday night this week, it was dead. Only 2 tables were filled and the almost all Japanese staff were replaced by no Japanese staff. 
The food was still just as decent and definitely one of the better Japanese restaurants in the city, so no complaints there. 
Sashimi of the night (25, 35, 45$ options) To eat between two people as a tapas plate (don't expect this to be that filling) the 25$ was perfect. 
Karaage: skip it. Over fried, over burnt, no flavor. It was closer to KFC chicken then your traditional Japanese style karaage. 1/5
Takoyaki: The tako wasn't the best quality, but it was good. 4/5
Okonomiyaki: There aren't very many places you can order this at. It's like takoyaki batter, but pancake style and with different seafood/vegetables in it. I preferred to okonomiyaki to the takoyaki. It was also a way bigger portion for the price. 
With beers being as cheap as 4-5$ on draft, it really felt like a Japanese izakaya.
Service okay..., food worse. We ordered about 15 different items plus beers. The beers about the only thing worth coming back for.

We needed a few small bites to tie us over before our Christmas Eve dinner and this place was perfect. They accommodated us before it got super busy with the dinner crowd. The chicken karaage was crispy on the outside and super tender on the inside. The omakase sushi was a fresh selection of 4 sushi's. The poke bowl was well flavored with lots of fresh fish. The prices are quite reasonable too.

Whenever we are in Vegas for work, we prefer to go off the strip for food.  Food tends to be better (not as fufu) and much better priced.  We love going to Raku, but wanted to try something different so decided on Izakaya Go.

They have a cool homey hipster type vibe.  They have bar seating with alcohol bottles all lined up against the bar, and they even have one long table in the middle where you take off your shoes (true Japanese style!).

They have a very extensive menu so it was a bit overwhelming trying to decide what we were going to order, but we settled for the following:

Yakitori - Beef Tongue/Scallop/Asparagus With Bacon/Chicken Breast with Wasabi/Chicken Meat Ball - My favorite out of these were the scallops, the beef tongue and the meat balls.

Yamasen - Good but forgettable

Hamachi Kama - Fish was soft and delicious

Chawan Mushi - Light and yummy

Yakinasu - I'm not a huge fan of eggplant so I didn't particularly like this dish, but my friend enjoyed it.

Grilled Mochi with Cod Roe Cheese - Must get.  Never had any dish like this.  Sounds weird but it was quite addictive.

Squid Garlic Fried Rice - Really good.  Felt like it was slightly missing something but can't quite put my finger on it.

I feel like we had more food, but I can't seem to remember everything right now. Overall the food was delicious and better than most things on the strip.  All the food plus a small bottle of sake only came out to $95 before tip.

Came here for happy hour cause we were wanting hot sake! Definitely recommend coming here for happy hour because the sake is good and prices are affordable. We didn't try any food here because we had dinner before we came here. We mostly wanted to drink but I would definitely come back here to try the small dishes and food. It looked good. It's a cute small spot too. It's cozy inside.
Great service! Delicious ramen, we all got shio ramen, shoyu ramen, and miso ramen! I like that they offer free ice cream to everyone! Lovely little place overall, would definitely come back!
One of my go to spots when I'm in Vegas!  Great food and service but, there's a wait sometimes.  Happy hour is the best which starts at 10 PM to close.

This was a recommendation from a foodie friend and it was AMAZING! Great prices, great food and excellent customer service. Our server Bee was very friendly and recommended so many great menu items. 

We ordered:

Braised Pork Belly 10/5 STARS! 
YES that's right 10/5 stars! This was out of this world AMAZING! 
Tender, juicy, full of flavor pork belly. YOU HAVE TO TRY IT AND FALL IN LOVE! 

Miso Ramen 5/5 stars
Broth was delicious, pork (the same one above) was sooooo YUMMY! Noodles were tender. 

-Spicy Friend Rice w/ Jidori Chicken 4/5 stars
It was very spicy. Full of flavor but the spicy got me..lol

House Fried Rice 3/5 
The pork pieces we so yummy and tender but the rice itself was kinda bland. 

-Pork Gyoza 4/5 stars
steamed and pan fried well. full of flavor but the dipping sauce could've been better. 

Fresh Oysters 4/5 stars
I personally do not eat seafood. My boyfriend said 4/5 stars, the oysters were very fresh but the vinegar sauce inside of the shell was very over-powering to the flavor.  

Pork Belly (on skewer) 5/5
It was crispy, full of flavor, and tender. 

Karaage Fried Chicken 4/5 
Crispy, very flavorful but there was a lot of fatty parts. The dipping sauce was very good.
My favourite Japanese tapas bar in Las Vegas. Try out their happy hour menu which starts at 10pm. Prices are reasonably fair. Must try.

I read the reviews about how great this place is so I wanted to go check it out. But due to not having enough time to dine in I opted for take out. Employees were very nice and polite which is why I gave a two star rating instead of one. 

The main reason why I wanted to give this place a one star was because the main dish I ordered was not worth its price. I had gotten an order of takoyaki (which was very delicious) and an order of the chicken karage dinner plate. For me it was not necessarily bad but it was not as good as I thought it would be. As for the quantity, I had only gotten 4 pieces of the chicken karage. I was disappointed that I had paid $12 (not including tax) for this. Even though it comes with a side salad, one scoop of potato salad, a small tofu side dish, rice and miso soup; it was not worth the price for me. I feel that if it came with 8-10 pieces of the chicken karage then I would be ok with this. For me the three items that hit it for me were the miso soup, the rice, and the takoyaki which is sad to say. (I have a picture that I took of the dinner plate but for some reason I cannot upload since I am using the app on my phone. Will update soon)

Probably will not be going back there.

A little about me because this is important to the review (everyone is biased through their background, right?):

I'm a southern Californian who is a self-proclaimed foodie. I refuse to eat bad food.  I'd rather starve.

This is the place I'd go back to EVERY TIME I go to Vegas, FOR SURE.  

We went to this place around 3 AM.  It's really odd, but I honestly thought a lot more places would be open on a Saturday morning at 3 AM in Vegas, but I was wrong.  This place closed it down at 4 AM so we barely made it.  

What I love love love about this place:

1.  Freshest sashimi I've ever had.  In an inland state????  How is that possible?  Ok, I've never had sashimi in Taiwan when we went last time and I've never been to Japan.  I stand to change my mind when I actually do that.

2.  The best "Happy Hour" menu I've ever seen in any place.  Period.  And for whatever reason, at 3 AM, Happy Hour was still going on.  Fine by me and my big mouth!

3.  Exceptional service.  I felt we were very well taken care of even though this place was PACKED.

I can't wait to go back to this place.  Seriously.  I don't go to Vegas very often, but I for sure will be coming here the next time we stop by.

Such a jewel in LV!  Great food and great service.  All done to perfection.  Loved the eel!  My Japanese friend and I enjoyed our meal so much, we went back again during our three day visit to LV.  I would add more stars if I could.
Some food are good some are not. It's mediocre. Staff are great tho! Yakitori is ok. Although, I feel like they cook it with an electric grill or something because there is no smoke flavor to it.

My husband and I found this place on accident and we are glad we did. Staff is so cool and professional, I love that this place combined tradition and fusion, which brings people of all ages. The food is worth the drive, especially the Korean BBQ ribs. We've brought family and friends to this place and they loved it as well!
The food is great and the service is awesome! I've been here couple of times now and I've been satisfied every time! The Happy Hour pricing is pretty good too and will definitely be coming back!
This is one of the best Japanese tapas joint I ever had.  love the wide range selections.  Definitely coming back.

The best meal we had while staying in Las Vegas. We just kept ordering more! The fish was deliciously fresh, and my parents are SUPER picky about that kind of stuff, coming from a country with seafood-heavy cuisine. 

Some highlights from what I remember: The dessert we had (yuzu cheesecake, mille crepe) were perfect, my dad especially liked the mille crepe because it wasn't too sweet. The uni was sooo creamy and not fishy at all!

I HIGHLY recommend going.

This place has pretty much everything under the sun. Plus they're open late so I don't have to resort to eating at a fast food place or generic casino cafe when driving into Vegas after work. Had the shisto peppers, tempura, ramen, karaage, and yakitori with friends and it was incredible. Staff is very accommodating as they know their menu is extensive and also gave some great recommendations.
Love this place! This is THE place to come if you're looking for an authentic Japanese food in Las Vegas.

Sitting here, unable to move from how awesome this meal was .... So good!   Oysters, sashimi, yakisoba, beef tongue, beef tataki... When you go out with your boss & the team after a good quarter ... you get to order whatever you want :)!

Food is pretty good. Prices are decent. Service was friendly but somewhat slow. Serving sizes are a bit on the smallish side. Didn't like how they made their onigiris with a mold rater than by hand.
