Plus, it was on the dry side. But overall, a decent place for izakaya style Japanese food. Note: closed on Sundays.
LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!The best place in Vegas!!! Love everything here. Clean, friendly, Food is fantastic! We go here almost every week sometime twice a week.
Amazing foood!! Fresh fish all day! Good happy hour specials and friendly service! Literally so good were only half way thru our plates and i had to make this review

I've been eating here since it opened and not sure why I didn't give it a review sooner. If you enjoy Japanese tapas aka "Izakaya" you have found the spot. Look no further, this place offers some of the best Izakaya in town!

Excellent Japanese Restaurant in Vegas. Delicious tapas and other finger food. Generous portions. A little pricey (4 boys-$115) but we liked most of the things we ordered. DEFINITELY coming back here next time I'm back in Vegas

Love this place! Their Happy hour menu is pretty good! Not very big, small and the service was great.  They have a Japanese style table where you take your shoes off and sit on the floor w a low table. It was pretty cool. They also have tables and a few booths. The booths only fit 4, the tables fit 4, unless you put them together. The food was great! The appetizers were very savoring and affordable. Their ramen is delicious...it's all about the broth! Would definitely come back!
Great happy hours deal ( started 10pm). Great food, I love their variety of tapas. Friendly server.

Chill spot in Chinatown, LV. They were able to accommodate same day reservations for a group of 10. 

The menu is extensive with lots of tapas, izakaya, and veggie friendly options. 

Tako wasa here is a great beer companion. It's relatively cheaper than prices in LA so was thoroughly happy to try a bunch of things with our big party and still not have to fork over a pretty penny.

The only good part of the experience was the POKE BURRITO & the UNI PASTA. and the constant checking.
Got seated at exactly 8:03pm and didnt get greeted by the server for at least 5 minutes -_- (yup! we had to wait 5 minutes to get asked what we want to drink)
So upon ordering, since the place is new, the server wasnt really knowledgeable of the menu .. 
dont get me wrong, SHE WAS SUPER NICE.  

So our food took SOOOO LONG. we got 4 dishes and waited 40 minutes for everything to get delivered, in addition to that, one of the order was wrong..  (they had 6 tables) & the only good thing was that she frequently checked on us. Although when it was time for the check, we had to ask like 3 times for her to bring it.  

Dont order the sashimi bowl. Im suspecting that was what made our stomachs hurt. We love japanese cuisine and we could tell by the first bite that the fish were not fresh at all.. this place need some work.
OVERALL:
food - 3 stars
Service - 3 stars
WAIT TIME - zero starsss !!

Came in around 5:30/6 on a Friday night with a couple of friends. The place was pretty empty so we were seated right away. The restaurant is a little small so I felt squished at our table. I felt claustrophobic. Lol 

I think they have 2 different menus? One is the regular one & the other one is for specials, I believe. I ordered takoyaki and a poke bowl. My bf had the tuna belly steak with a side of rice. The takoyaki was delicious. This was my favorite dish of the night! The poke bowl came with miso soup. Miso soup was alright, nothing special. I didn't care for the poke bowl. It didn't really taste fresh & i couldn't finish the whole thing. I had a bite of the tuna belly steak and that was pretty good! 

If you check in, you can redeem a free scoop of ice cream! You have two options: vanilla and green tea. I had the green tea and it was good! Service was also pretty good. Though I thought she gave us a glare when we wanted to retrieve our free scoops of ice cream lol. I'll probably come back for the takoyaki but never order the poke bowl again haha.

Fantastic izakaya. Everything we got was amazing. Favorite things being the chicken meatballs and the miso salmon bowl. The Hakushika sake was the perfect accompaniment to all my dishes. Can't wait to go back!
There are too many plates to choose from. There are about 3-4 menus, but the food is delicious.
Our go to late night resto when we are in Las Vegas. This is the place, I always bring my friends who are visiting from other country.  I know they will not disappoint me. Reasonably priced too.

It was obviously greater restaurant than others. I was here with my business partner during CES in January and had authentic Japanese food as if I were in Japan. Nice  and quick service.  I would return if have next chance to be in LV.

The ambiance is very traditional Japanese. The ikura and the salmon meat are very fresh. I am very particular with the taste of green tea ice cream if its too strong I don't like it but their matcha ice cream is really. Highly recommended for Japanese food. Will surely be back.
Great food - ramen and various Yaki (grilled) dishes!! Service was great. Felt like we were back in Japan.
Very good place for dinning with friends. Takoyaki os the best order. Don't forget to order yellowtail collar which is only in secret menu.
Place is small but appetizers are awesome. Ramen was OK for me. I've had better Ramen at other place...
Forget all my other reccomendations... Come here at 10pm. Order tuna belly, blu fin toro roll, spicy tuna roll, 2-3 other order if your choice from specialty menu, with beer. Text n let me know....

By farrrrrr my favorite izakaya in Vegas.... Yet. Go during hh and you'll get some great deals on food and drinks. Uni sushi was always fresh when I went here so that's a must! I also love the fact that they had tako wasa. This place hits the spot when I have a craving for that. Otherwise... I have to give it up to Tajima in San Diego for the best tako wasa. Uni pasta was decent. Very filling! They give you good portions here. They have combo dinners that's always a good option if you want a bit of everything. They get pretty busy at night but if you're in a party of 2 the wait isn't that long at all. This place does accommodate large parties though so it's a good place to grab drinks with a group of friends. For the yakitori, I recommend getting beef tongue, bacon wrapped asparagus, and chicken heart! If you like foie gras you'll love chicken heart. Not sure if they have fatty chicken heart but for you foie gras lovers out there, get the fatty heart if they have it.

Tried this place on late night on a weekday.
I was trying to make a list of the things that would fast good since the menu has like 1000000 things.  I was very very happy with every dish that i ordered.
The beed tongue and Pork cheek skewers were amazing.  I actually went back the next day just to order the Uni Pasta again.  That plate melts in your mouth and is absolutely 100% one of the best dishes I have ever had.  
I highly recommend this place. All dishes are made fast and the quality is very high.
My tempura combo was yummy. So full now. Definitely coming back next time. Waiting for my dessert now

Incredibly fresh and amazing quality! Ordered the Chu Toro sashimi, which was a steal at $13.95, and it was the BEST buttery tasting piece of raw fish I'd ever had!  Was so delicious ended up ordering 2 more orders.  Also had the Amberjack Sashimi and the quality was on point.  I'm a big fan of Naked Fish because of the quality, but Izakaya Go had fish just as fresh and high quality at a fraction of the price.
Firefly Squid- YUM! tiny itty bitty baby squid served raw with a miso sauce.. To die for.. So amazingly fresh!
Poke bowl had high quality tuna, Ramen Burger was savory, the pork cooked to tender perfection.  Seriously considered ordering extra noodle "buns" to take home with me to snack on later.  
Huge menu selection, lots to choose from for everyone, had so many intriguing items.  
Owner himself took the initial order, staff super friendly and accommodating, great atmosphere, comfy seating.  Honestly wish I found this place earlier.  Been going to Ichiza for years but will definitely make the switch to Izakaya Go for Japanese tapas!  
Recommend that you go now while they're still in their initial stages of opening- this place WILL have a wait once people start realizing what a great little restaurant this is.
Great place for late night and off strip.  Happy Hour menu is great.  The poke California roll is delicious
I love this restaurant!!!! Great prices, awesome food and the staff is wonderful. Open 24 hours with fresh food always available. Definitely a 'must try' in Vegas!!!!

Really loved this place! Was just driving around trying to figure out what to eat and found it on yelp so why not give it a try. Very cute restaurant. I love the atmosphere of the place the staff was very friendly. Overall great service. My brother and I asked for no spicy ramen but when they brought it out It was spicy, the lady noticed right away but let us try it first (it was pretty spicy, at least for us it was) she changed it for a non spicy, took an extra 5min or less. The food was AMAZING. [See pictures] I definitely want to come back with some friends. Oh and the prices are well worth it.

What can I say about Izakaya Go? 

First off, Go is amazing! He's always playing some Rastafarian music and yet, it feels really authentic in there. Go is seriously one of those owners you just have to appreciate. He works hard as an owner and as a server, etc. I've been here so many times, its ridiculous why I haven't checked in every time on here. At one point I made it to go here every week. Hell, sometimes when I leave and they greet you "goodbye" I yell back "I'll see you guys tomorrow!" And to no surprise, I do come in again the next couple days. HAH! I've told many many people about this place and every single one who has tried Izakaya has loved it!  

I have too many pictures from this place that I can't post everything just yet. As a tip though, study that menu! There is so much on there that its hard to choose. 

So as far as the staff goes, they all work really hard. I love how they all interact and check up on you constantly. They do get busy from time to time to where its hard to get their attention, but it's really not too bad. Also, the ambiance is quite lovely. I love the feeling I get in there. It's so calm and everyone's in their own zone. 

Now, on to the food!

Ok, they have amazing food. 
I'm not going to get to all the things I've ordered, but none of them have let me down. I promise!
