Etc etc etc... 

Oh, and don't forget the drinks! They have all types too. 
I suggest coming in from 10pm until close because that's when Happy Hour happens. 
Also, check in to get that free scoop of ice cream!

Drove here specifically for their happy hour menu from 10 pm - close. My friends have been raving about this place, so I finally tried it with them and I gotta be honest and say that my experience was mediocre. The food was alright, but the customer service would probably be 2 out of 5 stars. So, for my first time, only 3 stars at best.

The happy hour for food and drinks are pretty generous - lots of variety for it just being a happy hour menu. We got the half ramen, curry rice w/ added chicken cutlet, pork dumplings, California roll, and the seasoned french fries. The half ramen, for the happy hour price of $5, was awesome. I'd come back and get this again. The curry rice + chicken cutlet was decent - they got the flavor right, which IMO is most important, but the serving size is tiny (even with the HH prices, there's an additional cost to add the chicken so I expected a bit more). Everything else we ordered was okay, no complaints.

The customer service needs some work. It was a Friday night, and unexpectedly not as busy relative to other places in Chinatown, yet our server took 15 mins to take our waters, then 20 mins for our actual orders. She also ended up messing up our orders (giving us someone else's order so we had to wait more to get our actual order), and giving me back a different credit card back... not a good first impression.

Overall, a decent experience. I'd come back again for the food and drinks.

The reviews do not lie! 
This place is a gem. 
Food A+
Service A+
Overall Value A+

If your staying on the strip and are tired of overpriced food that under-delivers go here.

Do not be swayed by any alternative, as there are many restaurants in the area.

This place has great menu with very fresh sashimi and incredible ramen poke.
Great ambience, good get away from vegas strip, cozy atmostphere, tasty tapas, yummy sake and green tea mochi dessert.... we loved the experience and the tapas were awesome

I'm shocked at the high ratings this place got...it really was just ok.

Food: we ordered a lot. Grilled mackerel was a bit overdone and tasted dry as a result. The calamari was extremely oily. Our vegetarian friend got squid flakes in her salad (funny but a big no-no). Enoki butter was good. The stir fried udon and grilled squid were delicious. Pork karaage also came out late. It was also dry and room temperature.

Service: Waitstaff was sweet but simply no where to be found. One of our dishes also came out as we were getting ready to leave.

We were hoping for another great experience venturing off the strip, but this was just an average place.
Very friendly place with a simple twist on the decor. Food was great, with the right balance of flavors. Will diffently return.

Oishikatta! I'm Japanese and I thought it was really authentic and affordable. Standard izakaya fare done well. We had karaage, chawan mushi, fried rice, hamachi roll, yaki udon, poke burrito, ramen, and a ume onigiri :) they also have combination plates with stuff like teriyaki chicken so your friend who isn't an adventurous eater and/or can't appreciate good food has something to eat. (You might want to reconsider that friendship though.) wish I lived here so I can try more of their stuff.

I always enjoy coming here. The service is good, they have all sorts of options, and happy hour is every night. I usually go for the combination dinners with an order of sashimi. Those never disappoint. On this recent visit, I decided to try my first ramen burger. I was looking forward to the runny yolk but my egg ended up being fully cooked, bummer! The ramen part was too bland, however, the filling was delicious and flavorful. In conclusion, ramen burgers aren't for me. I just don't want none unless you got buns hun! I'll be back though.

Best place for happy hour. 10 pm is when it starts. 3dollar large sake and 6 dollar pitcher beer. Food is just amazing. Haven't tried anything yet that I haven't liked. First time I tried it just got me hooked. Like to drink and eat with friends here expecially  to start us off for the night. Great servers. Make sure you try reserve a table if your going with a group.

I love this place.  I didn't think sashimi could be this good in a non-coastal city.  Lots of sashimi choices, including oh-toro.  The salmon was wild and fatty (not the orange farmed stuff).  The aji was perfect.  The yellowtail left me licking my lips to capture all of the buttery fatness.  The unagi was more tender than usual, which lent to more emphasis on the flavor, rather than texture (and the flavor was exceptional).

Sashimi aside, the sunomono, especially the ume and the kyuuri were full of pop.

The kalbi ribs were ok.  Probably a little too much char.

The yakitori were all above average, especially the chicken liver and the pork cheek.

I'll be back.  Probably tonight.

This place is one of my favorites! I feel like it's one of Vegas' best kept secrets but everyone should know how amazing it is! Staff is friendly and attentive! Food is amazing. Since its tapas you can try a bunch of different things. I love trying new dishes. Some favorites are enoki butter, pumpkin croquettes, fried squid legs, onigiri. There's too many to list. This is definitely a regular spot for me and my friends!

My coworker and I were planning on going to a restaurant in the same shopping center and saw this place had newly opened and decided to try something new. The menu is pretty interesting and I am interested in going back later and trying one of their burgers. I wasn't in a burger mood this time so I tried a one of the combination platters with grilled salmon teriyaki. I can be a salmon snob so the first bite is everything. If I get the hint of fishiness it is going back. But, I was super happy to note that there was not a hint of fishiness. For 9.95 the Combo plates are massive and have a lot of food, could not even come close to eating it all. In the end it was very good. My coworker got the curry and enjoyed it. In order to get a five star review a place has to really wow me, and this place did not. But it was very good and we will return.

Delicious food! So many options it can be over whelming. Have tried several different items on the 4 different menus and never been dissapointed. Service is always great no matter how busy they are. Great selection of alcohol. You could go to this place every day for months straight and not get the same items. The dinner plate deals are amazing deals very cheap for a ton of food.

This is probably one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas! I was surprised because it is always so busy!!!! Such great prices and awesome menu items. All of the staff here are so nice and very attentive.
We ordered the poke sushi burrito which was sooooo amazing, the ramen which had amazing chashu, egg, and seaweed! I didn't really like the noodles but everything about the ramen was perfect. 

The skewers are definitely a must get. We got the chicken liver which was cooked to perfection, asparagus with bacon, tuna belly, and corn. Everything tasted amazing and our food was awesome!! We were surprised at the end of our bill because everything was priced so perfectly.

I will definitely be back!
This place can get quite packed and has limited seating but it is by far the best izakaya place in Vegas.

I thought that this place was alright, and thought that they had a very extensive Japanese menu and has quite low prices (especially for the combinations). However, the fish quality was pretty low and I was not especially impressed with the food. I would not return, but if you're looking for a cheap eat, I would suggest this place!

Stopped by as first stop on way to check in to hotel...I wanted to adore this place so much...but could not...it just wasn't as good as I wanted it to be...I was excited by the reviews and pics but the food was not as good as the pics appeared...we started with great sake called karatamba...super dry and tasty...also had the sparking sake which everyone always loves. Then had the beef tongue which was tasty but not amazing...then had some crab tempura...they put a leaf in there that overwhelmed the crab taste...not sure why they would do that but tempura was very well done...but overall taste did not hit the spot at all...then had the whole sea robin which was tasty...then had the scallop bbq which was good but not great...the chicken cartilage which was pretty good!! The omakase 4 item dish was good value with Japanese shrimp and toro and wayugu beef but it still was not great...then had the uni with egg and that was fantastic!!! Ended with grilled squid which was served mildly cold...it was soft and tender but not outstanding. So maybe my standards are high from eating in LA so much but this definitely did not live up to the hype or rating on yelp. 3.5 stars overall...cannot say I will come back unfortunately!!

Had to entertain some cool people while in Vegas for business, so I decided to take them out for drinks and Japanese style tapas at Izakaya Go.  What a cool name!  When we arrived, the initial response was "I feel like we're back in Torrance."  I didn't know what to think or say, but once we all sat down and started with the beers, I knew it was going to be a nice evening!

Located off of the strip, this drinking spot looks like it attracts more locals than "others."  This is fine with me since a $4 beer off the strip tastes better than a $12 beer on the strip - especially when you're buying!

Izakaya Go isn't a huge place, but it's not a hole-in-the-wall by any means.  Decorated nicely.  Music was a bit weird but after the third pitcher, the music started sounding all the same.

Food was better-than-good.  We had a few beginner sushi eaters with us and the Uni Shumai was a hit or miss.  Spicy Tuna Rolls, Yakitori, Kim Chee, Tako Yaki, Noodles .. I think we ordered plenty for all to share.  Beer kept coming and the conversation kept flowing.  For a while, you almost forgot that we were in Vegas.  Consensus agreed.

Food and drinks were good.  Service on point.  Plenty of parking.  Highly recommend.

Enjoy!

Place is small but cozy. Definitely like the privacy you have with your own party. It's decorated in a unique way and I really like the reggae choice of music. Staff is phenomenal- my water was immediately filled every single time. Bar is well stocked. Food is unreal. Everyone walked out satisfied, however apologies I cannot recall the names of the dishes. Definitely recommend making reservations if more than a party of 4. I recommend the udon shrimp tempura soup!

Food was delicious! Every dish we ordered was enjoyed! I especially liked their agedashi tofu. Crunchy on the outside and super soft on the inside. Every dish was served piping hot to us and food promptly came out. We did arrive early for dinner so got nice attentive service from the wait staff and the fellow who was possibly the manager. It's a small restaurant so may not be good for really big groups. Will be back again when we visit Las Vegas next time...

We came here on a weeknight for dinner after my daughter's kumon hour. This place is nice and was not crowded on this night. The food was pretty good and service was efficient.  Forgot all the things we ordered but the Kara-age chicken stood out and was really good (well seasoned) as was the sashimi bowl (fresh), mixed tempura was also quite good but the vegetables needed more cooking time. We also ordered Yaki-soba but it was not cooked well either, the noodles kind of clumped together, not easily separated and we did not care for the sauce used.  Overall, not a bad place for food and drinks with an attentive wait staff.

Everything we tried was super yummy and fresh!  There are so many different things to choose from between BBQ skewers, sushi, ramen, and appetizers. 
The ramen is amazing , and the fish just melted in my mouth. 

** I recommend slowly ordering a few items at a time if you are a slow eater like I am, that way the food doesn't get cold. They are super fast at dishing out items hot off the grill!

Definitely coming back again when I visit Vegas!

For all the great reviews thanks for the recommendation to a very poor restaurant half our food was cold/ frozen not fresh. The service was at best poor. One item came out still frozen and left on the bill and then the waiter spilled my beer in my lap. Wait,10 minutes later offered me another which by that time a declined. Will never return and will be sure everyone I know stays away. Overpriced and overrated. Stay away!!!!!!

All around great experience. Very warm and welcoming environment. Good service. Excellent dishes. Well crafted and thought out menu. Pork cheeks, wagyu carpaccio, scallop skewers, and fresh uni go well with semi-dry saki. The owner/chef walks the floor and is very friendly and humble. Fun and tasty joint. Check it out. Be here. Eat here.

Went in here with my Son and had Sushi. When we got in we were seated right away. the place was busy but it seemed like a lot of people were just getting finished and new ones coming in. 

We ordered and got our beer right away. the sushi came out quick to. Let me tell you this place has good sushi that tastes fresh. I get all my sushi with Soy paper so you can taste the fish and not how seaweed tastes. We got 3 rolls total and each one was different and great! 

The price here is good for what you get. the service was good to! Way to go! All in all this is a really good place to stop for sushi! I would recommend this place to all the sushi lovers!!!

The aesthetic, atmosphere, food and staff here give this place a good reputation. If it looks crowded don't hesitate to wait, it's usually not that long. 

What I order:
Buta kakun 5/5 very generous portion. It's not a dry pork belly, its kind of in a sauce but its sooo goood!

Ramen Burger 3/5 Picture worthy yes. Mouth worthy? You can try it out yourself.

Dinner plates (back menu) 4/5 Crazy good portions for the price! 

Sushi burrito poke 3/5 

Ramen shoyu 2/5 Definitely had bettter ramen but it's decent to get during happy hour.


Pro tip: 10pm-close is happy hour! Don't miss out their selection is huge.

I found this place on Yelp recently when I was in Vegas with my boyfriend. After watching a show, we got hungry, well I wasnt hungry but he was and so I suggest that we should go to Izakaya and grab something light. This place had the best review and it was the closest.

I really liked how small this place was. Thats because if its too bug, it gets too loud and I cant even hear myself talking. That bothers me a lot. Like Hondaya in LA, I have to scream to talk to friends and I can barely hear what theyre saying so, who enjoys that right?

Their menu was very extensive like many other Izakayas. I know yakitori/skewers are people's favorite but we skipped all that and just ordered a few dishes that caught our attention. When I go to Izakaya, I always start with Takowasa. I dont know why but thats just my thing. I love raw food and so Takowasa is just raw octopus smothered in light wasabi. Its very good and you cant never go wrong with this!

Then we started ordering other dishes and one of them was Uni Chawanmushi. Its a very delicate egg dish. Its steamed egg eith some shitake mushroom tooped with uni. It was really soft and flavor was wonderful. Though I dont eat Shitake mushroom, its flavor wasnt too strong so I was able to eat them fine. But I let boyfriend eat the mushroom itself, haha.

Second dish we ordered was what, Zaru Soba? Haha, I love soba and I thought it was a better choice than Uni Pasta or other noodle dishes they had on the menu. It was a small portion but enough to share with the boyfriend. We ended up asking for another dipping sauce so it was easier for us to eat it on our own dipping bowl.

Boyfriend ordered the House Fried Rice. It was very good. It's one of those fried rice you cant really dislike. Just egg and scallion - - thats all you needed to have that great flavor. I really enjoyed it but I can make this home better, hehe.

I think thats all I had that night. We were pretty full from eating them because before the show, we pigged out at a buffet like crazy! It was good food with good ambiance. Price was just right and service was pretty good in general except when they brought out zaru soba, they gave us an empty dipping bowl. I told them it was empty and they couldnt believe it as if I was lying. Why would I lie about that?! 

All in all, food was great and I would probably frequent this place if I lived here. Will come again with friends next time I visit Vegas!
I did a to go order of the salmon ikura and just from that I can say that it seemed very fresh and price was affordable. I will definitely be coming back for all the other goodness on the menu.

This is a small sushi/tapas place with a lot of menu choices. Went here with a couple friends and ordered a lot from the skewer tapas menu and some from the regular menu. The beef tongue was actually pretty tender as was the spicy chicken wings, although not that spicy. Quail eggs wrapped in bacon, also pretty solid. The clams with garlic butter had some good flavor, blue crab avocado salad was decent for a crab salad. The food was simple for the most part, had good flavor but not incredible. Overall 4/5

OK, so Izakaya Go is a go!!  Sorry, couldn't resist. Every time I suggested to my husband to try here, he always opted for Hachi. But this time, he relented and boy am I glad he did. We went on a Wed. night, about 5PM and parking was an issue. The only spots that were open were the 30 min. ones, so we picked one right in front where we could keep an eye on it in case security was checking for violations. 

Foodwise, everything was great. Hachi does have a leg up on the chicken skins, because Hachi's is like a chip.. a big fried crispy chicken-y thing of beauty, about the size of a wonton wrapper. Izakaya Go's was.. different, grilled on a stick. The other item was the chicken karaage. The husband liked the IG's version because of the batter (really crispy). I like Hachi's better because while I did like the crispy batter, it was quite salty. 

The standout for me was the clams in garlic/butter broth. I drank the broth. Straight up. It was that good. Either the manager or the owner of the place saw me and said he was glad I liked it.

Price-wise, it was very reasonable, on par with Hachi. We're looking forward to going back and trying more stuff!

Izakaya Go (Pronounced "Is-A-ka-ya") is located in the same plaza right next to Krung Siam in Chinatown. I was lucky enough to have dinner here on Grand opening night even though it was packed and busy. The first thing you notice once you step inside is how well decorated the restaurant is. It just feels very welcoming and comfortable. The menu (sitting on the wall on strips of wood written in Japanese) brings a nostalgic feeling in me as I lived in Japan for almost 3 years.

Once seated on our table. We proceeded to order a vast variety of appetizers and entrees. Izakaya Go specializes in small dishes called tapas similar to what Ichiza offers. We started off with the Miso soup and Edamame (the staple starters in Japanese meals) the Miso soup tasted great and was authentic and the Edamame was a good snack. Then came the Kara Age "KAH-rah-AH-geh" which is a Japanese style fried chicken. It is traditionally marinated in soy sauce, ginger, and garlic. I would highly recommend the Kara Age here as it was a perfect balance between flavor, texture and richness.

We ordered the Crunch roll, California roll, Spicy tuna roll, Spicy tuna crackers, Tempura Platter, and Chicken Yakisoba. Everyone loved every dish that came out of the kitchen. The Chicken Yakisoba was one of the best versions of Yakisoba I've ever had. The quality of food is what I would expect as the head chef here has over 20 years experience as a chef from Kyoto Japan.

If you're in the mood for Japanese food, don't hesitate to give Izakaya Go a try. Once they acquire their liquor license (in process), they will be open late as well.

The overall service was excellent. The dishes came out really quick, though the portions were small in my opinion. I'd recommend pork belly, sasami wasabi medium rare and fatty tuna skewed. They are really good!
Love this place for late night sushi!  Great vibe!  The food is on point and very reasonably priced.  The staff attentive and friendly.  My go to!
Very good food here. Right time for 1 year anniversary from Izakaya Go. Come and join there delicious food in China Town. Japanese Restaurant style.

This place is so tasty. My parents and I came here because my mom was craving ramen at night 11pm (very odd, yes). But we ended up here and ordered from the happy hour menu, which has a lot of variety and options. 

The service was outstanding and the waiters are all good looking too! We also got our food in a timely manner, and it tasted so good. So much flavor! 

We loved this place so much, we returned here again before my parents went home the next day. And surprisingly, one of the waiters remembered us and welcomed us back haha. Overall, yummy yummy Japanese food!
Great atmosphere, feels like you're in Tokyo, creative menu not seen anywhere else! Ahi Poke Salad was the most delicious salad I've ever had and I'll go back again next time I'm in Vegas.

If you are looking for a home far from your home, you can come here to feel warm welcoming hospitality by people working here and its food. 
Nothing to do with Teppanyaki, they serve Sashimi and Sushi truly based on seasons and a "real" grilled chicken, Yakitiri that you can experience authentic Nippon!! Also, you can enjoy Sapporo draft beer from tap in order to refresh the heat in Las Vegas. 

???????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????????

Good service and friendly staff.
The tocoyaki & deep fried squid were really good. I've tried soyu ramen and the broth were very tasty!

Items Selected:
Matcha Green Tea
Takoyaki
Hamachi kama
Unagi bowl
Salmon skin salad
Miso Soup
Battera
Agedashi tofu
Chicken Karaage
Tuna Belly Steak
Chawan Mushi
Mushroom Zosui porridge
Ten zaru soba with tempura
Tororo Udon with grated mountain yam

Located just off Spring Mountain Road, cattycorner to Kuma Snow Cream, it was as part of a group of seven that a baker's dozen plates were ordered amidst the cozy confines of Izakaya Go and although palates I trust have recently offered the freshly opened space high commendations, our experience would prove to be just short of a disaster - the sort of meal that left one wondering how anyone could find such a place palatable, let alone worthy of praise.

Admittedly jam-packed, each seat in the house filled at the time of a 7:30 arrival, it was with advanced reservations that the group squeezed into a makeshift table best appointed for six, and with Izzy and Katie playing a bit too loudly from behind the bar a large menu was surveyed as water and hot tea were filled freely - the restaurant fresh out of green, but offering matcha or black over ice at $2.50 per glass.

Optimizing orders so as to cover a large swath of Izakaya Go's offerings it would not be long before first plates arrive and with creamy balls of fried octopus beneath bonito setting an extremely high bar it was unfortunate that no other plate would even come close to the quality of those tender fried orbs - least of all the grilled collar of tuna that was essentially charred dry leaving one to wonder whether the kitchen possessed any skill or integrity at all.

Essentially ruining a unagi bowl by burying the eel under too sweet a sauce over dried out rice one could say that the crispy salmon skin atop greens mixed with more bonito was the star of round two and with two small bowls of miso soup no better or worse than any other the box-sushi battera was additionally quite good, the savory smack of mackerel finding balance in vinegar and shiso, both.

Admittedly impressed by lightly fried agedashi tofu in more of the miso broth, but less so by fried chicken that was nearly as much batter as bird, it was onward to par-for-the-course egg custard that the meal progressed and with the previously forgotten tuna belly arriving with texture similar to the collar at the meal's beginning a single bite was more than enough for most - nearly half of the $12 order remaining on the table at meal's end.

Rounding out the evening in three bowls, the soba literally flavorless even when dipped in dressing while tempura served alongside was fairly competent and entirely full of grease, it was only at the meals end that both the mushroom porridge and hot udon topped with sticky yam would approach the level of the Takoyaki, but at this point bored with belabored service and annoyed by so much mediocrity all one really wanted to do was 'go.'

Perhaps suffering from high praise begetting a full house, maybe besmirched by a grill burning too hot, or - and I hope not - possibly deeming our table expendable as we were the only Caucasians in house the only real positive of dinner at Izakaya Go was the friends involved and $30/pp price - nothing save for the Takoyaki better than can be found elsewhere on Spring Mountain without the pop music, sub-par service, or overall lack of quality control.
Great place to enjoy authentic kushiyaki. Reminds me of Japan,  $ is very reasonable for the great quality of ingredients. Thank you Chef Go I got to meet him he is a laid back dude.

A hidden gem in Chinatown.

Environment: The restaurant itself is located almost in a hidden location in the back of a plaza near the main Chinatown center. It can be a little hard to find, and the restaurant itself is not too big. However inside they make use of their small allotment of space and have booths, tables, sushi bar seating, as well as a large middle area which could be used for big parties. Additionally, the decorations and lighting make the restaurant fun and cozy.

Food: Their menu is very expensive and ranges from sushi and sashimi to kushiyaki. We could try carpaccio, skewers, oysters, rolls, and much more. The sashimi was very fresh and the oysters were delicious. Additionally, we tried chicken heart skewers which were surprisingly good as well.

Service: Service was good as well, with our server being sure to stop by periodically throughout our meal to check up on us and ask if we would like to place anymore orders (which we usually did).

Overall Izakaya Go is comparable to my favorite Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas, Ichiza, and I see myself coming back to dine here again.

Was just craving some takoyaki and they were 6 pieces! And reasonable size. very good. Slow service... but the food was alright. Order from this piece of paper and they missed like 3 items XD that I had marked then charged it in the bill later. Then gave our takoyaki to some people who came in after us. Two tables near us got great service and got their food before us but they both came in after we were seated.

I heard about this restaurant from a client, so when I went to Las Vegas, I had to try it.  I also took a friend who lives in Las Vegas.  We were both extremely impressed with the extensive menu and asked for recommendations from the wait staff.  We both had the tempura shrimp and veggies.  Since this was our first time, the chef brought us a few samples and they were wonderful and was a great prelude to the meal.  When our dinner came, the presentation was excellent, but  I was not ready for the fresh, delectable taste of the tempura.  I have never tasted anything so light and tender as this dish.  The choice of veggies was excellent and different.  Even sweet potato dipped in tempura batter and fried to perfection.  My friend also had the miso soup and he said it was the best he had ever eaten.  I am just salivating writing this and will definitely go back again and again.  You need to try this restaurant!!!!  If you are visiting Las Vegas, seek it out, and if you live there, make it one of your regulars!!!!  You won't be sorry!!!!

Great late night happy hour after 10pm-close  multiple selections on the menu priced right! Best things were the salmon tar tar which is like a deconstructed salmon/California roll, tasted great! The tuna belly was delicious ! It's a huge tuna steak for only 4 bucks! The curry rice with steak and chicken katsu! Great taste and a great price! Will be back again!

When my family decides where to go for dinner, I get worried it'll turn out to be a cheat meal. I reviewed the menu very carefully before going to dinner with them. They have veggies, salads, proteins and grilled items.

This is located in Chinatown. We got seated right away and I noticed one of the Japanese diners who runs a Japanese restaurant in town.

Deep Fried Soft Shell Crab:
Served with ponzu sauce. The batter was light. 4/5

Gindara:
Grilled miso black cod. Light, mildly sweet, smokey fish that simply melts in your mouth. If you like simplistic dishes, this is for you. 5/5

Beef Tataki:
Tender slices of beef sashimi served with ponzu sauce, salad and roasted garlic on top. 5/5

Sashimi Salad:
Spring mix with hamachi, tuna, salmon, whitefish and shrimp with ponzu garlic dressing and spicy mayo. Perfectly dressed. Protein to greens ratio was just right. 4/5

Salmon Skin Salad:
Greens, salmon skin, bonito flakes and yuzu dressing. They were generous with the salmon skin. The salmon skin looked super crispy but it was not quite the case. 4/5

Sea Urchin Dumpling:
Out of the dishes we've tried, this one was the most disappointing. Steamed wonton with what seems to be egg inside with a bit of uni on top. The flavor and texture were weird. 1/5

Sea Urchin Sashimi on Wooden Tray:
From Santa Barbara, CA, this tray of beauty and perfection is served with nori, wasabi and special soy sauce. Very fresh and buttery texture. 5/5

Uni Pasta:
You may have had the same dish from a Japanese trattoria a few blocks away.  I think this version is better. Pasta in very creamy sauce, uni floating on top and nori shreds. 5/5

Ikamaru:
Grilled squid served with Japanese mayo. Slightly chewy. 3.5/5

Grilled Tuna Belly Steak:
It's nice to have a casual restaurant that serves this. I love this stuff. Flakey, tender and smokey fish that you dip in ponzu. 4.5/5

The prices aren't bad. Apps and entrees anywhere around $4-15. The service was very good. I think everything we've had so far have been delicious except for the uni dumpling.

I think I found my place!
I accidentally found this new restaurant, but I'm in love!

They have the deep chicken cartilage which sounds gross, but in Japan this dish is super popular to go along with some alcohol. 

There are many popular AUTHENTIC Japanese tapas at this restaurant which I am excited for! There are tons of knock off Japanese dishes at other "Japanese" restaurants in Vegas, but this place is the way to go. 

The decor and the set up of this restaurant is pretty cool too. Old school Japanese Izakaya environment forsureee. 

They said they haven't got the liquor license yet, but I'm thrilled to see how this business will turn out like! I hope not TOO busy so I can enjoy my dinner here and there from now on ;)

This place is so fantastic. Great atmosphere. Huge menu. Everything is amazing. Love tapas style dining. Try the Uni pasta, amazing. Giant clam was fantastic. Crispy Pork Belly was so good. Poke is another solid choice.

Izakaya Go is a secret gem Japanese restaurant. It's tucked away in the South East corner of Spring Mountain and Valley View. They offer traditional Japanese cuisine as well as sushi. Some of my favorite items on the menu other than sashimi is the Beef Tataki, Rock Shrimp, Truffled Butter Corn, Sushi Burrito, Tuna Poke with Chips, Miso Marinated Salmon Bowl, Sautéed Mushrooms, Halibut Carpaccio, Salmon and Hamachi Kama, Salmon Carpaccio with Truffle oil, Toro and lastly the Wagyu Beef Sushi  !!!!
They have a full bar and are open really late which is a huge bonus for night owls like me. The crowd is always fun and interject this place is a must try.

This place is amazing! Food is great, atmosphere is great, and not too loud. 
Its like I'm in an actual izakaya in Japan.
The only thing this place is different from popular izakayas in Japan is that you can't smoke cigarettes indoors(of course), everything else is top notch!
I went with a couple friends and had a great time with tasty food and ice cold beers. 
Now this is how a izakaya should be!

The place closes at 3:00 am one of the best things to have in Vegas.  Our friend recommended this place to us her cousin is the owner.

It was a good recommendation since we were able to get there around 12:00 am.  The place was pretty busy considering how late it was.  I was surprised to find a happy hour menu.  We ordered from the happy hour menu.  There was three of us and we only spent 50.00.

We got s special hamburger steak Japanese style.  It was beef and pork patty it was thick about an inch and very juicy.  It looked like a loco moco but the gravy was different it tasted like they put Worcester sauce in it not the brown gravy that you get in Hawaii. It was not served with rice just carrots and potatoes.  This is yummy yum yum!

The spicy tuna rolls were yummy yum it didn't look like tuna color more like salmon but it was delicious. We also got the poke California rolls.  Then we also got the curry with pork tonkatsu, this was yummy.  

We got the fried tofu and it was not as crispy as I had before but the taste was sweet and savory.  They put a lot of seaweed shavings and it was what made it delicious.  

We got the pork ramen with miso soup.  It was not too spicy as requests.  The noodles were pretty chewy.  The soup had a taste of sake or something like that.  I didn't like it as much since I don't like alcohol. 

The service was pretty good and they turn the lights for if you are celebrating a birthday.  They play a happy birthday song.  Reminded me of days when we w.rook our kids to Farrell ice cream.

Really liked this place. Service was very good. The food was fresh and well prepared. I had some sushi, grilled fish, eggplant and seaweed/cucumber salad. Everything was excellent. Nice beer and sake selection as well. Will be back next time in Vegas!

Cute little restaurant to stop by if you're looking for an affordable meal in Las Vegas. My boyfriend had the salmon combo meal. I opted for a poke bowl. Their miso soup is so good! The combo meals are a great deal. There's plenty of dishes in each combo. The poke bowl just came with rice and some seaweed. Wish it came with some veggies.
I am madly in love with with this location. I highly suggest this location. #nomnomnom The food here is delicious. Love this atmosphere.

I have lived in Japan and this Izakaya is legitimate. The owner/head chef is from Osaka and really recreates an authentic izakaya. There is even a tatami/deep table area where you have to take your shoes off.

The food was amazing here. I loved the uni pasta, screaming orgasm and all of the fish here. I went with a friend who normally does not like fried rice but he said that the cha-han (fried rice) was really good here. 

Great ume-shu and cocktails here. I have been here twice now and it is awesome. I recommend making reservations because it does get crowded.
You won't regret eating here! They are very friendly & their food is delicious! I'd travel across America just to eat here again. Till next time Las Vegas & IZAKAYA!

I can't say enough about this great place. The service is incredible! And the food is amazing. Check out they happy hour menu. 

A chill style ambiance. Perfect for date night or birthday celebrations. And the music is always just right! I recommend the izakaya house rice and the tuna belly. My favorite are the fresh fish selection. Their drink selection is plentiful. 

Their happy hour is a great price and never too long of a wait to be seated. I've been coming here for over two years now and it only gets better.

A little piece of home when I am here. Servers are attentive & fast, and the food is so authentic & delicious! 
Definitely a must for me while I'm here in Vegas!
Great food along with great service.  The place is a little tight but you won't be disappointed.  We will definitely go back.

By far my favorite casual Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas....hands down....so many items, great pricing, great food.

What I have ordered:

Ramen Burger - Instagrammable as fuck...better than most "Ramen Burgers" i've had and they have slabs of pork belly in the middle instead of a burger patty like most places.

Gindara - One of my favorites with that fatty, buttery, sweet flavor of the Alaskan Cod. Fire.

Okonomiyaki - not the best i've had like the now dead Gottsui in LA (RIP) but respectable enough to get it every single time i'm there....

Omakase Delicacies - 3 small tastings of 3 different delicacies for the adventurous mothafuckas...all i can say is that two are ok but the shark cartilage...fuck that...

Miso Marinated Salmon Bowl - another item we basically get every damn time...fire

Deep Fried Soft Shell Crab - not a fan of soft shell crab because of the texture of basically feeling like you chewing on your nails...

Spicy Fried Rice w/ Jidori Chicken - it's a given, if you fuck up fried rice you def should not have a restaurant...again another item we order almost every time....

Tuna Belly Steak - Good fat portion however lacking flavor and would rather eat most seafood raw....

Skewers - Great selection and flavor

Curry Rice & Beef Steak - Not the best curry in town but the best steak that is paired with curry for sure...especially for the price for happy hour...

Karaage - I grew up on this style of fried chicken...not the best but good enough to satisfy my craving for it...

Dango - Dessert mochi balls that are fire...

Yuzu Cheesecake - subtle yuzu flavor...

I know there is a lot more items we have ordered just can't remember them all...

Highly recommend if you fuck with Ichiza cause between the two you can't go wrong....

Came with my wife to eat late at night and even though had never been here, we wanted to see how good of a place it was. Our server was not only patient, he took the time with us and explained to us what each menu consisted of, he was awesome!Great service, food was delicious and we even got a free ice cream with checking in!

One of the best sushi and tapas dishes in town.  I love the Tonkatsu ramen.  It was so good.  We went on Sunday night which I usually think the fish isn't fresh however it was very good.  It was my first time there and i was impressed.  i would definitely come back when I am in town again.

Been here multiple times and every time I visit I find something delicious. My favorite dish is the takoyaki. The enoki butter, jalapeno poppers and the rock oysters are also delicous. They have a huge huge menu so you'll find something to enjoy like I have multiple times. Service is also great.
The service is great, just be prepared for a louder atmosphere, super friendly staff, good food.

Quality of food is fine. 
got oyster that is still frozen
portion is not really match the price!

Not a fan of raw sushi. Pointing that out now. Came here on a whim after babe and I found a restaurant.com certificate for $10 off. Wasn't too thrilled at the wait (about 30min), but for a small joint and absolutely no one in the mood to rush, I wasn't allowed to be too irritated. Servers checked on us constantly and updated us on times. Got seated in a cute booth that looked utterly uncomfortable, but funny enough, was the opposite. 

Our fat asses ordered a slew of plates: albacore roll (all his), crunchy roll, rice porridge, chicken teriyaki combo, and a ramen burger. I'm not sure I've ever had such flavorful chicken teri in my life, but this was a bomb in my mouth. The sauce in the ramen burger tied in how flavorful the meat was--which was a pleasant surprise considering my expectations of the thing were low. 

My only problem was one of our servers. He had a lack of energy when taking our orders and asking questions that it dented my experience. Never a fan of lazy service. The other servers were great and helpful so I s'pose it sort of made up for it. 4 stars to food. Definitely coming back when closer to happy hour.

All the servers work as a team, and are very service oriented. Our server, Travis, was outstanding! He was very knowledgeable about the menu and made great suggestions. He was also very pleasant, and attentive. Thanks, Travis!
Owner was nice and showed us some of his prized dishes. Lots of variety and a korean dive bar atmosphere. I would come back and try some other dishes

loved this place. had a bunch of recommendations and was really satisfied with halibut rolls, crunchy cracker appetizers, shoyu ramen, and thee best mochi ice cream i've ever had (red bean and sesame seed)

I like this place for their large menu and reasonable prices. I've usually ordered off of their daily specials and most popular sections. A couple of my favorites are their Takoyaki (fried octopus balls) and Okonomiyaki (Osaka pancakes). The first time trying their ramen burger I thought it was great. But the next few times trying it I actually didn't think it was that good. The ramen noodles on the burger tend to be a little tough and hard to eat. I liked their mushroom porridge, it has a good flavor but nothing too out of the ordinary. The service is great and staff very friendly. However, I have mixed feelings about the taste and quality of their food so it's usually not my go-to place for Japanese tapas. But I like the fact that they stay open pretty late, so I'd definitely stop by for a midnight snack.

I came here based on the 4.5 star yelp review. Ordered 8 plates and the Toro had lining which was tough to chew and the sweet shrimp was not even fresh, I could go on and on. The only decent dish was the grilled pork belly. I will NOT be coming back. Only reason for one star was the service, but the food was far from good.
Amazing selection of unusual sashimi specials! It's a hidden gem slightly off the strip!

Best sushi in Las Vegas period bar none. My wife and are both sushi snobs. We were introduced to this place by our Tokyo native friend Hideyo and we were blown away. 
The restaurant is located in a strip mall in China Town don't let that fool you. The decor is in line with casual Japanese restaurants on Tokyo. 
The food.
We ordered the Horse Mackerel $19.50. It's essentially sashimi. They slice the fish into site size pieces and use the bones and head to dress up the plate. When you are done with the dish they deep fry the bones and you can eat them. Very nice and crunchy. 
Omakase Nigiri $65. We were serves 12 pieces in total. Everything seem to be freshly caught that afternoon (even though it wasn't)
Tuna Belly (Toro) was flown in from Turkey (600lbs tuna). Super buttery.
Sea Urchin (Uni) flown in from Santa Barbara. We were served proper size pieces not those wafer thin pieces you get at other places. Thus we were able to fully experience the subtle flavors.
Sorry got to go now!!!!!

Excellent food and I never comment on service, but all the servers were not just experienced and attentive, but genuinely friendly. 

The tonkatsu ramen is a MUST. I rarely order ramen outside of a ramen restaurant, but this was labeled as a "staff favorite" and it was SOOO good. Good even compared to LA ramen. 

Their happy hours specials are great as well.

We ordered several cut rolls, a hand roll, skewers and the ramen. Left stuffed. Will definitely return again when in Vegas.
Food was just ok - friendly staff, loud and drunk customers. Good atmosphere if that's your thing.

Awesome little place that offers a lot of variety like sushi, ramen, yakitori, and Japanese tapas. We always come here if we want more than just sushi. The food is flavorful especially the skewered meats and veggies. Great service from the staff.

Kinda tucked away in the middle of Asian (Spring) Mountain area of Las Vegas. This place was definitely a gem !!

Parking is kinda limited, but was not to bad. I can imagine it being very crowded and hard to find parking during peak hours like lunch and dinner. 

Also, there is not many seats, so waiting is inevitable. Lucky for us, we caught them on slow day during a weeknight and got seated right away. 

Waitors running everywhere! its great that you can pull one of the waitors so that you can either order something, get more drinks, or simply asking a question. 

Portions were pretty good being an Izakaya place. Becareful though because these dishes stacks up and before you know it, youre racking up a hefty bill. 

Music was all over the place. From EDM to Hip Hop to Rock Classics! I didnt mind at all. 

Simple guy like me, i really enjoyed the house salad. Simple cabbage and sesame ginger dressing. Great substitute for rice !!

Don't forget to check in on yelp and get your free ice cream !! 

I recommend the uni pasta, soft shell crab, and of course the seasoned cabbage !!

Enjoy !

Food is pretty consistent here. I love the o toro, here. Very fresh, and moderately priced . Skewers are a must, can't go wrong with any of their skewers. Spicy tuna with crispy rice was generously prepared with a mountain of spicy tuna. Overall, love the food and definitely always a go to option late night.

Stopped in here looking for a variety of Japanese food to satisfy some Asian cravings. Service was lacking in at tentativeness and timing, needed time to review the extensive menus and they stopped multiple times then but once we had had a chance or needed refills on beverages the waitresses were really hard to 'find'.   Our party of 4 in the end was satisfied and full from our variety of selections lots of yakatori options and a few set meals.  I will say that this is the first place in Vegas I have found/had Japanese potato salad and it was so awesome to see that small scoop on the set meal plate.  Thankfully a friend and my other half who ordered the sets let me indulge; missing small slices of ham and a bit more salt but it sent me to the Asian market to get some Kewpie mayo to make one of my favorites :) We will continue to search out our 3rd Japanese place since we've been here the last two have gone out of business, perhaps they should have had higher all be it reasonable prices like this place and they would still be round; but we wouldn't object to coming back at some point.

Izakaya is the place to GO ! Food and staff are superb. Their menu is quite huge and always gets me on what to get Becuase of the majority of selections. Such a tiny restaurant and they do get very busy. I ordered their popular dish of Uni pasta which had so many pieces of uni in it. 

Also ordered the Tuna belly steak for happy hour which was a lot with a side of rice. My girlfriend ordered the Slamon dinner combo which came with so many side dishes for only $11. 

Everything was great and the staff took great care of their customers. Will come back for my late night cravings since they close really late Til 3am on weekends.

Delicious, everything is good.  I've been back over 20 times and yet, I've only ordered from a third of the menu, it's that good.  And I've actually ordered that much is because the owner and waitress actually pushed me to try new stuff.  When the food is so consistent that you do not want to "experiment", we have all been to those restaurants.  This isn't one of those.  

Actually, one little caution, ramen is ok, there are specialty shops in town if you are into ramen.  Then again, I don't have to tell you not to go to an izakaya and order ramen.  That's like going to a Pho place and order rice.  Go with their specialties, izakaya, grilled, fried little dishes.
Great place!!! Prices are very affordable and service is super fast! I love this place and would recommend it over any non-AYCE sushi place in town!

This place is the business. They have such good deals on their happy hour menu. I got a table worth of food with my friend and multiple drinks for only $15 per person at the end. Although their happy hour menu is limited to those items, you can still order from the regular menu if you're really craving something. Also, the Japanese decor of this restaurant is awesome. I really felt like I was in a little village hut while I was in there. Finally, they're open until 2am! I literally didn't show up for dinner until 10 and hung out til they closed. This place is a gem.

First review on my Yelp since my other account isn't usable anymore. So I thought to make my first one on a restaurant that I consider my favorite as of right now. 

I have been dining at this restaurant for about 3 months now and I come at least once or twice every week with my best friend. The atmosphere makes me feel like I'm at home and the staff is very friendly. What makes me happy is that some of the staff remembers our faces and makes us feel so welcome whenever we come in. 

As far as food goes it takes a while to look at all the menus they give you, but a handful of items are my favorite out of any Japanese restaurant in town. 
Pork cheek with scallion: $6.25 and the dish I get the most. You get several of slices of meat for such a low price! Fatty, crunchy on the outside, and the lean parts are just as tasty. 
Beef tongue skewer: $2.75. my favorite out of the skewer list they give you. Very juicy and they pack the meat onto one skewer. 
Enoki butter: $4.95. Enoki mushrooms drowned in warm butter. They give you a lot for less than $5 and goes hand in hand with the items I listed above!
Salmon/yellowtail sashimi: both less than $6 and they give you 5 pieces for each fish. Fresh fish and decent sizes. 

Service, food, atmosphere, everything about this place is amazing and that's why it is my favorite restaurant in Vegas so far! Also, if you check in on Facebook you get a free scoop of ice cream! I still have yet to try a lot of things on the menu but I highly recommend everything above!

Favorite spots in Vegas during the night after coming out off work late and not feeling to cook.
They are fast on service fast on food can't complain and the best part all my favorite cravings is right there too

Came here after seeing absinthe. 10pm hh begins, and it's awesome! Everything we ordered was excellent! Poke burrito, truffle edamame, urchin dumplings, and sushi rolls... Can't wait to come back the next time we're in Vegas!
Excellent service, great food, great prices!! It was my first time in Vegas and from all the places I ate this was so good that I had to go twice durin my vacation!!! Highly recommended!!!

Came with 4, spent $160 :O

Vast selection and authentic.
Typical izakaya are far more reasonable.
Hawaiian music was a strange combo.
One piece of salmon I had in the carpaccio was messed up. Not sure what it was but had to spit it out. Tasted very stale so didn't want to risk it.

WOW! Talk about food-gasms! Tucked away in the far left corner of chinatown, this restaurant is a hidden gem among the many asian establishments on Spring Mountain Road. It seems like they have everything here in terms of Japanese cuisine! What initially attracted me to this restaurant is that their menu is very unique. I can promise you that you won't find many of the dishes here at other establishments. Prices are affordable and realistically reflect the quality/quantity of food that you are getting. I love the authentic atmosphere of the restaurant. It feels almost like you just walked into a restaurant in Japan! The entire staff are very courteous and polite which only adds to the restaurant's ambience. I must have seen the waiters/chefs bow their heads seven or eight times to other guests throughout my entire meal. I also love how they have a large dining area in the center of the restaurant where there are no chairs available and guests dine by kneeling on cushions laid on the floor (just like in Japan!). My brother and I were feeling adventurous tonight so these are what we ordered:
1. Sea urchin dumpling: Fish cake with some sea urchin on top, wrapped into a dumpling; steamed. Creamy. Tastes great with their signature soy sauce. My only complaint with this dish, of course, is: it could use more sea urchin.
2. Chutoro: Simply fresh & delicious. A bit fatty but much leaner than otoro. 
3. Ocean trout sashimi: Reminds me of salmon, tastes like salmon...but it is not salmon. 
4. Ankimo Ponzu (steamed monkfish liver with ponzu sauce): Light, creamy, a bit salty. Not as earthy as you'd expect from your regular liver. 
5. Beef Tataki (beef sashimi with ponzu sauce): This dish was a bit disappointing because we were expecting raw beef but instead we got over-seared meat. Still good, but could be better. Make sure you let your server know that you're expecting sashimi style.
6. Tako Wasa (raw octopus marinated with wasabi): This dish surprised me! The spiciness of the wasabi really enhanced the flavor of the octopus. It is not as slimy as I expected (which is only a good thing). 
7. Sea urchin sashimi on wooden tray: Don't let the picture fool you, there's not THAT much sea urchin because the sea urchin are thinly sliced. It is definitely the go-to dish if you need a little sea urchin fix. Sweet & creamy in flavor.
8. Vanilla ice cream: We got it for free by checking in to Facebook.  Definitely the best vanilla ice cream that I've ever had. No joke. Rich & creamy, reminds me of Haagen Dazs ice cream, except much... much better.
What a great find!   They have all my favorites.   Unni dumpling was new for me.  Definitely worth trying.   Just wished they had regular hour happy hour.   It doesn't start till 10pm.

Delicious, cool decor, awesome service. Our waitress was overworked (her coworker had called out, she said) but diligent and helpful.  And the food was really, really good-- reasonably priced, especially for the quality.
Get the takoyaki (octopus balls) and the mussels for the best twists on seafood you've ever had.
The waiting time for this place wasn't great but wasn't bad either. Food was okay, and the waiter was kinda quiet. Kinda got a hippy vibe from the music. Overall pretty cool.

First and foremost SERVICE could be better, our drinks was never REFILLED even went we ordered several different times from 2 different server!!! 

Second all the house sauce is horrible, I just simply had better sauces in different restaurant! 

Third all our food tasted bland  We ordered the Soft Shell Crab (Sauce no good and Small), Tuna Belly Skewer (Sauce OK), Black Pork Sausage (No good), Izakaya Go's Fried Rice (No taste BLAND), Fish and Chips (Just ok BLAND), Pork Gyoza (Just OK) and lastly they ran out ice cream flavors only Vanilla (Just OK) and Green Tea (taste like medicine) available. With that said we won't be back glad we didn't ordered too much food. THE ONLY GOOD IS Restaurant atmoshepere is GREAT!

As far as tapas goes this is a good place for those who enjoy small food. The quality of the food we had was fine. Our group ordered a bit of everything so we were able to sample a variety of the dishes. Again, the food tasted fine but the only thing I did not understand was why all the vegetables we ordered came out last, at least 45 minutes after we ordered. This was on a Friday night and it wasn't that busy. Anyways, be ready to eat elsewhere after leaving this place.

This place is expensive but if you enjoy Shabu Shabu, it would be a great place to go.  My British and American friend didn't enjoy it as much since they aren't into soup at all but their appetizers are great so they got full on that.  With great baked Mussles, chicken skewer, and gyoza to start.

Excellent choice for Izakaya in Vegas
open late

We are all so picky living in this town where the restaurants have to be on cutting edge for us to appreciate them. Well - this place is such a pleasant surprise!! The vegetables hat are part of every dish we ordered were cooked to perfection, seasoned perfectly, the fish was fresh and the rolls were different, creative, spiced and prepared perfectly. Nice job - my family of foodies was impressed. Can't wait to go back!

Three dishes to review:

bluefin sushi: fresh, solid cut. Very tasty, would get again. 4/5

grilled scallops: nice flavor, reasonably priced. 4/5

Uni risotto: the most distinct dish of the bunch, with a nice flavor. Would've liked a little more uni, but it is an enjoyable dish that I would reorder. It is also quite filling. 4/5

So, a nice 4/5 across the board experience. I imagine they can get very busy.

I been to this location a few times. The beef tongue is great at reasonable price. The oyster is very fresh.
The fish is also fresh..will come back again and again...

We have found our go to Izakaya in Vegas!  Don't miss this place sitting in a corner of a strip mall hidden behind another just south of Spring Mountain.  Once you find it, you won't regret it.  Love that it's bustling with crowd, servers are efficient although dishes come quite slowly, and the food is favorable to Ichiza.  Battera was better than Ichiza although not as good as Yu-Yu's, and I found other items to be fresh and quite good.  While I only had a hot sake, they have a good choice of bottled sakes to choose from.  Be prepared to shell out some $ for those though...

Table-for-1 Factor:  It's an izakaya, so I don't think you'll want to sit here alone.  But they do have bar seats.

Yayyyy!!! Had dinner here tonight. 
Having Japan withdrawals I've been on this Japanese kick.
I ordered the sashimi bowl, mom my ordered the katsu dinner and we both had a side order of shrimp tempura. We got seated in a booth right away... Order was taken promptly... Everything seem like it was going great until my moms order came out and mines seemed to have a major lag... Not to sure why when I had a sashimi bowl which is faster to make then a combination plate. My mom was almost done with her dinner... Still no sashimi bowl. The owner seen I looked distressed and came to our table. I told him that I was upset about my food not coming out.... He apologized... And about 10 mins later my bowl and our tempura came out. Food was great. Only thing that upset me was the timing of my food coming out late. The owner Go was nice to send over takoyaki... Which I thought was very sweet of him. He came over to check on us and we ended up talking up about all things Japan. The takoyaki here taste just like takoyaki in Osaka. I will be back! Arigato Go! It was nice to meet you! I'll be back. I'm a fan! -miss yelp 2015 (Mariko) P.S. Check in on FB to get free ice cream! Oishii!!

Everything we've eaten here so far are really good. Love grilled corn!  Miso soup is awesome. They have happy hour from 10pm to close. You can get half ramen with Happy hour. Really good ramen!! If you ask to make it spicy it will be spicy level of Thai dishes. This place is the real izakaya style that you will find in Japan.

Excellent! After recently traveling to Japan, we have been seeking out new Japanese restaurants in town. This place is great. The owner knows his fish and personally did a wonderful job guiding us through the menu.

Not too much to say other than I was not impressed.  In a city where ramen is so prevalent, you really need to step up your game. This restaurant was listed on top ramen houses of eater in vegas. I've tried many and this one was just not that good.  I went for their famous happy hour. The menu is limited and my server didn't really know enough to influence me. I explained it was my first time there. They do a happy hour half bowl of ramen, but it's also a half portion. 

The flavors of my tonkotsu was off.  The chicken karaage was ok. The pork gyoza was so so as well.   

I usually try a restaurant a second time, but here in vegas where there is such an abundance of pho, ramen, soba and more, I'm off to th next noodle shop.

After seeing many delicious pictures and hearing great things about this place from my friends, a group of us decided to try it. When we entered, we were immediately greeted by one of the staff members and quickly gave us a table. I love the decor and the atmosphere of this place, a traditional feel as you might say. The restaurant is a little small so it packs up pretty quickly as well. 

What we ordered : 
My group of friends and I always have to order a hot sake after a long day. So we ordered the house hot sake. It was stronger than usual, but that's always good! Haha. Ended up ordering two large ones. We always say that hot sake is a warm hug to your body. 

Spicy tuna crunch was really, really, really good. I'm a sucker for crispy rice with tuna. The spicy sauce on it enhanced the flavor a lot more. The tuna and crispy rice ratio, very good. 

The chicken karaage with mayo sauce was pretty good. Boneless and crisp to perfection. Very good  with the mayo sauce and squeezed lemon on the chicken. 

The oysters were full of flavor. The sauce they put on the oysters completely blended well together. Only thing I didn't like about it was the oysters were a little too small for the price we paid for. 

Ahi poke rice bowl was ordered by one of my friends. The rice bowl was a decent size. It could definitely fill you up. A good amount of poke in the bowl as well. The poke was completely fresh. Definitely melts in your mouth. Also comes with a side of tasty miso soup! 

Super go crunch burrito was AMAZING. Consisted of imitation crab, shrimp tempura, and a few greens with avocado wrapped in seaweed goodness.  The portion of this is no larger than a chipotle burrito, but bigger than Taco Bell burrito as the waitress described it which was true lol. 

Ramen burger was good too. Wanted to try it because there are barely any places that serve ramen burgers. Another reason why I wanted to try this place out. It was VERY filling due to the ramen noodles on top of it. The meat was very juicy and tender, full of flavor. To top it all off, the over easy egg with it. Just the yolk dripping down the burger.. Yolkgasm for real! The ramen noodles also had some sort of flavor to it too. So delicious. It also comes with a side of seasoned fries. 

My overall experience with this restaurant? Definitely one of my favorite spots. A lot of variety and choices to choose from their menu. The service was vey good. They were very patient and helpful with our food order since there were so many to choose from! Will DEFINITELY come back to this place to try a lot more! Thank you izakaya go staff for the wonderful first experience!
This is my spot. Friendly and nice stuff with good service. Open late. Lots different food.

Ramen was decent. The highlight was tuna belly. My husband's teriyaki chicken average. Soft shell shrimp had a weird bitter taste in my opinion. Atmosphere was really cool, server was friendly. Maybe we didn't order the right things but this place was just ok.

I think this shop is for the first time. We enjoyed a midnight snack in the four and a sister and a brother subordinates. My home country is Japan. This shop was the shop of Japan meal to enjoy as it is. I was very happy (^ ^) you also try by all means try.
This is a really good Japanese tapas restaurant. We ordered the beef tataki, soft shell crab, tuna rice cake, poke burrito, and uni shooters. All these dishes were flavorful. I will be back for more.
A late night Vegas run ended here.  My fiancee had fried fish, shrimp tempura and salad with octopus.  I had a couple of rolls.  Everything was good.
most amazing japanese restaurant!!!!! absolutely outstanding, freshest, customer service, just everything is amazing!!!!!!!
Izakaya is where you want to go when you want good company, great food and owners that care. I travel often and can't wait to come back again.

This place is awesome, the octopus is some of the best I have ever had and it was not a one time thing. We had uni, octopus, jellyfish, beef tataki, and a bunch of other items off the menu and everything was extremely fresh and prices were great. Their menu is awesome, lots of small portions so you can have all kinds of stuff rather than filling up on one item. Had a great time will be back again and again. Highly recommend.
This place is awesome !!! Great place to eat good food!!! And more selection to choose!!!

Authentic food , good prices.  Staff very friendly , and they speak Japanese if needed.  You can reserve the big table if you call ahead with a big party.  I had a good time with my group, I can't think of anything I got that I didn't like.

It was an interesting visit. The only down side is the seating is small and when you order for seconds, sometimes the food doesn't go through and you have to wait a little longer. I was a little annoyed on our last visit because we had ordered a lot & the waiter responded " just to let you know, you already ordered a lot ". That was a rude comment to make. Overall the food is good.

2015 is undoubtedly gonna be the year of Battle Izakaya (Las Vegas edition).

But seriously, the quality and execution of the dinner items I tried overall was superior to that other established Izakaya restaurant down the street.  The price point is also more consumer friendly.

The lunch menu was okay. But I didn't get to try the ramen noodles, which from the pictures look like they too are on point. 

The Ramen Burger that I ordered was a bit of a mess to eat, but I managed to keep my hands clean by donning a pair of latex gloves. However, the big pieces of raw green onions should be grilled or left out entirely. The fried egg with the runny yolk center enhanced the burger. The seasoned fries was pretty good, but I normally skip the fries (I try to save those calories for other stuff like matcha cheesecake or Thai Iced Tea).

The Poki "Burrito" was decent. The portion is bigger then your typical sushi rolls, and instead of tortilla a sheet of nori seaweed with rice help contained all the ingredients in an easy & no mess format ideal for on the go consumption.

Their GO Curry menu is good too. I ordered it with Pork Cutlet, and the curry was good but with maybe just a 1 on the spiciness scale.  I have not asked, if there is an option to make it spicier for those that are into the burning mouth game.

For dinner, we ordered the Teriyaki Chicken Plate, which I thought was a great value and was delicious. My fav Asian friend gave her thumbs up approval.  In spite of initial hesitation, she also enjoyed the Grilled Miso Marinated Alaskan Black Cod. 

The Chicken Kara-Age was decent, as well as the Geso (Baby Octopus) Tempura. But the star of the evening was the Uni Chawan Mushi. Seriously good.

Service was good, especially considering that they have just barely opened.  But I have not been there yet when the restaurant was packed and the servers are truly tested.

Overall,4.5 stars!
The Ramen Burger is great.  Menu is huge but the other stuff I had was just ok-good, nothing stood out.  It was also on the pricey side for relatively small portions.

Coming from Denver, this place is definitely more unique. This has more of an ambiance much like what you would get in Japan: hole in the wall, hard to find, but damn oh so good.
We had my friend with us who never ventured past a California roll. He was willing to try something way outside the box and this place delivered with full stomachs and happy faces.
As soon as you walk in you know and feel like this is the real deal. The loud conversations from other patrons will right away tell you that what they are eating and drinking has a positive impact in their mouths and they are enjoying each and every bite. This place is small so if you have a large group, be ready to wait. Smaller groups tend to he seated quicker. 
I will try to remember all that we ordered: garlic lemon gizzards, pork belly, tuna belly, cow tongue, spider roll, dragon roll, Unagi roll, sashimi 5fish plate, and Uni. My favorite was the Uni but the rest comes in a close 2nd. Everything we ordered was made to perfection and there was nothing we could complain about. This restaurant made my friend a sushi fan and more than ever willing to try more exotic dishes.  
Next time We are back here we will definitely come back. But we will be ordering  different things on the menu. Only to explore other items that we anticipate will only gratify our pallets.

I always try to come here whenever I'm in Vegas. Super close to the strip, good food, and a great mix of traditional and more adventurous plates. The staff is always friendly and I have yet to be disappointed!!!

By the way, the truffle butter corn is to die for.

So glad we tried the food here. Our favorite was the whole fish sashimi, after you eat the sashimi they deep fried the rest, to die for!!! The soft shell shrimps and soft shell crabs were delicious. The blue crab salad was also tasty. I don't recommend the chicken items we had the chicken karaage and chicken yakatori they were both over cooked and dry.
Just opened! I ordered the shoyu ramen and it was great. Was able to eat it several things off the menu even though im allergic to seafood. Excellent service and very reasonable prices. Must try!

I love this place! It was located right next to our house in Las Vegas and we liked to go there after 10pm- it's a happy hour!!! Even without it it's very good price for this quality, food is very good and fresh!

We are a group for 4 and we ordered a lot of food. Love the omasake, Jao, our server was very nice and attentive. I will definitely come back to bring my so who also loves Japanese food. 
Check in to get free ice cream.

Delicious meal! First time here, in from LA, enjoyed every bit. I got the tororo udon and it was great. It's a simple dish, but they prepared and cooked everything perfectly. We also got the ten zaru soba. The tempura was extraordinary! It was so crispy and even when dipped in the sauce had a perfect crunch when eaten! They were very accommodating and helped us get extra tororo (grated yam) for the ten zaru soba. Great service as well. Never had to ask for a refill or call them to get their attention. Excellent! Will be back when we come to Las Vegas next time!

We had some really good dishes here.  There was pork belly, so there's that!  We tried shark cartilage, jelly fish and monkfish liver.  It was beautifully presented, but the shark shreds were a bit....hard core for us. We had some sushi and sashimi as well.  It was fresh, sweet and beautiful.  Definitely on the repeat list when we go back to Vegas.
Cool restaurant with awesome food. I had a chance to talk to the owner while I waited for my food. I was there solo and he make feel very comfortable and shared about his restaurant. Two thumbs up!!!
I just adore this little restaurant. Fresh Uni!!!! One of my favorite restaurant in Vegas.

Location: parking was bad. 
Service: the lady forgot my order couple times. They didn't come around the tables that much. 
Food: Yakitori was really bad. I have never been to a yakitori place as bad as this place. The meat quality was bad and the taste was awful. The miso soup was meh. All of other food we ordered were meh.
People who gave this place 3 stars or more should go out and try REAL Japanese food. 
Never come back!!!

This is by far my favorite joint in the Spring Mountain vicinity!!

Let me start by saying you can can get just about anything Japanese that your heart desires. With everything from spicy ramen to octopus carpaccio and everything else in between, the menu is very extensive and never dissapoints! Our go to is pretty much everything off the grill. The okra, mushrooms, scallops wrapped in bacon, pork cheek, beef tongue and korubuta sausage are just a few of our favorites and are always cooked to perfection. 

Another plus, they are open late! However, they do get pretty busy, no matter the time of the day... so call in advance and make a reservation and head on in.
Fantastic food! I'm visiting from Honolulu and found this fabulous izakaya... and I know good places in Honolulu, this is as good as it gets!  Better yet with the service!  A must go!
